loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
A. Mary is a fishmonger. She is a single parent and has 5 dependents. She buys fresh fish from fishermen, processes and then sells the fish to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

She is asking for $625 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. is a fishmonger. She is married and has two children. She purchases fresh fish from  fishermen, brings it home for processing and then later sells the fish to local costumers. She wants to increase her inventory to meet the demand of her customers and would like a loan to purchase more fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi T., 47 years old, is a kindergarten teacher at their town's school. As a teacher, her main source of income is quite stable but not enough to provide for her family. In 2003, she decided to join TYM and invested in breeding cattle for her first loan. After the next few cycle, she had money to repair all the pigsty as well as buying more foodstuff. She had three grown up children, all have had their own jobs and own places. The previous years, her husband was construction worker so he also have a very stable income but now as his health is declining, he decided to stay home and help Mrs. T. out with all of this. She would love to borrowed 15 million VND to repair their cages and buy more breed-cows. Their monthly income: 3.5 millions VND

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Thơm năm nay 47 tuổi hiện là giáo viên mầm non của xã. Là giáo viên nên chị Thơm cũng có thu nhập ổn định từ việc nuôi dạy trẻ nhưng thu nhập đó không đủ để chi tiêu trong gia đình. Năm2003 chị Thơm quyết định tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư thêm vào công việc chăn nuôi tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Qua các vòng vốn vay chị đã đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại, mua thêm giống để chăn nuôi nhờ đó thu nhập của gia đình chị đã tăng lên đáng kể. Anh chị có 3 con đã trưởng thành, có công ăn việc làm ổn định hàng tháng đều có thể hỗ trợ thêm cho bố mẹ . Những năm trước chồng chị làm công nhân xây dựng, đến nay vì lý do sức khỏe chồng chị Thơm đã nghỉ làm và ở nhà hỗ trợ thêm cho chị trong việc chăn nuôi.. Anh chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại mua thêm bò về nuôi. Thu nhập 3.500.000/ tháng

loans.use: Raising and growing

loans.name: Caroline Walele's Moven Pick Group

texts.en:
Caroline W., age 48, is a widow with two children (ages 20 and 17). She sells second-hand clothes from door to door. She began this business 6 months ago. She works whenever she is ready to move or is called by customers to bring them the clothes and she is able to make a monthly profit of around $109.

Caroline hopes to take a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She will share this loan with her loan group Moven Pick, which totals 19 members. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Caroline is in the middle of the first row.

loans.use: Buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes K. is married with three children (ages 16, 14, and 10). She has had a business selling food since 2002. She works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$ 43.

In the past, Agnes has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business capital. She hopes for a new loan to continue to grow her business. Agnes will share this loan with her subgroup members selling clothes, cosmetics, and fruits and vegetables.

In the picture, Agnes is the tallest, second from right.

loans.use: to grow her business

loans.name: Samira's Mungu Tusaidie Group

texts.en:
Samira is 32 years old, married, and has four children, 1, 7, 9 and 15 years old. Since 2005, Samira has been earning income selling juice and eggs. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., making a monthly profit of about US$30.

Samira now needs a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock of goods. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Warda.

loans.use: Purchase of additional food items for sale

loans.name: Berlin

texts.es: Berlín quien tiene 30 años, es padre de 2 hijos maravillosos que le incentivan a salir adelante, vive junto a su pareja, quien lo apoya en todo sus decisiones y está de acuerdo con sus metas trazadas.  Desde hace 6 años, trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros por diferentes lugares  de Pucallpa, es propietario de un motocarro, en el cual solo trabaja por horas, ya que también se dedica a la venta de artefactos eléctricos para el hogar. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque así conoce muchos lugares.   Trabaja duro, ya que quiere brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos que estudian y son su razón de ser, como también velar por los gastos familiares.  Desea comprar repuestos para la reparación de su motocarro, en el futuro quiere alquilar un local para su negocio de venta de artefactos.
texts.en:
Berlín is 30 years old, father of 2 marvelous children who are his incentive to be successful. He lives with his wife who supports him in all his decisions and is in agreement with his goals. For 6 years he has worked transporting passengers to different places in Pucallpa as owner of a motorcar, which he works alone for hours. He also sells home electronics. He likes his work a lot because he gets to know many places. He works hard as he wants to provide his children with everything they need and they are his reason for being, and he also takes care of his family’s expenses. He wishes to buy parts to repair his motorcar. In the future he wants to rent a locale for his business selling electronics.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts to repair his motorcar

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mr. Chin C. is a 34-year-old rice farmer who occasionally also buys beans wholesale to resell to people who live in his area. His wife, Mrs. Pock Yem, is 35 years old and makes a living by farming and raising pigs. They live in Speu Commune, Kompong Cham Province and have four children, all of whom attend school. Chin needs a $1,000 loan to buy more beans to store and resell, and also to buy food for the family's pigs. The loan will increase their income and allow them to buy more food for their children.

loans.use: to buy more beans to store and resell

loans.name: Ajoke

texts.en: Ajoke is 45 years old and married with four children. She makes a living sell kerosene to customers who visit her small shop. She has been in this business for a long time, and is a LAPO client. Ajoke says that the small amount of capital she been able to borrow from LAPO Microfinance has increased her business in recent years, and she would like to increase it even more. To make this possible, she is applying for a loan to buy more kerosene to sell. She is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Paula Hirma

texts.es:
La señora Paula es socia del Banco Comunal “Vítor Echave” del distrito,  provincia y departamento de Puno. Es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos menores de edad a los que mantiene económicamente. 
Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.500, compró artículos usados para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal. 
Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más artículos usados para venderlos en su puesto y así aumentar sus ganancias.
Paula desea seguir trabajando para que sus hijos continúen sus estudios y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the 'Vitor Echave' Community Bank in the district, province and department of Puno. She lives with her partner and is the mother of 3 young children. With her first loan of S/. 500 she bought used goods to sell in her stall. She has worked with the community bank for almost 3 years. With this loan of S/. 500 to be repaid in 4 instalments she will buy more used goods to sell in her stall and in this way increase her earnings. Paula hopes to continue working so her children can continue with their studies and pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase used goods

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Абдурахмонов Алишер житель района Рудаки. Живет  вместе со своей матерью. Занимается бизнесом на рынке "Сомон". Торгует уже около 10 лет фруктами. Кредит планирует получить для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Вложение дополнительных средств поможет ему увеличить бизнес.
texts.en:
Alisher A. resides in the district of Rudaki. He lives with his mother and has a business at the Somon market, where for the past ten years he has sold fruit. He would like to take out a loan to increase his turnover, and will be able to repay the loan within 12 months. The investment of these additional funds will help him to increase business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Kanlévi

texts.fr: D. Kanlévi est une veuve avec quatre enfants qu’elle élève seule. C’est une femme très dynamique qui s’est lancée très tôt dans le commerce de céréales depuis son jeune âge pour survivre car n’ayant pas de qualification professionnelle. Jouant le rôle de père et mère à la fois, elle n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Souffrant du manque de moyens financiers pour élever son activité à un niveau qui lui permettrait de subvenir aux besoins d’éducation de ses enfants, elle sollicite ce crédit pour multiplier son chiffre d’affaires et faire plus de bénéfice qui lui permettra de rembourser son crédit et améliorer la situation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kanlévi D. is a widow with four children she is raising by herself. She is a very energetic woman who, at a very young age and due to having no professional qualifications, got started in the commerce of grain in order to survive. In the simultaneous role of both father and mother, she isn’t able to provide for her children. Suffering from a lack of financial means for enhancing her business to a level that would allow her children an education, she is requesting this loan. She could then increase her sales figures and make more profit. This will enable her to repay her loan and to improve her children’s situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and sell grain

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36 year old Nana K. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of 14 and 18 years old. Nana has been running a shop since 2007. Our client’s business is to sell common items from her shop such as wheat flour, salt, biscuits and cooking oil. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Nana currently earns about 120USD from her business. 
She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase salts, wheat flour, biscuits and cooking oil. In the future, she plans to expand her business. 
Nana thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase salts, wheat flour, biscuits and cooking oil

loans.name: Apu Curi - Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal denominado “APU CURI - QUIQUIJANA”; proviene del respeto a los cerros y montañas de la región, para los antiguos inkas los Apus, eran las representaciones de deidades superiores como el padre, quien abraza y protege a la comunidad.

Los socios de este banco son naturales del distrito de quiquijana, una zona muy bonita y rica en productos, ellos tiene entre sus actividades caceras, las de, agricultores (papa, maíz, alcachofas, habas, verduras, trigo, cebada, flores, duraznos, choclos), y la crianza de alpacas, llamas, ovinos, ganados en general, aves de corral, y dos socios tiene su tienda de abarrotes, muchos de ellos venden productos secos, que son los granos que producen sus tierras. Nuestros nuevos socios, requieren el préstamo para poder invertir en su capital de trabajo y mejorar sus ganancias.

Los socios de este banco están muy agradecidos y valoran el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen en cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago en el plazo y fechas programadas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “ APU CURI - QUIQUIJANA ”; it comes from the respect given to the hills and mountains of the region, for the ancient inkas the Apus. They were the representations of top deities like the father, who embraces and protects to the community. The partners of this bank are natives of the district of Quiquijana, a very nice area and rich in products. The partners besides their home activities they are farmers (potatoes, corn, artichokes, beans, vegetables, wheat, barley, flowers, peaches, sweet corn), and they also breed alpacas, llamas, sheep, poultry. Two of the partners have grocery stores. A lot of them sell dry products, which are the grains product of their land. Our new partners need a loan to be able to have a working capital and improve their profits. The partners of this bank are very grateful and value the granted loans and promise to repay in the stipulated terms and dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of sheep, cattle, dry products, groceries and fruits.

loans.name: Tope

texts.en: Tope is 32 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs. She started her business in 2006. She hopes to obtain a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more food items to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-ol S., 30, and her husband, Mr. Ne Nao, 27, were married in 2004 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One of them attends school and the other one is still young. The family lives in a small village off of National Road number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sam-ol has been a garment factory worker for eleven years. Her husband has been driving a motor remoque for two years; remoque is a motorbike with a trailer at the back which can carry more goods and people. She is asking for her second loan of US$500 to build a concrete room under her wooden house for storage and to repair her kitchen.

loans.use: To build a concrete storage room and repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Olga es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Olga viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que luego vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz y cebada.
Los sueños de Olga son comprar una casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Ollantay community bank. She is 30, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Olga travels to the different fairs in the region to sell fruit. At the fairs she buys cereal to later sell in the Ayacucho city markets. Olga needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy corn and barley. Olga’s dreams are to buy a house and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and barley

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is a 20-year-old man. He has owned a clothing store for the past year. Today, Tony is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase new clothes to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes

loans.name: Olufunsho

texts.en: E. is the headmistress of a primary school in the Ikotun area of Lagos. She also has a shop where she sells washing soaps of all kinds. She has two sales attendants who assist her in the trade. E. gets her supply of goods directly from the various manufacturing companies, at a discount. She started this business five years ago. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more soap to sell. With her paid job and this business E. assists her husband in providing for the needs of the family as he does not have a stable job. E. is 40 years old and has four children.

loans.use: To purchase more soap to sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann sells drinks and she engages in indoor and outdoor catering services. She has been in the business for the past 19 years. Ann is 47 years old and married, with 3 children. She has been borrowing from Lapo for the past 2 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more drinks and flowers to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and flowers for resale

loans.name: Por Un Futuro Mejor (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Por un futuro mejor esta ubicado en el mercado centrar del Cantón Paute, Paute es un lugar turístico de la provincia del Azuay, se caracteriza por su clima tropical, los espacios verdes, plantaciones de flores y frutas, sembríos de caña de azúcar y variedad de frutas que producen sus habitantes, las integrantes del banquito son comerciantes en el mercado de diferentes productos como frutas, legumbres, variedad de carnes, comida, entre otros.
Las personas en este sector son muy amables y respetuosas, son organizadas y colaboradoras es así:

Mercedes tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, vive en unión libre con su pareja, el hijo mayor estudia en el colegio de Paute, Mercedes por falta de recursos económicos tiene instrucción solo primaria, en cambio su pareja tiene hasta dos años de universidad, en su casa viven 6 personas, las cuales colaboran en el negocio, tanto hijos como pareja trabajan con ella y esta agradecida con Dios por tener una familia así.
Mercedes se dedica a la panadería hace ya mucho tiempo, más o menos unos 7 años, el crédito que solicitó es de 330 dólares para invertir en su negocio, su horario de trabajo es de 11 a 12 horas diarias, los 5 días a la semana, cuenta que más o menos gana unos 20 dólares semanal en el pan ya que no hace mucho porque en ocasiones a tenido que quedarse con el pan que no se vende, esto es por la competencia, este es su primer crédito que realiza a la Fundación ESPOIR, la invitaron unas amigas del grupo, su meta en el futuro es poderse pone su propia panadería ya que por el momento esta haciendo en su propia casa y sueña con tener un local para poder comercializar el pan conjuntamente con tortas, pastas, postres y demás delicias que Mercedes sabe hacer. 

María es oriunda de la ciudad de Cuenca, vive por el barrio de San José de Balsay, tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos, se dedica al comercio de pollos pelados, por libras y enteros, vende aproximadamente 25 pollos diarios en el mercado central de Paute, pero los días feriados su venta se duplica, estos días son los miércoles y domingos, su horario de trabajo es de 9 de la mañana hasta máximo las 3 de la tarde, de lunes a Domingo, su crédito que realizó es de 330 dólares,  que invertirá en comprar pollos bebes para criarlos y tener más utilidad al momento de venderlos, es socia ya mucho tiempo pero hace un año se retiro por causa de la distancia ya que pertenecía a otro banco que quedaba en Cuenca y la mayor parte del tiempo pasa en Paute, su meta es poder tener un criadero grande de pollo y adquirir equipos para poder pelarlos ella misma.

Diana es nativa de el cantón Paute, sector el barrio la Solidaridad, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera se encuentra embarazada de 7 meses de gestación, tiene instrucción secundaria hasta 4º curso, se retiro por causa de su embarazo y por la situación económica, vive con sus padres y aporta económicamente en los gastos diarios, se dedica al comercio informal en la venta de dulces dentro y fuera del mercado, ya tiene más o menos unos dos años trabajando de esta manera, en la semana gana aproximadamente 20 dólares, piensa seguir estudiando pero luego que nazca su niño, el crédito que realizó es de 220 dólares y lo va a utilizar para invertir en su negocio que es de rosquillas, tortas, entre otros. Su meta en la vida es poder terminar los estudios en el colegio y seguir en la universidad estudiando marketing y finanzas.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Por un futuro mejor” (For a Better Future) is located in the center of the Paute District. Paute is a tourist area in the province of Azuay, characterized by its tropical climate, green spaces, plantations, sugar cane fields and a variety of fruit produced by its inhabitants. The members of the communal bank are business owners who sell different products in the market such as fruit, vegetables, meats, prepared meals, and other items. These women are very kind, respectful, organized, and they work well with one another.

Mercedes is 45 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. Her oldest child attends high school in Paute. Mercedes could only afford to finish elementary school, in contrast to her partner who completed two years of college. Living in a house full of people who are willing to work and help with her business, she is thankful to God for the family that she has. Mercedes has been working at her bakery for quite some time, approximately 7 years. Her loan of $330 will be invested into her business. She works a schedule of 11-12 hours, 5 days a week. Mercedes earns about $20 each week selling bread, which helps tremendously because her family gets to keep the bread that is not sold as a result of competition. This is her first loan with Fundación ESPOIR. She was invited by her friends to join the group. Her goal for the future is to acquire a location for her bakery since she currently makes bread from home. Mercedes says this will help her to market her bread, along with cakes, pastries, desserts and other delicacies.

María is a native of Cuenca and lives in the neighborhood of San José de Balsay. She is 44 years old, married, and has 6 children. Her business involves selling whole plucked chickens by the pound. She sells approximately 25 chickens each day at the Paute central market. Her sales double during the holidays, and also on Wednesdays and Sundays. Her work schedule is from 9am to 3pm, Monday through Sunday. She will use her loan of $330 to purchase chicks and raise them until they are ready for sale. María is a longtime member, but became inactive for a year because of the distance and her decision to work with another group based in Cuenca. Her goal is to own a large chicken hatchery and purchase equipment for plucking.

Diana is a native of Paute and lives in the neighborhood of Solidaridad. She is 21 years old, single, and 7 months pregnant. Diana completed her education prior to the 4th year of high school before she dropped out because of her pregnancy and for financial reasons. She lives with her parents and contributes to the daily expenses. She has an informal business selling candy in the market and at other locations. Her business has been in operation for about 2 years and she earns approximately $20 each week. She plans to continue her studies after the birth of her child. She will use her loan of $220 to purchase donuts, cakes, and other items for her business. Her goal in life is to complete high school and continue on to college to study either marketing or finance.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens for breeding, expand a bakery business, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Vaimalo

texts.en:
Vaimalo T. (0) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Gataivai. She is married and has seven school-aged children.

Vaimalo owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has just started operating this business.

In 2009, Vaimalo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

 To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
El socio Jose, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 40 años de edad vive en el barrio de Manuel prado, es conviviente y tiene  2 hijos, nuestro socio alterna sus actividades con la prestación de servicios hoteleros, el trabaja en un hotel en el área de house keeping o ama de llaves en español, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal, el necesita pagar algunas deudas y adquirir algunos muebles y el colegio de los hijos, por lo que requiere el préstamo.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete en cumplir con el pago estipulado en el contrato.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Gnet

texts.en:
Gnet S., 51, is married and lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US $2 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Gnet S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a water pump. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.
(Gnet's husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Patricio

texts.en:
Patricio S. Jr. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 24 years old. Patricio is married and has 1 infant. To make a living, Patricio owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of dried fish in the local community. Patricio has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Patricio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricio is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Patricio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jorge Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Pablo Ángel está muy agradecido por su gran cooperación en el anterior crédito, el cual le ayudo mucho a que su negocio y a tenido mas ventas.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir más en comprar mercancía y que sus clientas le están pidiendo que venda en esta temporada de invierno. Pero no quiere descapitalizar el negocio es por eso que está solicitando nueva mente su cooperación para está inversión de comprar mercancía para el negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge Pablo Ángel is very grateful for your great cooperation with the previous loan. The loan greatly helped his business, and he has had more sales. He is asking for a loan again to be able to buy more merchandise, which his customers are asking that he sell this winter season. He does not want to take money out of his business. That is why he is once again asking for your cooperation for the purchase of merchandise for his business. He plans to pay the loan with part of the income he gets from the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline G. is from the village of Bay-bay Bonifacio Misamis Occ. She is 43 years old. Evangeline is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a fishing business selling seafood products like fish and shrimp in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay for tuition fees. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina E. is currently in the business of selling bread in the market and is requesting a loan to buy other items such as cooking oil, sugar, rice, etc. to sell. Medina is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bakery.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy other items such as cooking oil, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Resiliza

texts.en:
Resiliza A. is from the village of Nicdao, Maasin Baungon, Bukidnon.  She is 30 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Resiliza owns and operates a retail store.  Her main source of income comes from buying and selling gasoline in the local community.  Resiliza has been engaged in her business for over two years and she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Resiliza joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Resiliza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI.
--------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is forty-three years old. He is married and has two children who are both in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading.

John works very hard to be able to provide for his family. He runs a drugstore by the roadside in the community, procuring his drugs from Accra and from supply vans. He has been in business for nineteen years and wants a loan to procure drugs in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy drugs in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy parts and material for engine repairs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. H. is twenty five years old. She is married to a driver and they hope to have children and raise them well. Her business is located in Thika, Kenya. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapple. 

Mary has a salon where she has been providing hair and beauty services to the local women for seven years. She has one employee who works very hard to ensure good service to the customers. She says that this business is profitable and her only major challenge is that there are many power blackouts slowing down her business operations. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more hair weaves and cosmetics to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to open many outlets and serve many more people, especially in different parts of the town. She is a very hardworking and honest lady.

loans.use: Hair weaves and cosmetics

loans.name: Tsend-Ochir

texts.en: Tsend-Ochir is 41 years old and lives with his wife and their three children in Uvs province, Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent.  Tsend-Ochir produces wooden products and his wife sells them at the market. Since he started the business, he has been contributing to his family finances and has even purchased a new car. He started the carpentry business with a man named Namsrai in 1998, but they have worked separately since 2002. Since that time, his business has expanded and he has purchased electrical appliances and equipment for the business, which he runs from his own home.  He is a decent person and keeps good accounts of his own business.  He says, “I would like to create my own workplace for the business”. He is requesting a 700,000-tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of  wooden planks for the business.

loans.use: To purchase wooden planks for his carpentry business

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es: La señora Mirta F. posee una despensa donde vende todo tipo de artículos como para limpieza, de uso domésticos y algunos artículos de librería, ella nos comenta que le negocio es de mucha ayuda para la familia ya que mediante ella consiguieron muchas cosas su clientela la conforman los vecinos del lugar del Barrio San Isidro de la cuidad de Encarnación .El destino del crédito fue para aumentar su stock de mercaderías, su comercio cuenta con un importante stock de mercaderías la cliente es soltera y tiene un hijo.
texts.en:
Mirta F. has a larder where she sells all types of articles such as cleaning products, domestic items including food, and some bookstore items. She tells us that her business has helped her family greatly, as through acquiring many items she gained customers who are her neighbours in the San Isidro suburb, in Encarnación city. This loan is destined to increase her stock as this is very important to her business. Mirta is single and has one son.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, pasta, fruit, vegetables, bread-making items, dairy products

loans.name: Kausar's Group

texts.en:
Kausar Bibi is from the mid-sized city of Vehari, Pakistan. She is the wife of M. A.. Their house consists of four rooms. She is the mother of five children, one daughter and four sons. Her eldest son works in a factory for a monthly wage. Her husband works as a mason.

Kausar stays at home and takes care of her children and family and manages the domestic chores. She has taken two loans from Asasah, a micro-finance institute in Pakistan, and successfully repaid them. Now she is applying for the third loan to purchase masonry tools for her husband so can earn a good profit and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To buy masonry tools for her husband's business

loans.name: Alla

texts.fr: Madame Alla D. est une dame de 44 ans qui habite dans la localité de Ouakam. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse depuis 3 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 2 enfants dont elle assure la charge. Elle pratique le petit commerce et en même temps la commercialisation  de tissus et de produits cosmétiqués depuis 7 ans. Son objectif est d’éviter le chômage et aider ses enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour renouveler son stock de tissus mais aussi dans le but d’augmenter son fond et de renforcer son petit commerce. Elle a déjà bénéficie de 2 prêts  antérieurs et ces derniers lui ont permis d’acquérir  quelques matériels  de maison.
texts.en:
Mrs Alla D. is a 44 year old divorcee with two children who lives in the Ouakam area. She has been a member of the microfinance association for three years. She runs her own business and has sold fabric and cosmetics for the past seven years. Her aim is to avoid unemployment and support her children. She is seeking a 150 000 FRS loan to replenish her fabric inventory, and also to bolster her business. Mrs D. has already received two loans and these have enabled her to purchase building materials for her home.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing business funds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase electrical appliances for his family

loans.name: Amy Lèye

texts.fr: Amy Lèye D. est une femme de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 25 juin 2002 et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de l’embouche ovine et son nouveau prêt lui servira à acheter 20 moutons qu’elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Cette activité lui procure de revenus lui permettant de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Amy Lèye D. is a 39-year old woman who is married and mother to seven children who are in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 25th June 2002 and has had 15 consecutive loans; she has never had any problems with the repayments. She has a sheep fattening activity, and her new loan will be used to buy 20 sheep which she will fatten up and resell after four to five months. This activity procures an income which allows her to help her husband with the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 sheep to fatten

loans.name: Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El grupo “Rosa D. Guadalupe” esta representada por la señora Shirley Jessica y conformado por 10 miembros 1 varón y 9 mujeres, todos miembros residentes del mismo barrio por lo que son muy unidos y trabajadores. La señora Shirley Jessica se dedica a la venta D. refrescos y jugos vitaminizaos, debido al clima calido D. la zona donD. resiD. le va muy bien con los refrescos ya que tiene años en su puesto y su producto es D. buena calidad, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos ella residen en su propia casa que esta a medio construir pero, espera que hasta fin D. año pueda hacerle las ampliaciones necesarias, ella requiere del préstamo para la compra D. mesas para que su clientes puedan sentarse y talvez ampliar su negocio con la venta D. alguna comida al paso.  El resto D. las socios se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos, comida, empanadas, elaboración D. pan y el tejido a croché. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias no cuentan con mucha competencia cercana a sus puestos y ya cuentan con clientes que confían y demandan sus productos. El presente crédito será para la compra D. insumos para incrementar su producción y algunas herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a agilizar su producto terminado. En cuanto a la experiencia muchos D. los socios ya obtuvieron créditos similares en otras instituciones por lo que tiene amplio conocimiento del manejo D. los fondos utilizando estos para el crecimiento D. sus negocios y el mejoramiento D. sus ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group “Rosa D. Guadalupe” (Rose of Guadalupe) is represented by Sra. Shirley Jessica and consists of ten members, one man and nine women. All of them are residents of the same neighborhood, so they are very close and hard workers.

Sra. Shirley Jessica sells soft drinks and vitamin-packed juices. Due to the warm weather in the area, she has done very well selling refreshments. She has been in business for many years and her products are of good quality. Shirley Jessica is married, has three children, and lives in her own home that is halfway built. However, she is waiting until the end of the year to make the necessary upgrades. She needs a loan to buy tables so that her customers can sit down. Shirley Jessica is also considering expanding her business by selling fast food.

The other members sell cosmetics, food, turnovers, fresh baked bread, and crocheted items. Out in the marketplace, the members do not encounter much competition near their vending locations since they already have customers who rely upon and demand their products. This current loan will be used to buy supplies to increase their production and work equipment to help streamline their processes. Since they have obtained similar loans with other institutions, the members have extensive experience and have ample knowledge of how to manage their funds in order to grow their businesses and improve their income. This will allow them to proviD. their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables

loans.name: Claudia Sundo Group

texts.en:
Claudia S. is from the village of Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Claudia is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Claudia is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Claudia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Claudia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Claudia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claudia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Claudia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Claudia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia P. is from the village of Northern Poblacion, Baliangao. She is 28 years old, married and has 1 infant. To make a living, Ofelia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of dry goods in the local community. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ofelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,850 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase rice for her family. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Ofelia from PMPC. 


Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Ayshen

texts.ru:
Ayshen ne zamujem  i jivet so svoimi roditelyami. Ona jivet v qorode Baku. Yey 20 let .ona uchitsya v univere na zaochnom fakultete u neyo universitet platniy ona rabotayet chtobi oplatit universitet. 

Seycahs ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit moyushiye sredstva dlya pereprodaji. V etom biznese prodaji shampunet milo balzamov i t.d ona uje 2 qoda.
texts.en:
Ayshen is not married and lives with her children. She lives in the city of Baku. She is twenty years old and is studying in the university in extramural department. She has to pay for the university and works so she can pay her tuition. At this time she needs 2000 AZN to buy hygiene supplies for resale. She has been in the business of selling shampoo, soap, oils, and other products for two years.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hygiene products

loans.name: Benkadi  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi II est constitué de  sept femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Wobougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SALIMATA M. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.000FCFA environ par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkadi II group is composed of seven married women having an average age of 36 years and 3 children each. Most live in polygamous families at Wobougou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice, pearl millet, peanuts and beans. This is their second planting loan and the previous loan has been fully repaid. With this new loan, SALIMATA M. intends to pay for planting supplies, small tools and ploughing to maintain approximately 1.5 hectare of peanuts and beans. The crops are sold in the town of Massigui after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average profit of around 65,000 CFA per planting.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ploughing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing and small tools

loans.name: Cerila

texts.es: Cerila tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura desD. hace 20 años, junto con sus hijos y su esposo la apoya en esta actividad. Sin embargo hay ocasiones en que su esposo tiene que ir a trabajar en una minería, por lo que solo debe poner mano dura, sembrando sola papa, maíz, cebada y habas, que una vez cosechadas lo lleva a vender D. manera directa a los mercados mayorista. D. esta manera obtiene ganancias que le permiten sostener a su familia. Afirma que le gusta trabajar en la agricultura porque le permite tener buena cantidad D. alimentos en su almacén y aunque el trabajo es muy intenso y esforzado siempre  mantiene su optimismo con este trabajo es por esta razón que se proyecta  para el futuro mejorar sus futuras cosechas y adquiriendo más animales. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono y semillas D. papa, para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Cerila is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and four children in their own house. She has been working in agriculture for the past twenty years. She has the assistance of her children and husband in her business. Never the less, there are times when her husband has to go to work in the mines. At this time she has to work extra hard planting potatoes, corn, barley and lima beans. When these items are harvested she brings them to the wholesale market to sell. In this way she is able to make money to support her family. She likes to work in agriculture because it allows her to have a good amount of food in her small grocery market. Even though the work is very intense and difficult, she is always optimistic. In the future she would like to improve her harvests and acquire more animals. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support. She has always been responsible with her payments. Also she is thankful to be part of the communal group because the members are responsible and supportive. She is thankful for those people that will be managing the loan that she is requesting. They have been very useful by helping her improve her business. With the loan money that she is requesting, she will buy sacks of fertilizer and potato seed in order to continue growing crops.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy sacks of fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Aropat's Group

texts.en:
Aropat T. is the leader of this group. She is 51, married and has raised three sons; two sons work in construction and the third son went to work in Russia. Her husband is handicapped, so she takes care of him. In order to make money Aropat breeds livestock. With money received from the loan Aropat wants to purchase sheep for breeding and then resell them at a higher price after fattening them.

Munishon D. is the treasurer of the group. She is 45, married and has raised two sons and a daughter. The first son is a farmer, the second works in Russia and the daughter is married and lives separately with her family. Sixteen years ago when the collective farms broke up, Munishon got a piece of land. Since that time she and her husband have cultivated different fruits and vegetables. Her husband sells the harvest at the market, making 3000 KGS per month. Munishon applied for a loan because she wants to buy another piece of land for farming. In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle.

Maripathon B. is 46, married and has a daughter and two sons. In order to make money her sons and husband work in construction. Maripathon farms; she cultivates fruits and vegetables. With money received from a loan she wants to hire labor for the sowing process. In the future she plans to start repairing the house and purchase a cow for breeding.

Mukumjon S. is 38, married and has a son and two daughters, all of whom are at school. Mukumjon and his wife are farmers; they cultivate cotton. By selling the cotton they make 5000 KGS a month. With money received from a loan Mukumjon wants to rent a piece of land and hire labor to sow the cotton seed.

About Mol Bulak Finance:

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep, buy and rent land, and hire laborers

loans.name: 08.03.02 Dong Ve Group

texts.en:
Lan N. T. (4) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Lan is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 08.03.02 Dong Ve (08.03.02 Dong Ve).


Lan is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, Lan owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Lan has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lan is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women for 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Lan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Hanh (5) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. T. Hue (6) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  T. T. Lan  (7) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lan N. T. (4) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Lan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.Kieu Dai II . Dong Ve (08.03.02 Dong Ve).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Lan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lan kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Lan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Hanh (5) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Hue (6) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  T. T. Lan  (7) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is a single, 29-year-old woman. She has one child, who currently attends school.

To earn a living, Mary operates a small business where she sells tomatoes and fish. She is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. With the extra profits generated as a result of this loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her fish inventory

loans.name: Misbah's Group

texts.en:
Misbah is a resident of Lahore, which is the 2nd largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She owns a 2 room brick house in an area named Mughalpura and has been living in it with her family for the last 6 years. She is part of a group of four members.

She is a business woman who operates a dye (coloring) business. She dyes shawls (a kind of cloth, worn over body and shoulders) to financially support her husband. She operates this business at her home. She provides her services to her community people. They come to her to dye their shawls into different colors. This business gives her good earnings, which helps her to manage the financial circle of her family.

Her husband is a government employee on a reasonable income. She is the mother of 2 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is studying in kindergarten in a nearby school. The others are too young to attend to school.

Misbah has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her own business. She will utilize the loan money to purchase dye colors in bulk quantity to provide better and timely services to her clients. She has been doing this business for the last 10 years, which is considered good amount of experience. She is confident that after this loan investment, her business will improve. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she responsibly paid her installments and attended every meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Misbah”.

loans.use: To buy colors for clothes-dye (coloring) business.

loans.name: Daisy Judith

texts.es:
La señora Daisy Bermúdez Q. tiene 44 años, es separada y vive con su hija de 13 años en un apartamento en Barranquilla. Desde hace tres años ella se dedica al comercio de mercancía como ropa exterior femenina, bolsos, carteras, perfumes, cremas y accesorios de plata; su  experiencia en ventas se remonta a más de treinta años cuando empezó a vender dulces en el colegio para financiar sus textos escolares. Recientemente la señora Daisy está distribuyendo una línea de ropa interior femenina que le envían desde  la ciudad de Medellín y ha tenido una gran acogida, especialmente en mujeres jóvenes, porque son prendas decoradas con encajes y bordados que le dan un aspecto más sexy y femenino. La clientela de la señora Daisy está conformada por amigos, vecinos, familiares y referidos a quienes les da hasta 60 días de plazo para que le paguen en dos, tres o cuatro partidas.
Este es el primer préstamo que la señora Daisy  tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo invertirá en comprar mercancía de contado y en volúmenes que le represente importantes descuentos. Ella aspira en el mediano plazo abrir un pequeño almacén en algún centro comercial para poder ofrecer sus productos y conectarse con nuevos clientes que compren de contado. Con orgullo y alegría la señora Daisy afirma que “a punta de vender mercancía” ha logrado financiar los estudios de secundaria de su pequeña hija en uno de los mejores colegios privados de la ciudad, esto demuestra lo importante que ha sido su desempeño comercial en su ida familiar;   su sueño mas adelante es poder también financiarle sus estudios universitarios, porque según ella, el mejor legado que un padre le puede dejar a su hijo es una buena formación académica cimentada en valores cristianos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Daisy Bermúdez Q. is 44 years old. She is separated and lives with her 13 year old daughter in an apartment in Barranquilla. For three years she has been selling merchandise such as women's outerwear, bags, wallets, creams and silver accessories. Her selling experience began more than thirty years ago when she began selling candy at high school to pay for her textbooks. Recently, Daisy has been distributing a line of women's underwear that they send her from the city of Medellín and it has been very popular, especially with young women because they are pieces adorned with lace and embroidery that give them a sexy and feminie look.  Daisy's clientele is made up of friends, neighbors, relatives and referrals to whom she gives up to 60 days to pay her in two, three, or four payments.   

This is the first loan that Daisy has taken out with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and she will invest it in buying merchandise and paying for it upfront in quantities that will mean significant discounts for her. In the future, her plans are to open a small store in a mall to offer her products and connect with new customers who will pay up front. With pride and happiness,  Daisy affirms that "by selling merchandise" she has been able to finance her young daughter's high school education at one of the best private high schools in the city. This shows how important her work has been for her family. Her dream for the future are to also be able to finance her university studies because according to her, the best legacy a parent can leave a child is a good education based in Christian values.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and pay for it upfront and in quantities that would mean significant discounts for her.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 32-year-old enterprising woman, married to a driver, with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She lives in a semi permanent house and is vested with the responsibility of taking care of six household members with the help of her husband. Her dream is to be able to pay school fees for her children through to tertiary institutions. She has been selling secondhand shoes and clothes for twelve years, and she has been able to rise from hawking her goods to owning a shop. She is challenged with the high cost of rent and seasonal sales. Her business dream is to operate from her own premises. This being the Christmas season, when demand for her products is high, Christine has decided to inject extra capital into the business; thus, the need for a loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell in her shop

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa Amelia N. H. tiene 33 años. Es soltera, vive con la madre, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia para ponerse un negocio familiar.

Le gusta limpiar y arreglar la casa y festejar las fiestas de carnaval
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia N. H., 33, is single living with her mother in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  She has no children.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light & Progress) communal bank are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It belongs to the Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and other professional jobs.  It has 17 members.

Rosa is a corn, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer.  She buys her supplies in Chillanes and sells her products in the Chillanes market and in her home settlement.

She is asking for the loan to buy corn, broad bean, pea and chayote seeds.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  Her dream is to have her own house to set up a family business.

She enjoys cleaning and straightening up her house and celebrating Carnival.

loans.use: For seeds.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 37 years old.  She is a mother of three.  She owns a shop where she sells animal feeds.  She omi opened the shop five years ago after leaving her job as a driver.  She is doing well in her business and hopes to improve it.  Naomi also does horticultural farming and runs a retail shop to boost her income.  She has requested a loan for 50,000 Kes to buy a Fresian cow and more animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy a Fresian cow and animal feeds

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora Marcelina U. M., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, es madre soltera  en donde tuvo dos hijos quienes ya están casados, con ella viven dos nietos que están estudiando y que son hijos de la señora Marbella.

        Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de ingredientes para elaboración de tamales que viene practicando desde hace tiempo y cometa que hasta el momento le va muy bien con este pequeño trabajo.

        En esta actividad se inspiro ya que para sacar adelante a sus hijos tenía que tener en donde de dicar su tiempo y tener de donde provenir sus ingresos para cubrir sus pequeños gastos generados en su hogar.

        Con la ganancia que va obteniendo  comprar  más ingredientes que se le terminan cuando helos elabora al mayoreo  y le agotan, de eso mismo  obtiene para ser puntal en sus pagos que se dan en el préstamo.

        Su sueño es que logre comprar materiales para mandar a repellar su casa, como también  seguir trabando  hasta que dios le preste vida y con ellos salir adelante en estos tiempos.
texts.en:
Señora Marcelina U. M. lives in Tecpatan in the state of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is a single mother with two children that are married.  She has two school-age grandchildren that live with her and are the children of Señora Marbella.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make tamales. She has been making tamales for some time now and says that so far things are going well. She was drawn to this activity because, in order to help her children get ahead, she needed to find a way to use her time to earn the income needed to pay her minor household expenses..  With the earnings she obtains she will buy more ingredients because she runs out when she makes large quantities of tamales.  She will also use her earnings to make her loan payments on time.  

Her dream is to be able to buy materials to plaster her house as well as to also continue working for as long as God grants her life and to get ahead in these times.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: Maria Gabriela tiene 23 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, ya que desde muy joven aprendio este medio de vida y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sobrevivir con su hijo menor de edad a su cargo, inicio este negocio por su propia cuenta por lo que no tenía un trabajo estable y así proporcionar ingresos fijos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior y sabanas. Sueña con poder formar a su hijo par que sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Maria Gabriela is 23 years old.  She sells general merchandise.  She’s had this business for over 10 years.  Through much effort she has managed to survive with a minor son in her care.  She started this business on her own initiative because she did not have stable employment and needed to earn steady income.

She is asking for this loan to buy footwear, cosmetics, underwear and sheets.  She dreams with raising her son to be an upstanding citizen.

loans.use: To buy footwear, cosmetics, underwear and sheets.

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en:
Chhoun N. is a married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband have been cultivating rice on their own farmland for years, earning approximately $5 a day. They get a good crop almost every year. This couple has two children, neither of whom are enrolled in school yet. Chhoun N. would like a loan of $550 in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. She will rent this land to farmers for their farm work. 

Chhoun N., her husband and her young kid are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land in good condition for a farming business

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm T., 34, is married and lives with her three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for its rubber plantations. T. is a motor taxi driver and grows fruit trees, earning $1.85 US per day. Her husband sells cashew nuts, earning $3 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $35 US on food and $22 US on other expenses. T. is requesting a loan of $500 US to purchase potato seeds to grow. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds to grow

loans.name: Los Ángeles De Charlies Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Ángeles de Charlies lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras  una de ella es Karla J. de 40 años quien se dedica a la venta de comida. Ella realiza la comida, las empaca y entregara en las empresas. 
Giron tiene tres hijos de 20, 15 y 10 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente.
Las integrantes de los grupos son Gloria Q. de 31 años quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años y Raquel G. de 51 años quien vende tortilla, gaseosa, licor y cerveza.
texts.en:
The Charlie's Angels group is made up of 3 hard-working, enterprising women.  One of whom is Karla J. who is 40 years old and sells food.  She makes the food, packages it, and sells it to businesses.

J. has 3 children who are 20, 15, and 10 years old, each of whom also works hard.

The other group members are Gloria Q. (31 years old) who has run a small general store for the past 4 years, and Raquel G. (51 years old) who sells tortillas, soft drinks, liquor, and beer.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat, etc.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Atzacan Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Lucila una integrante del grupo "Rosas de Atzacan" que esta ubicado en el estado de VeraC., México. Ella se dedica a la venta de tacos y tamales que inicio hace 20 años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de un triciclo, sus compañeras la consideran una persona responsable, al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente contenta, tiene 33 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y tiene un hijo, quiere este credito para la compra de triciclos para aumentar sus ventas, también espera en un futuro poder construir su casa en su terreno y así poder ofrecerles a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una carrera a su hijo para que logre sus sueños.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Lucila’s house; she’s a member of the “Rosas de Atzacan” croup located in the state of VeraC., México.  She’s been selling tacos and tamales for the last 20 years.  She is asking for a loan to buy a tricycle (three-wheeled cart).  Her fellow group members consider her to be a responsible person.

She is 33 years old and at the moment of requesting the loan is happy.  She finished middle school and has a child.

She wants this loan to buy tricycles to increase sales.  She also hopes in the future to be able to build her house on her lot to offer her family a better quality of life and a career for her son so that he can reach his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new tricycle to increase sales

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Maria Francisca H.: de 47 años tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar,ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la compra y venta de cafe maduro y seco por quintal,ella saca a vender su producto lo dias Jueves y domingos, madruga para aprovechar la mañana y asi poder vender su producto a buen precio y asi generar un poco mas de ganacia, ella alquila un camion para llevar su producto al mercado ya que donde ella vive esta un poco lejos. Aparte de eso de la compra de cafe tambien compra pepita de ayote por quintal. por eso ella solicita el credito para la compra de cafe Maduro y seco por quintal y compra de pepita de ayote por quintal,el sueño de ella es tener su propio vehiculo para transportarse con mas facilidad, y agrandar mas su capital para poder invertir un poco mas.
texts.en: María Francisca Hernández, 47, has five, school aged children.  She tells us that she sells raw and dry coffee by the quintal on Thursdays and Sundays.  She gets up at dawn to take advantage of the morning and sell her products at good prices to generate a bit more profit.  She leases a truck to take her products to market because she lives a bit far away.  Besides the coffee sales, she also buys quintals of pumpkin seeds.  She needs the loan to buy raw and dry coffee by the quintal and to buy quintals of pumpkin seeds.  Her dream is to own her own vehicle to get around more easily and to increase capital to be able to invest a bit more.

loans.use: to buy raw and dry coffee and pumpkin seeds.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita B. is from the village of Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 29 years old. Esterlita is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Esterlita sells wild-caught fish in the local community. Esterlita is just starting this business.

In 2010, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Faleulu

texts.en:
Faleulu is 31 years of age. She is married and has two children. Faleulu owns & operates a business venture, selling beef products in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business. Faleulu needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Faleulu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faleulu's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
