Juan tiene su propio negocio, con más de ocho años en las ventas, el cual comenzó con poca mercadería que en el transcurso del tiempo fue aumentando de capital gracias a las ganancias y financiamiento que Afodenic otorgo mediante el crédito.
Su esposa lo apoya con las ventas, también ve por sus tres hijos el cual están pequeño y son de cuidados.
Vende una variedad de productos, logrando tener ventas amplias, lo que ha sido el objetivo al vender productos que mucho demandan los clientes, hoy con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en diez quintales de arroz, cinco quintales de azúcar, ocho bidón de aceite, frijoles, gaseosas, golosinas, de los cuales se venden más.
texts.en:
Juan has his own business; he’s been in sales for over 8 years.  He started out with little stock merchandise but as time has passed he’s increased capital thanks to profits and financing through Afodenic loans. His wife helps him sell.  He cares for three children who are still very little and need care.

He sells a wide variety of products attaining large sales which is his objective in selling products that have high customer demand.  Today, with this new loan, he will buy 10 quintals of rice, five quintals of sugar, 8 large vats of oil, beans, soft drinks and the best selling snacks.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Adele

texts.en:
Adele is 45 years old. She has 4 children who are between the ages  of 9 and 19years old. All of her children are in school. Her husband is a farmer. Adele sells clothes in the market and she has been selling clothes for the past 14 years. She sells shirts, trousers, sweaters and vests. This business has enabled her to meet her needs and to pay fees for her children.

Adele is requesting a loan to buy more clothes in order to make profits.She plans to make some savings and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 38 años de edad, el es casado, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son dependientes, julio cuenta con casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el  caserío Annape,  ubicado  a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope.  

Julio se dedica ala crianza y comercialición de animales, los cuales cría  en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, alimenta sus animales con pastos naturales, maíz, polvillo, etc y cuando estos alcanzan esl peso y tamaño ideal los negocia quincenalmente en Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Su esposa lo ayuda vendiendo verduras y pescado.

Julio está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles el cual utilizará para invertirlo en compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y en compra de verduras y pescado para negociar.
 
Julio es una persona  bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Julio is 38 years old, married and has two children, who are currently dependent. Julio has his own home which is located in the hamlet of Annape located 15 minutes from the city of Mórrope.

Julio works raising and selling animals which he raises in pens located in the back part of his residence. He feeds his animals with natural grasses, corn, powered foods, etc, and once they reach the ideal size and weight he negotiates their sale every other week in Chiclayo and Lambayeque. His wife helps him selling produce and fish. 

Julio is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3,000 Peruvian soles which he will use to invest in purchasing commercially prepared feed for his animals and buying produce and fish for sale. 

Julio is quite a hardworking person and of very good character. Those who know him have a great deal of respect and affection for him.

loans.use: to purchase commercially prepared feed for his animals.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 40-year-old business lady and a single mother of three children.  She is a trader of green vegetables and grains. She has been in this  business for the last 17 years and earns an income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family members.

Nancy is applying for her sixth loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Nancy will use this new loan to add stocks of dry maize and beans, and invest in mixed crop farming.   With the anticipated profit, she will educate her children up to university level. Her hope and dream is to concentrate more on educating her children.

loans.use: buy dry maize and beans

loans.name: Carlos Rafael

texts.es: Don Carlos de 36 años  trabaja como Auxiliar de enfermeria en el hospital Jacinto H. desde hace 5 años,  solicita su 1er credito para mejoramiento de una habitaciòn y asi gozar de mayor comodidad en el hogar , su esposa la ayuda con los gastos familiares ella es comerciante ambos son bien responsables segun referencia laborales, comerciales y personales, su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijos sean hombre de bien y que gozen de salud y no les haga falta lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en:
Don Carlos is 36 years old and has worked as a nursing assistant in the Jacinto H. hospital for five years. He is requesting his first loan to make improvements to a room in his house to make his home more comfortable. 

His wife helps with the family expenses. She is a merchant. Both of them are very responsible according to their work, business and personal references. His biggest dream in life is that his children will be good men, that they will enjoy good health and that they will not lack the basics at home.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of a room in his home.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Concepcion has a retail shop that sells beverages, snacks & breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & candies.

Concepcion is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & candies

loans.name: Four Mile Traders Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Four Mile Traders” group from the small town of Waterloo, near Sierra Leone’s capital city Freetown. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, for a loan of SLL 600,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Iye is the leader of this group. A 34-year-old married mother of three children, Iye has been a businesswoman for 10 years now, selling dishes, plastic bowls, spoons, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

(Also included on the left in the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy dishes, plastic bowls, spoons, etc. wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам занимается изготовлением кирпича дома. Он добросовестный и ответственный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он изготавливает сырого кирпича, а затем продает их. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством. Он покупает скота с других районов, а продает на местном рынке с надбавкой. Его жена  и сын иногда помогает ему.  Он запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки материалов для производства кирпича и покупки скота. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rustam is involved in producing bricks.  He is a conscientious and responsible person.  He is a married and loving father of three children.  He makes raw bricks and then sells them.  Besides this, he is involved in animal husbandry.  He buys livestock from other districts and sells it at the local market with an added margin.  His wife and son sometimes help him with the business.  Rustam is requesting a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of brick-making materials and to buy livestock.  He hopes that creditors will support him.

loans.use: to purchase materials for brick production and to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, vive con su madre y un hermano menor a él, es empleado de la Alcaldía Municipal, trabaja desde hace tres años, de este empleo se mantiene y apoya a sus familiares en algunos gastos.
Él necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en materiales de construcción, para realizarle mejoras a la vivienda, específicamente el cambio de techo de la cocina, este apoyo es verdaderamente importante para José, ya que su madre estará más segura en la vivienda.
Su propósito es velar por las necesidades de su familia, trabajar honradamente y algún día formar su propio hogar.
texts.en:
José lives with his mother and a younger brother. He has been a municipal employee for three years. With this employment, he maintains and supports his family with various costs.
He needs a loan to invest in construction materials in order to make home improvements; specifically, to change the roof in the kitchen. This support is truly important for José, since his mother will be more secure in the home.
He desires to watch out for his family's needs, to work honestly, and to set up his own home one day.

loans.use: to change the roof of his home's kitchen.

loans.name: Aychamol

texts.ru: Айчамол жительница Шахритуского района. Ей 54 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж и дети находятся в Российской Феерации. Сама Айчамол более шести лет занимается торговлей. Она в основном сеет чеснок для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Aychamol lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 54 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband and children are in the Russian Federation.  Aychamol has been involved in sales for over six years.  She primarily sows garlic for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds for sowing garlic, mineral fertilizers and fuel for a tractor

loans.name: Mekhdi

texts.en:
Mekhdi is 38 and married with two children. He has run his small business for the last 10 years, selling food products. His wife is a housekeeper, however she actively helps Mekhdi. 

His monthly profit from this business is about 400 USD and he would like to increase it. Mekhdi has good client history and wants to reinvest his profits.

loans.use: purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Elynor

texts.en:
Elynor is 32-years-old and blessed with two children. To make a living she is working as a manicurist and pedicurist in their community. She roams house to house to look for customer in need of her service. This is her method every day to make a profit. 

Because of poor living in their village, she simply asks rice as her payment. Then through that barter system, she is acquiring customers at the same time, earning income to lift her family from poverty. 

She is now asking for a loan amount of P5,000 to buy new kits for her service business such as cuticle remover, nail polish, pusher and nipper used to provide a good quality service. These would be a great help to provide better customer service for her clients and to earn a bigger income.

loans.use: to buy new kits for her service business such as cuticle remover, nail polish, pusher and nipper used to provide a good quality service.

loans.name: Bidii F.f.s Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii F.F.S SHG Group in Western Kenya! Jackson is the facilitator of the Bidii F.F.S SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jackson  takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jackson had an excellent maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Jackson was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackson  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jackson will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in goats and sheep.

In 2012, the members of Bidii F.F.S SHG Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photo, Jackson is pictured with his group and at the far left is the One Acre Fund field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 40-year-old married man. Together with his wife Florence, they are blessed with a three-year-old child. For the past 3½ years, George has operated his own vegetable kiosk and his primary customers are neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

George will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase more potatoes, onions and other vegetables. George aspires to open more kiosks and continue expanding his business in the future. He joined Yehu because they offer a variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes, onions and other vegetables.

loans.name: Ninh

texts.en:
Ninh is a 51-year-old widowed woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 1 son and 2 daughters. 

Two years ago, Ninh opened a soft drink store. She would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverage to stock her store.

loans.name: Lorita

texts.en:
Lorita is 63 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married and has eight children.

Lorita works in the fish industry and catches and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Lorita has been a member of PMPC for more than a year. In the future, Lorita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maritza Luz Silvia

texts.es:
Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 niños, la señora cuenta con estudios de educación superior incompleto.

Maritza trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de abarrotes, también vende carne vacuno.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará ochenta cajas de panetones de diferentes marcas, chocolates, leches y otros productos para abastecerce durante la campaña navideña.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos.

La señora desea tener un local propio y amplio para poner una bodega mucho más abastecida.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la organización, la puntualidad, la comprensión y el diálogo entre las socias.
texts.en:
Maritza’s a member of the “Ahorro es Progreso” communal bank located in Puno Province and Department.  She’s 39 years old and the single mother of two children.  She attended but did not complete higher education.

Maritza has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her initial loan was for 300 new soles.  She used the money to increase business capital selling groceries; she also sells beef.

She will use her new, 2500 new sol, loan to buy 80 boxes of panettones of various brands, chocolates, milk and other products to stock up during the Christmas season.  Her children help her in the business.

She would like to have a spacious locale of her own to set up a much better stocked store.  What she likes about her communal bank is the organization, the punctuality, the understanding and the dialogue among the members.

loans.use: to buy 80 boxes of panettones, chocolates, milk and other products for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Mwanahalima

texts.en:
Mwanahalima is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Her major dream is to establish a large business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and cooking pots. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and cooking pots.

loans.name: Juan Ronald

texts.es:
Juan Ronal tiene 24 años vive es soltero, y vive con su  padre. Vive en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el recreo  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Desde hace cinco  años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, urea  para la siembra del maíz,   El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño  es poder comprar un terreno y así  tener estabilidad económica   para su familia.

En los tiempos libres me gusta  jugar indor y pasar  con toda mi familia.
texts.en: Juan Ronal is 24 years old. He is single and lives with his father. He lives in Recinto San Vicente Las Lomas in the Canton of Ventanas. The "El Recreo" Community Bank is located in Recinto San Vicente las Lomas that belongs to the Canton of Ventanas. This community bank is dedicated to short term agricultural work such as growing corn, rice, beans and soy beans. For the past five years Juan has worked in agriculture growing corn and beans. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same location. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies, fertilizers and urea in order to grow corn. This loan will help him increase his earnings so that he can support his family. His dream is to buy a piece of land and have economic stability for his family. In his free time he likes to play volleyball and pass time with his family.

loans.use: to buy goods, fertilizer and urea in order to buy corn.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos como verduras, cereales y otros, en esta ocasión por la epoca la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de tarwi seco luego lo remoja y lo lleva  avender en Pisac, al socia también vende quinua pelada estos productos los vende los días martes, jueves, domingos. La socia desea a futuro prosperar con sus negocio y poder ver a sus hijos realizados en cuanto a sus estudios. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de tarwi y de quinua para la venta.
texts.en: The member continues with her business selling products such as vegetables, grains, and others.  Now, because of the season, she wants to invest the loan in buying dry tarwi.  Then she soaks it and takes it to Pisac to sell.  She also sells blanched quinoa.  She sells these products on Tuesday, Thursday, and Sunday.  In the future she wants to prosper with her business and be able to see her children fulfilled with regard to their studies.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in buying tarwi and quinoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy tarwi and quinoa to sell.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
“Virgen de Fátima “es denominado este comité y actualmente se encuentra en el 2°ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya,  con 14 integrantes, Es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, quienes se dedican diversas actividades.
 La señora Myrian es una mujer admirable, ya que pese a las adversidades que le toco vivir ella siempre lucha y no se deja vencer. Ella nos cuenta que es tejedora y que gracias a este trabajo ayuda con los gastos de la casa, cuenta que se siente muy contenta con lo que hace ya que es una forma que tiene de aportar en la casa.
Ella solicita la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de hilos, telas, agujas y demás insumos para sus tejidos. Ella agradece por este programa, ya que ella cuenta  con una capacidad física especial y muchas veces ya le negaron el acceso a los créditos y a través de esta oportunidad brindada ella puede sentirse una persona útil.
texts.en:
“Virgen de Fátima" is the name of this group and they are currently in the 2nd cycle of Fundación Paraguaya's Enterprising Women Program.  With 14 members, it is a group of responsible and hard working women who make their livings from various activities.
Señora Myrian is an admirable woman.  Even with the adversities that she has lived through, she has always worked hard and doesn't give up.  She tells us that she is a weaver and that thanks to her work, she can help with the household expenses.  She says that she feels very happy with what she does, as it is a way she has to contribute in her home.
Señora Myrian is requesting help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to purchase thread, fabric, needles and other supplies for her weaving.  She is grateful for the program since she has a special physical capacity and many times she is denied access to loans.  Through this opportunity with Fundación Paraguaya she feels useful.

loans.use: to purchase thread, fabric, needles and other supplies.

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Jariatu. She is married and has three children aged 16, 11 and 9. She has two additional dependents, her brother's children, who came to live with her for assistance in their schooling. 

In 2002, Jariatu established her fast food, soft and hard drinks business. She began her business because she stopped at form 4 and later took a catering course. After graduation she worked for some time and established a restaurant. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,950,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Jariatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy: 11 crates of stout at 89,000 SLL, 10 crates of Carlsberg Beer at 120,000 SLL, 15 crates of assorted soft drinks at 37,000 SLL, and 7 crates of Maltina beer at 37,000 SLL. The balance of 7,000 SLL will be used to pay laborer. 

In the future, Jariatu plans to acquire a shop, buy a car, build a house and travel abroad. This loan will help to improve her business. The shortage of drinks during holidays is her challenge. She is a hardworking business woman. She is very glad about the loan which has improved her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy: 11 crates of stout at 89,000 SLL, 10 crates of Carlsberg Beer at 120,000 SLL, 15 crates of assorted soft drinks at 37,000 SLL, and 7 crates of Maltina beer at 37,000 SLL. The balance of 7,000 SLL will be used to pay laborer.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. He has four children and has been doing this work for 20 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'He enjoys growing horticultural crops because of the reliable and high returns.' His biggest challenge is 'High input prices.'

Daniel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because of the favorable loan terms.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Microfinance gives loans to farmers in groups.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Daniel replied 'He will be able to improve the family's living standards and to expand his farming projects.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Daniel owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, running water' but does not have 'solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.en: Shavkatjon is responsible father of a little son. His wife is a housewife and has been busy with up-bringing their child. So, Shavkatjon is the only feed keeper of his family. Shavkatjon has been busy with growing greens, tomatoes and etc. He runs this business during 7 years. Shavkatjon sells his products in a local market. He is going to repair his house now but he has not money. He is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy cement, wood, paints and etc. He will repair all rooms of his house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cement, wood, paints and etc

loans.name: Mawuklo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAWUKLO  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Béatrice Baï, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 46  ans est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Paulin. Le couple a n’a aps d’enfants mais à deux personnes à sa charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Béatrice Baï et son mari. Pour cette raison, Béatrice Baï vend des savons, des biscuits et des pâtes alimentaires dans sa région depuis dix ans.  Béatrice Baï s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Béatrice Baï sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAWUKLO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement on été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des savons, des biscuits et des pâtes alimentaires

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old. She is a widow and has four children between the ages of 4 and 16. All of her children are in school. She is a petty trader. She sells rice, eggs, sugar, soap etc to support her family. The profit she makes goes towards the education of her children. 
 
Grace wants to expand her business in order to help her support her family. She is confident that with this loan, she will be able to buy more rice, eggs, soap and sugar to sell in order to pay her children's school fees and manage her home.

loans.use: To be able to purchase more rice, eggs, sugar, soap, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel and his wife Elizabeth have been business partners since they got married. Together, they operate a hardware store and several rental units in Mukuru Kwa Njenga. 
At the rental units, tenants do not have access to toilet facilities owing to the limited space for establishing a pit latrine. 
As such, when need arises, tenants use neighborhood toilets at a fee. While these toilets are accessible, often tenants do not use them during the night due to insecurity in the area. The lack of toilets has had adverse effects at Samuel's plot, there is a high turnover rate of tenants in search of rental units with toilet facilities. 

Samuel recently learnt of the Fresh Life Toilets, which he says would be an invaluable add on at his premises. They would be a solution to the high turn over rate of tenants and also ensure that cleanliness and hygiene is practiced at the plot. 

His desire is to install two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.use: To Pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He is 36. He married and has 3 children. Since 2005 he has been engaged in newspaper sales and an lottery sales. Having borrowed the loan amount of $300 from Normicro he has bought the newspaper store. The second time he borrowed $300.
He applies for the loan $500 to rent the grocery store and buy writing materials.

loans.use: To rent the grocery store and buy writing materials

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 27-year-old mother, married with 3 children. She has had no education at all. As a young woman she began to prepare local rice for sale to the inhabitants of her community. Over time, she has enjoyed good patronage and therefore changed to imported rice since customer preference shifted in favour of that. Her patrons include little children and adults as well.

With her participation in KRABAN'S learning sessions, Nana seeks the KIVA loan to put up a small shed under which she can serve her customers.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Viet

texts.en: Mrs. Viet is 44 years old, and her husband is 46 years old. They have two children between 10 and 16 who are attending school in grades 5 and 10. The family does not own any land for cultivation. Dong, her husband, works as a daily laborer, but he only works in six dry months. Therefore, it is important that Viet is selling fruit in front of the hospital, because it helps increase her income by about $2/person/month. Average is $11/person/month. Now, she is asking to borrow a loan of $75 for her retail business.

loans.use: selling fruits

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida P. V. weaves the traditional Mayan top called a huipil to provide a little cash for her family. She can weave a huipil in about 15 days and gets about US$100 for it when she sells it at the market. The yarn for a huipil costs her about $30. Before beginning the loan program with Friendship Bridge, Adelaida couldn’t really make much money weaving because she never had enough money to buy the yarn.

Adelaida is 22 and has two young children. She’s committed to getting them into school when the time comes, because she doesn’t want them to have her disadvantage of not knowing how to read, write, or sign her name.

The family lives in a rough wooden house with a dirt floor on a borrowed space. Her husband’s family does have some land, so they get some of the need for corn met that way. Her dream is work together with her husband to be able to buy food and clothing for the kids so that the kids can succeed in school.

Adelaida is a member of the women's group "Flor de Nebaj".

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving huipiles

loans.name: Ni Made Yudiani

texts.id:
From 2 piglets she bought for Rp200,000 (about US$22)/piece Ni Made Yudiani started her business after she started her household. After being raised for 2 months , she sold the fattened piglets to a roasted pig vendor for Rp375,000 (about $41)/piece. From that sales, after expenses Yudiani got a nett profit of Rp100,000 (about $11). She used that profit to supplement family daily expenses, since her husband's income as a tenant farmer is not sufficient to cover family needs, especially since her 2 children Alit and Ratna are in highschool and kindergarden that certainly needs fees. Yudiani plans to expand her business from Dinari's loan of Rp1,500,000 (about $165) to buy 2 more piglets, and repair her broken stall. I Made Sutama Yasa, her husband supports Yudiani's business. Even her children also help in the business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dari dua ekor ternak babi yang di beli seharga Rp. 200.000,- / ekornya Ni Made Yudiani memulai usahanya sejak baru berumah tangga . Setelah dipelihara selama dua bulan babi itu kemudian dijual kepada pedagang babi guling dengan harga Rp. 375.000,- / ekor. Dari hasil penjualan itu Yudiani memperoleh keuntungan bersih Rp. 100.000.- Keuntungan yang didapatnya di pergunakan untuk membantu menambah biaya kebutuhan sehari –hari keluarganya karena pendapatan suaminya sebagai petani tidak cukup untuk memenuhi semua kebutuhan keluarga apalagi saat ini dua orang anaknya yakni Alit dan Ratna telah duduk di bangku SLTA dan TK yang tentunya sangat membutuhkan biaya . Yudani mengembangkan usaha ternaknya dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari Rp 1.500.000,- Pinjaman itu digunakan untuk membeli dua ekor bibit lagi dan juga memperbaiki kandangnya yang sudah rusak.. , suaminya, sangat mendukung usaha dari Yudani. Bahkan tak jarang anaknya pun ikut dalam mengurus usaha itu.

loans.use:
To buy piglets and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Elshad

texts.ru:
Elshad was born and raised in the city of Saatli in Azerbaijan. He is 34 and has two children. He was born in a low income family. In 1993 he bought a small piece of land in his village, properly equipped it, set up a tent and started selling timber. The amount of wood he had for sale depended on the time of year. Because of this seasonal property, Elshad's business needed occasional one time investments that would allow him to purchase more wood. In order to be able to increase turnover Elshad came to Normicro, a partner of Kiva, asking to borrow $700. In the future Elshad is hoping to increase both profit and turnover, which will allow him to provide his family with all the necessities.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Ельшад родился и живет в г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ему 34, у него двое детей, он выходец из малообеспеченной семьи. В 1993 году он купил небольшую площадку у себя в деревне, оборудовал её, построил навес и начал продавать лесоматериал. Объём продажи зависел от времени года. поэтому бизнес Ельшада нуждался время от времени в разовых вложениях для пополнения товара. Чтобы увеличить объём продаж, Ельшад обращается за кредитом в 700 долларов к Нормикро - партнёру КИВА. После получения кредита он надеется увеличить свою прибыль и обеспечить свою семью всем необходимым.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Vaioalii

texts.en: Vaioalii is a 55 year-old mother with 4 children. Through the years, she has struggled very hard to get her family where they are now. Through her loans with SPBD, she has managed to improve many things for her family and developed her family living.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pig farm plantation and her canteen business

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira M. is 36 years old. She and her husband, an engineer, have three children of school age. 

Zamira is trained as a kindergarten teacher. However, for several years Zamira has also been selling clothing. She sells men's and children's socks in the central local market. She puts aside part of the income from the business for the education of her children. She and her husband hope that their children will receive higher education.  

Zamira has received several loans from IMON over the past 7 years, and she has an excellent credit record. She is now asking for a loan of  3 500.00 somoni ($ 1025.00 US) for the purchase of new goods for resale. Zamira promises to repay the loan in 3 months and thanks eyeryone for supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Telesforo

texts.es:
Telesforo works in the raising of dairy cows, selling the milk production to PIL Andina (Milk Production Plant).

He lives in the community of Kallutaka in the Pucarani sector, about three and a half hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his six children of 21,16, 15, 13, 11,and 8 years of age respectively.

He will use the loan to purchase a better quality milking cow which will enable him to increase his milk production, in response to the increased demand from PIL Andina.

This is his first loan with Impro. His financial evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Telesforo se dedica a la cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).

Vive en la Comunidad de Kallutaka sector Pucarani a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz., Junto a sus seis hijos de 21,16,15,13,11y 8 años respectivamente.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mejorada y así incrementar la producción de leche, en vista de la demanda por parte de PIL Andina.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Cheoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheoun I., 28, is the mother of two children and works as a garment worker, making about $3 a day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and can earn as much as $3 a day of profit.

The couple has requested this loan to replace their old motorbike, which is unreliable and uses lots of gas.

(Mrs. Cheoun I., pictured with her husband and one of her children.)

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa F. is a sixty-year old mother of two children who are currently in school. Her husband has gone on pension, so Adwoa is the bread winner of her family. She sells kebab (local food prepared with soya beans, meat and oil). She is very grateful for the financial assistance and will use her loan to buy more stock of soya beans and oil so she can produce larger quantities and increase her income. Adwoa belongs to the community group called Eagle Trust Group. Group members exert peer pressure on themselves as social collateral to repay.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials (soya beans, oil, meat) to increase production.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika belongs to the Communal Bank “Damas del Oriente,” located on Asentamiento Humano Villa Oriente Mz C Lt 8 in Calleria district of Ucayali state. She is 24 years old, mother of 2 children, and her husband is a motorcar driver. With Erika’s first loan from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 she decided to invest in the purchase of a motorcar.

Today she has a motorcar, and she gets up at 7 am to prepare breakfast for her children and husband so he may go work with the motorcar and she takes care of their children because they are still very little.

with this loan for S/.2000 which will be repaid in 4 months, she will pay the initial payment for the motorcar.

Erika is very happy because she can make a living in a tranquil way and without needing much effort so as to be able to also take care of her small children and attend to the household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Erika pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas del Oriente, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Villa Oriente Mz C Lt 8 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es Motocarrista. es así que Erika con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra de un motocarro.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un motocarro, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo para que salga a trabajar con su motocarro y de allí se dedica a la atención de sus hijos que aun son muy pequeños.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, pagará la cuota inicial de un motocarro.

Erika esta muy feliz, por que puede obtener sus ganancias de manera tranquila y sin necesidad de hacer mucho esfuerzo pues de esta manera también puede dedicarse al cuidado de sus pequeñas hijas y a los que haceres de su hogar.

loans.use: Pay the initial installment on the motorcar.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov S. is a villager in Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and pig breeder. Alhough her pig breeding business has improved, Mr. Pov S. would like to expand her business. Thus, Mr. Pov S. has decided to request a loan to buy more pigs to raise. His wife, Mrs. Ron Heang, is a farmer and she assists her husband in his business.

Mr. Pov S. is 34 and the father of a child who is too young to work or study. Previously, Mr. Pov S. obtained a loan to start pig breeding business. His wife and a child appear in the picture with Mr. Pov S..

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Para

texts.en:
Para K. lives in a single family with her husband and two children in Koteshwor. Her husband's name is Lalit K. and he works in a private office. They have one son and one daughter. Both of them are studying in secondary school.
Para opened her bag shop three years ago to help her husband in fulfilling the household expenses. She sells different types of bags like school and ladies bags in her shop. She buys these bags from the wholesale market. Now she is requesting a  $300 loan to expand her shop. She wants to buy different varieties of bags.
Para wants to use her income for her children’s education and she also wants to upgrade the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy bags

loans.name: Thi Nhi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Nhi, 44 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2007. Her first loan of 3,000,000VND (about 200USD) was used to invest in doing business and raising livestock. Her business of supplying fresh eels, snakes and frogs for restaurants brings about a high profit of 200,000VND (about 13USD) each day. Apart from doing business, her family also invests in rearing pigs. Currently, she has 8 pigs, so each year she sells out an average of 2 tonnes of pigs, earning high profit. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550.00USD) to invest in rearing pigs. Her average monthly income is 6,000,000VND (about 400USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Nhị 44 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007 vòng vốn đầu gia đình chị xin vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán và chăn nuôi. Với nghề buôn bán đồ tươi sống như lươn, rắn, ếch gia đình chị chuyên cung cấp cho các nhà hàng, đây là một mặt hàng đặc sản nên thu nhập rất cao bình quân mỗi ngày lãi 200.000đ. Ngoài việc buôn bán gia đình chị còn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, hiên tại gia đình chị đang nuôi 8 con lợn thịt bình quân mỗi năm gia đình chị xuất 2 tấn lợn ra thị trường thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của gia đình chị cũng rất cao. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Rearing Pigs

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi is 40 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 19, 15, and 8 years old. She has been a charcoal and bites (chapati) seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $85 from her sales.

Mkasi is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Narti

texts.id: Sebagai ibu rumah tangga Ni Ketut Narti mempunyai cita-cita menjadi sorang peternak babi yang sukses, dengan tekun ia menjalankan usaha ternak babi yang selama ini sudah ia jalani  lebih dari 15 tahun. Dalam satu periode pemeliharaan Ni Ketut Narti biasanya memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan yang akan di panen 5 bulan kemudian dengan keuntungan bisa di peroleh antara Rp. 250.000,- sampai Rp. 300.000,- per ekornya. Ni Ketut Narti mengaku dalam menjalankan usahanya ia sering kekurangan modal untuk membeli pakan maupun menambah jumlah bibit yang akan dipeliharanya, oleh karena itu Ni Ketut Narti memutuskan untuk mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelolah oleh DINARI dan mendapat pinjaman modal awal sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,-  dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pembayarannya di akhir periode membuat Ni Ketut Nantri sangat senang karena ia bisa mengembangkan usahanya. pinjaman yang di dapat dipergunakan untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit babi penggemukan dan sisanya untuk membeli pakan. Ni Ketut Narti sangat berharap melalui pendampingan yang diberikan oleh DINARI usahanya bisa lebih berkembang dan dapat menhasilkan keuntungan yang lebih besar dari usaha sebelumnya sehingga bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Narti aspires to be a successful pig farmer. She has been farming pigs for the last 15 years. In one growing cycle, she usually farms 2 pigs that is fattened and slaughtered after 5 months. She can earn about $27 - $33 per pigs. Ni Ketut Narti often experiences insufficient funds availability to purchase feeds or increasing numbers of farmed pigs. Therefore, Ni Ketut Narti decided to join DINARI's pig farming program and applying for a $525 loan with 6 month tenor. She is going to use the loan to purchase 4 fattening pig and feeds. Ni Ketut Narti is hopeful that DINARI's assistance will help her develop her farm and increase her farm's profitability, so she can improve her family's economic condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fattening pigs and feeds

loans.name: Aissatou P.

texts.fr: Aissatou P D., 32 ans, mariée, 06 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des arachides qu’elle décortique et transforme en pâte d’arachide pour vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Aissatou P. D., 32, married and raising 6 children, has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for 5 and a half years. She wants a loan to buy peanuts which she shells and transforms into peanut butter for sale. Her income allows her to help support her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of peanuts, dead wood, buckets, and payment of labor

loans.name: Niño Emanuel Group

texts.en:
The Niño Emanuel (“Emmanuel Child”) Village Bank is located in the Ccachuaram community of Ascensión District, in the Huancavelica Department of central Peru. This community is located two kilometers from the city. 

Ernestina C. lives with her common-law husband and their five children. Her husband is a baker, and she helps him distribute bread to different stores in the morning, then she sells bread at the door of the bakery. She needs this loan to buy fruitcake for the Christmas season. Her dream is for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to be able to pay for a course so that her husband can learn to bake new products to be more competitive in the market. 

Teodora Alfonso is divorced. She has been selling prepared meals at local markets ever since her husband left her. Teodora is in delicate health. She would like to buy more utensils for the meals that she sells to help expand her business. She wants her children to go to school and to graduate with professional degrees. 

Antonia R. is married and sells sweets near the entrance of a school in the Ascensión District. She got the idea for this business years ago, but her husband’s income wasn’t enough to start. With loans, she has been able to offer more products, and with the income she earns she helps pay for household expenses and the cost of schooling her children. Antonia is saving to pay for college for her son, who is finishing high school this year. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Bancomunal Niño Emanuel, ubicado en L. comunidad D. Ccachuaram en el distrito D. Ascensión en L. provincia y departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad se encuentra a 2 kilometros D. L. ciudad.

Ernestina C., es conviviente, tiene 5 hijos, su esposo es panadero y le ayuda a repartir en las mañanas pan a todas las tiendas, después elL. misma se pone a vender en L. puerta D. L. panadería. Necesita su préstamo para invertir en L. preparación D. panteones por campaña naviD.ña. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y poder pagar un curso para que su esposo pueda variar en L. preparación D. productos y poder competir en el mercado.

Teodora Alfonso, es divorciada, desD. que su esposo L. abandonó se dedica a L. venta D. comida en ferias los sábados y domingos. Teodora se encuentra delicada D. salud, le gustaría comprar mas utensilios para L. venta D. su comida y así incrementar su negocio, pues desea que su hijo estudie y sea profesional.

Antonia R., es casada, se dedica a L. venta D. golosinas en L. puerta D. una escueL. del distrito D. Ascensión. Hace años tenia esa idea pero no le alcanzaba con los ingresos D. su esposo, con sus prestamos incrementa mercadería y con las ganancias aporta en su casa y ayuda con los gastos D. L. escueL.. Antonia esta ahorrando para L. inscripción D. L. Universidad D. su hijo que este año termina el colegio.

loans.use: To buy fruitcake, utensils and sweets

loans.name: Navoneiwa

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and SELFINA!  This is 32 year old Navoneiwa R J.. She is married with three children between the ages of 5 and 19 and she is proud to report that all of them are in school.

In April 2008, she started a shoe selling business and has been running it since with the assistance of her husband. Her business has been doing well and her monthly profits are about USD100. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional shoes, sandals and slippers. Due to the success of this business, she hopes to be able to open another business in the future. She thanks you in advance for your support! 

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional shoes, sandals and slippers

loans.name: Idoyatullo

texts.en:
Idoyatullo is 34 years old. He is a married man with four children. Idoyatullo’s main source of income is in the transportation sector. He has a vehicle with which he travels through Dushanbe city. With this activity, Idoyatullo supports his four children and his wife. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair the engine of his car and buy new tires. This will allow him to better provide for his family. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Repairing the engine of his car (taxi) and purchasing new tires

loans.name: Hermila

texts.es:
Hermila inició el negocio por ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Comenzó el negocio en el año de 1998 platicando con su esposo decidieron comenzar a vender dulces y refrescos y les dio resultado, fueron invirtiendo en otros productos haciendo cada vez mas grande su tiendita y su negocio ha ido progresando bien ya que la gente de  su localidad acude a su negocio teniendo buenas ganancias y así reinvierte y va  aumentando su inventario de mercancías.  Lo que le ayuda es que no tiene competencia cerca por lo que goza de buena afluencia de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $6,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar mercancía y continuar exitosamente su negocio.
texts.en:
Hermila started her business to help her husband with the household expenses. She opened in 1998 when after chatting with her husband they decided to begin selling candies and refreshments. The business was successful and they invested in other products, each time enlarging her little store and her business has continued to do well as her neighbours come to her store to buy. The store has generated good profits and so she has reinvested them and continues to increase her inventory. Their greatest asset is that there is no competition nearby and so they enjoy a good influx of customers. She needs a MXN $6,000 loan which she will repay in 12 bi-weekly installments to buy merchandise and successfully continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es: El señor Eustaquio F. C. y su esposa viven los dos solos en su casa, ya que sus hijos ya  han formado su  propia familia y cada quien vive en su casa.  Los señores dedican a la venta de ropa usada, zapatos y accesorios para el hogar, a esta actividad se dedican desde hace 14 años. Ellos fueron de las primeras personas que vendían pulga en una de las instalaciones frente a un centro comercial de esta misma ciudad. Ahora están solicitando un préstamo para comprar mas mercancía y así  su ingresos aumenten.
texts.en:
Eustaquio F. C. and his wife live alone in their house since their children are already raising their own families in their own houses. They have been selling used clothing, shoes, and household accessories for 14 years. They were the first people to sell like a flea market at one of the facilities in front of a mall in their city. Now they are requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise so they can earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for the business

loans.name: Abdulahmid

texts.ru: Абдулхамид отец четверых детей. Работает в колхозе, кроме того, торгует по выходным на рынках. Ему помогает его старший сын. Его бизнес – купля продажа сухофруктов. Оборот бизнеса небольшой, планирует расширить его. Займ хочет получить в виде небольшой суммы, чтобы обучиться работать с заемными деньгами. В дальнейшем планирует получать займы вновь и в больших суммах.
texts.en:
Abdulahmid is a father of four children. He works in a collective farm and also sells on the market on the weekends. His oldest son helps him. His business is resale of dry fruits. The business does not have a large turnover, but Abdulahmid plans to expand it. He wants to get a small loan so he can learn to work with a credit. In the future he plans to get bigger loans.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche O. sells motor spare parts. He is 26 years old and married with a child. His wife also helps in taking care of the business when he is not around. He hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem D., 48, and her husband, Mr. Ly Vorn, 46, were married in 1988 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home. The other five attend school. The family lives along national road number one, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Soem and her husband have been selling vegetables for five years; they buy them from their village for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. Soem’s husband wants to start another new business,  therefore she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive as a motor remoque taxi. (remoque is a motorbike with a trailer at the back which can carry more goods and people).

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive as a motor remoque taxi.

loans.name: Mari Rosabeth

texts.es:
La señora Mari Rosabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo”, vive en el Jr. Prolog. Sargento Lores  Nº 141, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años y es madre de 2 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Mari, se inicio con S/. 500.00 y por iniciativa propia fue quien decidió emprender su negocio de venta de abarrotes, empezó primero con pocos productos para vender, luego fue implementando mas su negocio, ahora vende mas y ya es conocida por sus clientes, vecinos y amigos.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, cuenta con un local especialmente  acondicionado en su propia casa, donde atiende a sus clientes con amabilidad y el buen carisma que tiene.

Con el prestamo de S/. 1,000.0 lo invertirá comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, y también útiles escolares como lapiceros, lápices, plumones, correctores, borradores, cartulinas y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es una mujer muy luchadora y constante en sus metas que desea lograr y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Mari, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer, así mismo ayudar a muchas mujeres que quieren salir a delante.
texts.en:
Mari Rosabeth belongs to the “El Abiseo” Cooperative Bank, and lives on Sargento Lores Street in the Juanjui district of San Martín. She is married, 38 years old, and the mother of 2 children who still depend on her financially. Maria started with 500 soles and, through her own initiative, decided to start her business selling groceries. She started with just a few items to sell, and later began expanding her business more. She now sells many products, and is well known to her customers, neighbors, and friends. She currently continues in this business, and has set aside and outfitted an area in her own home where she tends to her customers with her friendly and charismatic nature. She plans to invest the loan of 1,000 soles into purchasing more products such as rice and sugar, toilet paper, milk, canned fish, personal hygiene products, cleaning supplies for the home, and also school supplies such as pens, pencils, magic markers, erasers, poster board, and varied products to keep her customers happy. She makes the decisions regarding her business’ earnings. On the personal side, she tells us she is a hard-working woman who keeps sight of her goals to succeed and be responsible with her loan payments. Mari is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and woman, as well as for assisting many women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to supply her general store.

loans.name: Phan Thị

texts.en:
Phan Thị B. is a 50 year old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 4 adult aged children. To making a living, B. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  B. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, B. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. B. is now requesting a new loan of 13000000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Por Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es:
el gupo por un futuro mejor esta consyituido por tres mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras y tienen un espiritu de superacion muy grande, ellas se llevan muy bien, son muy amigas y confian mucho la una con la otra, una de las caracteristicas de este grupo es que son unas muejeres muy honrradas.
las actividades que ellas desarollan son las siguientes;
Martina C.: se dedica al comercio desde hace 10 años, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo, negocio que tiene ebicado frente al bulevar las Democracias de la ciudad de danli, ella tiene 70 años de edad y mantiene un buen espiritu de trabajo.
Martina es soltera y con ella vive una nieta, la misma que ella le paga todo al 100%, para martina la edad no ha sido un obstaculo para trabajar y salir adelante, con los ingresos que ella genera de su negocio a construido su vivienda, ella hizo 3 cuartos para alquiler y con esos ingresos ella cubre sus gastos personales.
Maria Benita C.: tiene 2 años de haber iniciado con su negocio el cual se basa en la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo, ella tiene su negocio en el mercado Nuevo Amanecer de la ciudad de Danli, ella es casada y madre d 4 hijos, su esposo labora para una fabrica de tabacos, ella tomo la desicion de dedicarse al negocio para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Maria C.: se dedica a la venta de verduras, arroz y pastas, desde que ella tenia 15 años de edad se dedica a este negocio, ella cuenta con 30 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, ella esta casada y tiene 9 hijos, cinco de ellos le ayudan a vender su producto en diferentes lugares cercanos de donde ella vive.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “Por un Futuro Mejor” (Towards a Better Future) is made up of three hard-working women. They have a strong will to overcome obstacles, get on well together, are great friends and trust each other. One of the characteristics of this group is that they are all reputable women. They wish to expand the following businesses: Martina C. has been in business for ten years, primarily selling new clothes and footwear. Her business is located opposite Democracias Boulevard in the town of Danli. She is 70 years old and still a hard worker. Martina is single and has a granddaugher living with her whom she supports 100%. Age has never been an obstacle to working hard and doing well. With the income that she earns from her business, she has built her own house in which she has three rooms to rent. The money she gets from them pays her personal expenses. Maria Benita C. began her business two years ago selling new clothing and footwear. It is situated in the Nuevo Amanecer market in the town of Danli. Maria is married with four children; her husband works in a tobacco factory. She made the decision to start a business so she could help her husband with the household expenses. Ever since she was 15 years old, Maria C. has earned her living by selling vegetables, rice, and pasta—she now has 30 years of experience doing this work. Maria is married with nine children, five of whom help her by selling the foodstuffs in different places close to where she lives. All of the women need a loan so that they and their families can improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear, clothing, and foodstuffs

loans.name: Mojisola

texts.en: Mojisola sells hair extensions and hair cream; she is also a stylist. Mojisola has been in the business for the past 15 years and she lives in Lagos State. She is 34 years old and married with 3 children. Mojisola is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She says thanks you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell

loans.name: Lorgia Lourdes

texts.es: La Señora Lorgia Lourdes L. L. con la edad de 31 años de edad.es una mujer casada y vive con su hijo de 2 años de edad. El negocio de Doña Lourdes es una pulpería hace mas 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, empezó a vender golosinas a los niños que pasaban de la escuela por lo que ha luchado mucho para obtener este medio de vida. Actualmente realiza sus compras en los camiones que distribuyen los productos que ella compra. el sueno de la Señora Lourdes es hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar las ganancias para salir adelante ya que esta situación es muy difícil para ella a pesar del inconveniente que tiene como es  que una muchacha  le ayude pero  debido a sus pocos ingresos no se lo permite.
texts.en:
Señora Lorgia Lourdes L. L., at the age of 31-years-old, is a married woman and lives with her 2-year-old son. The business of Mrs Lourdes is a store that she has run for more than 10 years. She is dedicated to this business. She began to sell sweets to the children that passed from the school that she has fought a lot to obtain half of her life. At present she purchases from the trucks that distribute the products that she buys. The dream of Señora Lourdes is to grow her business and to increase her profits to do well since this situation is very difficult for her. She would like to hire a girl to help her, but her income is too small to allow it.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for her candy sales business

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a 45 year single mother of four children aged 19 and 25 years. Two of her children go to Teopista is a 45 year single mother of four children aged 19 and 25 years. Two of her children school. She resides and owns a four roomed house where she is staying with five people. Teopista takes care of two additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area where she  is a market vendor. She doesn’t incur any transportation charges as she buys from her place of work. Teopista sells sweet bananas in Naguru Market and on average she she sells to 15 customers a day. Teopista sells to all categories of people and works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, Feeding the family and monthly market dues. She has been in this business for the last thirteen years Teopista has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy banana clusters Teopista is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger ,and also going to villages directly without involving a third party 
 

.

loans.use: To buy more sweet banana clusters

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La señora Rosalía, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 51 años y 03 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.Lleva 12 años dedicándose a la venta de Abarrotes. Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos y seguir generando sus propios ingresos le motivaron a emprender su negocio, muy bien establecido que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa en un ambiente acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Las ganancias que genera a diario, la ayuda al ingreso económico  en su familia. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Rosalía, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y prepararse para hacer frente a las adversidades de la vida  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.

loans.use: Invertirá comprando, abarrotes para aumentar su stock

loans.name: Yasmina Ivette

texts.es:
La señora Yasmina G. posee su propio negocio de pulpería en su establecimiento en el departamento de Chinandega específicamente en el municipio El Viejo donde ofrece todo tipo de productos comestibles.

Ella ha venido desarrollando poco a poco su negocio logrando satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes pero con mucha necesidad de invertir en dicho negocio para desarrollarlo y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos y de esta manera continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yasmina G. has her own mini market in the Chinandega department, specifically in the El Viejo municipality. She sells all types of food products. She has been developing her business little by little. She has been able to meet her customers’ needs, but she really needs to invest in the business to develop it. That is the reason she has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan. The loan is to buy products and continue in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Om T., 55, is a widow with one married child and resides in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been selling rice noodle and porridge in her community for about US$15 in revenue each day and is aided by her daughter who sells chickens at the market. Om T. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter and leftover is reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and reinvest in business.

loans.name: Jonniz

texts.en:
Jonniz T. is from the village of Barangay 26, Kahulogan, Gingoog City. He is 24 years old. Jonniz is married and has one child, an infant. To make a living, Jonniz makes and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, his main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling boiled corn. Jonniz has been engaged in his business for more than a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jonniz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situaT. and ability to engage in business activities. Jonniz is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jonniz from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income and as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translaT. by Kiva.  Given that manual translaT. of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate informaT. to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

location.town: Barangay 26, Kahulogan, Gingoog City, Misamis Orie

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gynecological equipment

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie B. is from the village of Liposong Ozamiz City. He is 24 years old. Leslie is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Leslie owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Leslie has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leslie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leslie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Leslie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leslie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia P. is from the town of Turod Norte, Cordon. She is 46 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Ophelia owns and operates a business selling cosmetics products. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month.

In 2009, Ophelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Ophelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to buy more products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for business

loans.name: Femae

texts.en:
Femae M. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. Femae is 40 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Femae owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies. Femae has just started this business.

In 2009, Femae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Femae is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the food products. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Femae from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for food production

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to one child who is currently in school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Gloria is a baker, procuring bags of flour from nearby communities. She bakes bread and supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk

loans.name: Blessing Children Group

texts.en:
Watta K. is 40 years old and married with three children whose ages range from nine to 18 years old.  Her children are all in school, with the youngest in fifth grade and the oldest a freshman in the university.  Watta herself was never able to go to school and has difficulty reading and writing.
