Watta started her business selling cloth, fabric, thread, and linen about 21 years ago with $40 U.S. in starter capital provided by her father as a wedding gift.  Watta sells at the Red Light Market, a bustling area full of shops, stalls, and tabletop and mobile sellers and trades people.  Red Light is Liberia's largest market and is on the outskirts of Monrovia, the capital of the country.  Watta credits her success at business with talking to customers in a polite manner.

Watta plans to use her 12,000 Liberian dollar share of this 60,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy trousers, wedding garments, and other goods for her business.  Someday, she dreams of getting into real estate as a business.  She also hopes that she will continue to be successful enough to support her children so they can improve their lives.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Watta is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy clothes, fabric, thread, and linen.

loans.name: Maria Lyn

texts.en:
Maria Lyn P. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 26 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. Maria Lyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Maria Lyn has been involved in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Maria Lyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Lyn is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: It

texts.en:
Mrs. It C. (pictured above), 56, and her husband, Mr. Hout Khloeng, 62, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 km from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1970 and have eight children: six sons and two daughters. Four of the children are married and live outside the family home, one attends school and the other three children weave silk at home.    

It has been a silk weaver for 25 years, a skill she learned from her aunt. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. It is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her and her children’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her and her children’s weaving business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es una madre muy trabajadora, tiene 33 años y vive al lado de su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Actualmente viven en el segundo piso de la casa de su madre.

Al tener que cuidar a su pequeño hijo se decidió por un negocio que le diera las facilidades de realizarlo en los horarios de su conveniencia; es así que desde algún tiempo viene dedicándose a la venta de zapatos y zapatillas a pedido. Vilma recibe solicitudes de sus vecinas, a las cuales ofrece gran variedad de diseños, colores y precios los cuales se ajusten a sus necesidades.
A Vilma le gusta su trabajo porque gracias a él puede pasar todo el tiempo posible con su pequeño y además apoya con los gastos en el hogar, mientras su esposo trabajo como electricista. En un futuro quiere tener una tienda o algún negocio más estable, pero cuando su hijo sea más grande, por el momento se siente cómoda con su actual actividad.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente muy contenta con esta institución, por lo que promete ser muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, tal como lo fue en su anterior préstamo. Con el dinero del crédito comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para aumentar su ventas.
texts.en:
Vilma is a hard-working 33-year old mother who lives with her husband and young son. They currently live on the second floor of her mother's house. Because she needed to take care of her young son, she decided on a business that would give her flexible hours, and so for some time has been selling dress shoes and sneakers by special order. Vilma receives orders from her neighbors, whom she offers a wide variety of designs, colors, and prices, depending on their needs. Vilma likes her work because it allows her to spend as much time as possible with her little one and also helps with household expenses. Her husband works as an electrician. In the future, she wants to have a store or a more stable business, but only when her son is older. For now her work suits her situation. This is her second loan with MFP and she's very happy with the organization, so she promises to be very punctual with her payments, as she was with her previous loan. She will use the money from the loan to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta González Velázquez  es una señora de 51 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus 2  hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña  Marta y su familia   se han dedicado  toda su vida  a la agricultura, especialmente se ha interesado en el engorde de cerdos para su venta. Ella dice que nunca ha tenido su propio negocio y que  su situación económica la ha  motivo a buscar otros ingresos para mantener a sus hijos en la estudiando y mejorar su calidad de  vida.

Ella  desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢665000 (seiscientos sesenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar más cerdos y mejorar las condiciones de cuido e Infraestructura. Con este préstamo espera abastecer la demanda de carne de cerdo que hay en su comunidad y así  hacer crecer poco a poco su negocio hasta llegar hacer una microempresaria exitosa

Doña Marte es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo  y con el espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos. Asegura que este tipo de organización motivan a las personas para  seguir adelante y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Marta González Velázquez is a 51 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children in a community called Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. The community is situated in a mountainous area near the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are ranching and farming, with specific emphasis on the cultivation of grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Doña Marta and her family have dedicated their entire lives to agriculture. She is especially interested in fattening pigs to sell. Doña Marta never had her own business and her situation motivated her to look for other sources of income to support her children with their studies and improve their quality of life.

She wants to obtain a microloan in the amount of 665,000 CRC to purchase more pigs and improve the infrastructure for raising them. With this loan she hopes to meet the demand for pork in her community. In doing so, she hopes to increase her business gradually so that she becomes a successful micro-entrepreneur.

Doña Marte is a member of the Manantial de Santa Fe Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan and she hopes to improve her quality of life and that of her children. She says that these types of organizations motivate people to succeed and improve their position in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs & improve the conditions raising them

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN” se reúnen cada treinta días en oficina central de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la Ciudad del Cusco.  El banco comunal está representado por las señoras; Graciela que es la presidente, William que es el secretario, Juan Antonio que es el tesorero y Agustina que es la fiscal. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el IV ciclo y está conformado por 13 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios es por ejemplo; venta de comida, venta de madera, venta de ropa y artefactos de segundo uso. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios como por ejemplo seguridad de calles, carpintería, obrero de la municipalidad  de San Sebastián, lavado de ropa y construcción de estructuras metálicas. 

Graciela, tiene 47 años, es casada, tiene seis hijos y su actividad principal junto con su esposo es la fabricación, distribución y venta de muebles de madera, Su espeso Alejandro es carpintero de oficio y se dedica a la fabricación de los muebles, Graciela en el proceso de fabricación de muebles se encarga del acabado del mueble.  Una vez acabado el mueble Graciela junto con su esposo distribuyen y venden los muebles en el mercado del Molino I de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 13 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone a su trabajo, ella requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar materiales como por ejemplo tripley, chapas, jaladores, madera, laca, barniz y clavos. La socia nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que su esposo se accidentó con la maquina circular y dejó de trabajar pero ahora se está recuperando satisfactoriamente. El anhelo de la socia es terminar de construir su casa.   

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the “MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN” communal bank meet every 30 days in the main office of the microfinance unit of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. The communal bank is represented by Graciela, the president; William, the secretary; Juan Antonio, the treasurer; and Agustina, the comptroller. Currently, the communal bank is in its 4th loan cycle, and it is maD. up of 13 hard-working and enterprising people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and ways to proviD. a better future for their children through their daily efforts. The economic activities of some of the members incluD. selling food, wood, clothes or secondhand goods. Other members proviD. services, such as street security, carpentry, manual labor for the municipality of San Sebastián, laundering clothes, and building metal structures. Graciela is 47 years old and married with six children. Her main economic activity, which she carries out together with her husband, is producing, distributing and selling wooden furniture. Her husband Alejandro is a carpenter by traD., and he makes the furniture, while Graciela is in charge of finishing it. Once the furniture is finished, Graciela and her husband distribute and sell their products at the city of Cusco's "Molino I" market. Graciela has operated this business for 13 years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs this loan to increase the working capital of the business; she would like to buy materials such as wood, plywood, veneer, sponges, lacquer, varnish and nails. Graciela tells us with great sadness that her husband had an accident with the circular saw and stopped working, but he is now recovering satisfactorily. Graciela's dream is to finish building her house. All of the members value and appreciate the loan provided to them in this manner, and they are committed to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing capital by purchasing materials such as plywood, veneer, sponges, wood, lacquer, varnish and nails

loans.name: Herminia's Group

texts.en:
Herminia A. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Herminia is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Herminia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Herminia owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Herminia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Herminia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herminia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Herminia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Herminia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tunh

texts.en: Tunh V., 35, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She is a farmer who grows rice and raises animals for an income of about US $5 per day. Her husband is both a farmer and a construction worker, earning an income of US $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. V. is requesting a loan of US $700 to buy cows and pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy cows and pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 24 años, convive su pareja y sus hijos Cristhian y Diego de 7 y 2 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos residen en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, donde tienen su propia casa. Yolanda recuerda que se inició desde su adolescencia estando en la chacra de sus padres, comenzó a pasar mayor parte de su tiempo sembrando y cosechando los productos de cacao y café y de esa manera vio una oportunidad de que el cacao tenía gran demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, es por ello empezó a independizarse de sus padres, no sin antes de agradecerles por las lecciones que le dieron. Actualmente el cacao produce en grandes cantidades, generándole buenos rentas, para ello trata de cuidar de las plagas que afecten dicho producto. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja, pero en temporadas de cosecha necesita la ayuda de operarios que le puedan facilitar la extracción de su producto de manera eficiente y eficaz. Usualmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad a un precio razonable. Su mayor anhelo es tener una tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de obtener otros ingresos extras, ya que su producto es por temporadas y eso le ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar durante las fechas pactadas, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal ya que todos se solidarizan entre sí. Con el crédito que solicita, servirá para darle mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, adquiriendo insumos y abono, con el propósito mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 24 years old. She lives with her spouse and children, Cristhian and Diego, who are 7 and 2, respectively. They live together in the Peruvian jungle, located in the community of Sirenachayocc, where they have their own house. Yolanda remembers that she she started as a teenager in her parents field. She began to spend most of her time planting and harvesting cacao and coffee and that is how she saw that cacao is in high demand nationally and internationally. That is why she began to become independent from her parents, not befO. thanking them for the lessons they had taught her. At present, she produces cacao in large quantities, generating a good income. She tries to be careful of the diseases that can affect that product. At times she receives help from her spouse, but at harvest time she needs help from laborers who can facilitate the extraction of her product efficiently and effectively. Usually, she sells her product at the stockpiler's in her own community at a reasonable price. Her greatest wish is to have a grocery stO. with the purpose of having extra income, since her product is seasonal and this will help her family's quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP. She is committed to making the payments according to schedule. She also likes to work with her communal group since everyone supports each other. With the loan she is asking for, she will maintain her caco crops, acquiring materials and fertilizer, in order to improve her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and materials to improve the cacao production.

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Five members who live in Kor village in Takeo province make up this group loan. Mrs. Thol S. is the group leader, selected by the other members; each will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Thol S. is 32 years old. She is a weaver at her home and she is a pig breeder, too. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Ouch, is a soldier and a farmer who owns one-hectare of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support his family. 

Now they have a problem because Mrs. Thol S.'s pigs are too small to sell. So Mrs. Thol S. is asking for a loan to buy pig feed; with the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer. She is a mother of three children all of whom are studying in local public schools.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A. is from the village of Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 38 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Elena owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling charcoal in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is a hairdresser in Elmina. Aba has no formal education. She is married and takes care of two children. Her husband is a driver. Aba has been a hairdresser for four years. She helps her husband maintain the home. Her loan will be used to acquire more hair creams and hair extensions to meet the demand of her customers. She is confident she will save the new profits from her business to buy an additional dryer.

loans.use: To acquire more hair creams and hair extensions

loans.name: Georgina Kalekye

texts.en:
Georgina is a 26-year-old lady. She has a retail shop where she sells general items such as maize flour, wheat flour, bread, margarine and toothpaste. She has been in the business for a period of ten years now, with a monthly profit of about $260 per month.

She wants to use her loan to add more stock of maize flour, wheat flour and bread. With her profit she hopes to increase her business to be a mini supermarket. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To add more stock of maize flour, wheat flour and bread

loans.name: Elsa Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elsa; ella tiene 69 años de edad y es viuda, 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista,  la socia vende comida en el grifo San Jerónimo; desde hace 15 años. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes e insumos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "Mi Peru." The bank is located in the district of Santiago in the province and region of Cusco. Ms. Elsa, 69, is a widow with three children. She works in retail and has sold food at the San Jerónimo gas station for the past 15 years. Elsa requests a loan to buy supplies and ingredients for her business. She expresses gratitude to all those who have formed part of this dream through this medium and she promises to make all her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Kuluipa

texts.en:
Kuluipa T. is the resident of Balykchi, a nice city in Isykul region. Kuluipa is 43 years old and she is married. She has a son and a daughter, both of them are at school. Fifteen years ago, with the initial investment of 15000 soms, Kuluipa started to purchase dishes in Bishkek and then resell them at a higher price in Balykchi. In this way, she makes 25000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save money and purchase a house. 

With money received from this loan she wants to purchase more dishes in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education and to save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase dishes.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma Y. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 50 years old, married and has six grown-up children. She is from the village of Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. Elma has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Elma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Cornelio Nera

texts.pt:
Cornélio Nera M. conseguiu comprar todo o material acordado com a instituição, e também foi aplicado no proposito acordado.

Conseguiu pagar devidamente segundo o acordado e não enfrentou dificuldades, neste momento a sua obra encontra se num estagio avançado.

Com o novo empréstimo no valor de 13.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia e pagar o construtor) para dar um bom avanço na sua obra. 
Sente se realizado com nova mudança da sua casa e ainda obteve 2 netos, no futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e confortar a sua família.
texts.en:
Cornélio Nera M. will use this loan, in the amount of 13.000.00mt, to buy more cement and sand and to pay the construction workers' wages. The work on his house is at an advanced stage. 

He used his previous loan for the same purpose and paid it back in a timely fashion. He plans to apply for more loans in the future to finalize the work on the house and make it comfortable for his family. Cornélio is excited by the birth of two of his grandchildren and the prospect of moving to the new house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, sand) and pay workers' wages

loans.name: Patrón San Pedro Cuyo Chico Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SAN PEDRO CUYO CHICO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cuyo Chico, perteneciente a la provincia D. Calca y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Juana Hilda; ella tiene 48 años D. edad y es divorciada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta D. bebidas gaseosas y refrescos, ella venD. en su casa en forma independiente desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cajas D. gaseosas y vasos para que venda las bebidas.


Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. bebidas, restaurant, agricultura, artesanía, venta D. comida y  producción D. collares.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the Patrón San Pedro Cuyo Chico communal bank, located in the district of Cuyo Chico, which is part of the Calca province and in the department of Cusco.

Juana Hilda is 48 years old, divorced, and has five children. She works independently selling sodas and refreshments from her home from 9am to 6pm. Through this business, Juana Hilda gets her children ahead. She wants to improve the business, and she is requesting the loan to purchase crates of soda and cups to sell the drinks.

The other group members work selling drinks, in a restaurant, in agriculture, in handicrafts, selling food, and making necklaces.

Juana Hilda is grateful for everyone who is making this dream possible and promises to make her payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase crates of soda and cups for selling the drinks.

loans.name: América

texts.es:
América es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector Santa Clara del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de ganado vacuno. Ella adquiere vacas a sus vecinos y las engorda para luego revenderlas a los negociantes que siempre vienen a visitarla, el negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo de la mejor manera.

América desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más ganado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar, las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer bastante responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
America is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Santa Clara in the district of Pítipo. It is an agricultural area in the province of Ferreñafe, over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

America works selling cattle. She buys cows from her neighbors and works to fatten them to sell to traders who come to visit her. Her business is an important source of income for her family, and for this reason she tries to run it as best she can.  

America would like to expand her business by purchasing more cattle. She has asked Edpyme Alternativa [the Kiva field partner] for a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles to help her achieve this goal. She is a woman with a great desire to do better and get ahead in life, and those who know her consider her responsible and hardworking.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle for fattening and eventual sale

loans.name: Angel Lindorfo

texts.es:
Angel Lindorfo Q. C. tiene 58 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es crecer en el negocio y tener salud para trabajar.

Le gusta hacer viajes en el carro.
texts.en:
Angel Lindorfo Q. C. is 58 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 7 children.

The 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress) solidarity group is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group is engaged in farming and other professional tasks.  The group has 17 members.

Angel is a farmer and he grows corn, beans, peas and 'chocho' (a type of bean native to the region).  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells them in Chillanes market and district.

Angel is requesting this loan to buy corn, bean, pea and 'chocho' seeds.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to grow in his business and to remain in good health so that he can work.  He likes to go for rides in his car.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 23-year-old businessman.  He has been operating his barber shop for two years.  He gained experience running his business from working previously in a barber shop.  He is glad that since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money with his group members on a weekly basis.  Currently, his barber shop is small and cannot accommodate more than five customers at a time.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to enlarge his business premise and buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: To enlarge business premise and buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food supplies for her business such as meat, rice, and sugar, among other items

loans.name: Arlen Verónica

texts.es:
Doña Arlen Verónica S. trabaja como auxiliar  de oficina en una Universidad, desde hace 5 años.

Ella es casada con 1 persona que depende de ella, habita en la ciudad de Managua en el barrio Riguero ya tiene 3 años de vivir en este lugar.

Ella está solicitando este crédito para construir su vivienda agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle este crédito, ya que es una forma de poder construir su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Arlen Verónica S. lives has been living in the Riguero neighborhood of Managua for three years and has been working as an office assistant at a university for five years.  She is married and has one dependent.

She is asking for this credit so she can build her house.  She is grateful to CEPRODEL for granting her this loan, which will help her build her home and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo M. is 38 years old and married with three children. His spouse is a tailor and she helps Kyalo in meeting some of the family's financial needs. He runs a tyre retail shop in Eldama Ravine town.
 

Kyalo has been in this business for the last 15 years and it is the main source of his income. He has taken out a second loan of Kshs. 40,000 from KADET LTD after successfully paying for his first loan. From this business Kyalo gets a monthly gross income of Kshs 70,000. He plans to use the whole amount of the loan to purchase more stock of both new and second-hand tyres.


Kyalo plans to use his profit to educate his children and also expand his business. His dreams and hopes are to expand his business and be able to provide for his family adequately.

loans.use: To purchase stock of both new and second-hand tyres

loans.name: Sourng

texts.en:
Sourng S., 32, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. is a housewife while her husband is a recycler, earning an income of about $10.90 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $63 on food and $30 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more recyclable materials to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more recyclable materials to resell

loans.name: Lady Vanessa

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Lady, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 13, 9 y 6  años de edad  los mismos que estudian en colegio el mayor y en escuela los dos menores. El marido se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  también vende artículos para el hogar como licuadoras, planchas, tostadoras, etc.  Esto los vende a través de cartillas. Trabaja  tres días a la semana unas seis horas por dia. Ella  deja a crédito los productos a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Lo que es ropa la compra en Guayaquil y los productos para el hogar los recibe en una distribuidora en el centro de la ciudad de Portoviejo, nos cuenta que lleva 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido más o menos bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, pero sobre todo ropa de temporada playera. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 años. Su sueño es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the "Mujeres Organizadas" communal bank meets in the Rocafuente canton.  This location is well-known throughout the country for the delicious sweets made by the locals.

Here is where we meet Mrs. Lady who is 32 years old, has a common-law husband and three school-aged children, ages 13, 9 and 6.  Her husband works at a brick factory.

This member runs a door-to-door business selling all kinds of clothing and houshold items such as blenders, irons, toasters, etc.  She sells on a credit-based system, delivering the products and collecting payment every two weeks.  Her work hours are six a day, three days a week.  She buys clothing in Guayaquil and receives the other household merchandise from a distributor in downtown Portoviejo.  She has been active in this business for 9 years and says it has gone reasonably well.

The loan is to buy trousers, t-shirts, bloushes, children's clothing, especially for the beach season.  She's been in the communal bank for 4 years.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: To buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothing for the beach season

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: For the past four years Abena K. has been producing palm oil for sale. She also sells drinks. Abena lives together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a farmer. She contributes covering household expenses. She needs more palm fruits to be able to process oil in large quantity for sale. A loan will go a long way to help her expand her oil production business. The extra profit realized from the loan will be reinvested back into oil making.

loans.use: to expand her oil production by buying more palm fruits.

loans.name: Mina Chojlla Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”MINA CHOJLLA”, está iniciando su noveno ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de doce  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Juana. 

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos Tienda de barrio, venta de ají y verduras, zapatería, venta de ropa, venta de muebles, venta d comida, venta de frutas, trenzado de mantas.

La presidenta, la señora Juana es una mujer de 49 años es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Este es su quinto año que trabaja con asociaciones comunales,  desarrollando un negocio conjuntamente con su hija. 

En la actualidad vende comida y jugos en la zona Mina Chojlla, ella cuenta que, generalmente los ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas, los compra de la 16 de julio (zona comercial de El Alto); con el crédito que sacará comprara arroz, fideo y papa por mayor (porque es mas barato).

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella respondió que le gusta estar con las amigas, distraerse y pagar.
texts.en:
The “MINA CHOJLLA” communal bank is starting its 9th cycle in the Los Andes Focal Center.  This communal bank has 12 members.  Juana is the President of the governing board.

The members have different businesses.  Among them we have: neighborhood grocery store, chili and vegetable sales, shoe store, clothing sales, furniture sales, food sales, fruit sales and blanket weaving.

The President, Juana, is a 49 year old woman.  She’s married and has five children.  This is her fifth year of working with communal banks running a business with her daughter.

She sells juices and food in the Mina Chojlla area.  She relates that she usually buys her ingredients at the 16 de Julio market (El Alto’s commercial zone).  She will use the loan to buy rice, noodles and potatoes at wholesale (because it’s less expensive).

When we asked her what she liked best about Pro Mujer she answered that she likes being with her friends, to relax and to pay.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles and potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en: Racquel is 33 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Racquel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a 21,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sardines, groceries, etc., for her sari-sari store. Racquel has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 13 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Racquel aspires to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store business.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William C. Chacón, tiene la edad de 39 años, está casado  y vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El con el préstamo pretende realizar el arreglo del terreno para su posterior cosecha en grandes cantidades, también pagar la mano de obra de su siembra. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo y la experiencia de varios años  en el conocimiento del cultivo. Su meta es genera ganancias para su bienestar familiar y también para seguir invirtiendo en la próximas cosechas y obtener cada día más ganancias. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
William C. Chacón is 39 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children who are his top priorities. With this loan, he intends to prepare his land so that he can eventually harvest in large quantities. In addition, he will pay for the labor required for planting. William owns land that is suitable for growing his crop and has several years of farming experience. His goals are to generate income for the welfare of his family and to continue investing in subsequent crops so that he earn more profit each day.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. William has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting beans and to pay for labor.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Daniel le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior. 
Esta solicitando un presta para poder comprar el material que es pintura, cemento y para pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como cocinero de un restaurante en la vecina ciudad. Ya que su esposa la señora Ana Cecilia se encarga del cuidado de los tres hijos que tiene. 
Desean que el patrimonio de sus hijos este en buenas condiciones y seguro para ellos.
texts.en: José Daniel needs to finish off some work to the outside of his home.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy materials: paint and cement, and pay the person who will carry out the improvements.  He plans to repay his loan with the wage that he earns as a cook in a restaurant in a neighboring town.  His wife, Ana Cecilia, looks after their three children.  They would like their children's inheritance to be in a good and safe condition.

loans.use: to finish off some work to the outside of his home

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 41 years old and married, with 2 children. She has 3 years experience selling different crafts. She works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day and she employs four people to help her.

Clementine has requested her loan from Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying different crafts to sell. With this expansion, she hopes to earn more profits than before. This will enable her to reinvest in her business and to save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase different crafts to sell.

loans.name: Leonor Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Leonor es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 67 años, es viuda y tiene tres hijos.
El tiempo que lleva en Manuela Ramos es muy poco, pero quiere surtir mas su negocio porque todavía le faltan algunos productos que le solicitan sus clientes, además que su negocio está ubicado en una avenida muy transitada.  Ella tiene una pequeña bodega.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 bolsa D. pañales descartables, comida para cachorro,1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, 1 caja D. leche, 1 caja D. conservas, 2 tiras D. champú en sachet, y materiales D. limpieza como detergentes.
Su casa la comparte con su nieto, quien es el que le ayuda en su negocio en sus ratos libres, Leonor piensa que él será quien la cuiD. en su vejez.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos pueD. trabajar para ayudar a su nieto y  que no le falte nada para poder terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonor, 67, is a member of the Mujeres Del 2000 community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali.  She is a widow with three children.
Sra. Leonor owns a small corner shop.  She's new to Manuela Ramos and she wants to stock her business with the kinds of products that her customers are likely to ask for, especially since her business is located on a busy avenue.  
She will use this S/.1,000.00 new soles loan to buy bulk supplies of: disposable diapers; dog food; rice; sugar; milk; canned goods; shampoo; and cleaning products.  
Sra. Leonor shares her house with her grandson who also helps her with the business when he can.  She expects to depend on him when she can no longer care for herself.  
Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she can help her grandson so that he has everything he needs to build a career.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Oeum

texts.en: Mrs. Oeum has been earning a living by selling different kinds of vegetables, which she and her husband plant on their own farmland or buy from other local farmers in province of Siem Reap. They have given birth to six children; two of their children are employed while the remaining four go to school. Mrs. Oeum’s kids are concerned that they face difficulties in traveling to their workplace. They always travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own motor vehicle. To solve the trouble, Mrs. Oeum has requested a loan in the amount of $1200 to be used to buy a new motorcycle for her kids to ride to work without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her kids to ride to work without hiring a taxi.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 23 años, convive con Idayza de 18 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hermosas hijas. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito ecológico de Sivia. Daniel es un hombre laborioso, recuerda que tuvo que trabajar desde muy para ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar, pues eran muy humildes y lo que ganaban no le era suficiente. Es por esta razón que Daniel vio la oportunidad de incursionar en el mundo de los negocios e incursionó en el rubro del transporte fluvial, desde Sivia hasta CCatunrumi. Pero en un inicio  no le iba tan bien, pero su perseverancia hizo que pueda adaptarse a este trabajo, y así fue, ahora cuenta con muchos clientes que prefieren subirse a su bote, siempre ofreciendo servicio con seguridad y un trato cordial. Con el pasar de los años, el motor se fue deteriorando, por tal razón es que necesita un capital para poder comprarse un motor nuevo. Este será  su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda continuar ofreciendo el servicio de transporte fluvial. Con los 2,500 que solicita, comprará un nuevo motor.
texts.en:
Daniel is 23 years old.  He lives with 18 year-old Idayza and the couple have two beautiful daughters.  They live in their own home which is located in the ecological district of Sivia.

Daniel is a very hard-working man.  He recalls that he had to work from a very young age in order to help his parents with their household expenses as they were very humble people and what they earned didn't reach far enough.  For this reason, Daniel saw the opportunity of breaking into the world of business.  He started providing a river transport business between Sivia and Ccatunrumi.  At first, things didn't do very well but his perseverance meant that he was able to adapt to this work and he now has many customers who prefer to embark on his boat as he always offers a safe service and treats his customers well.  Over the years, his engine has been deteriorating and, for this reason, he needs capital to buy a new engine.

This will be Daniel's first loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you so that he can continue offering a river transport service.  Daniel will use the 2,500 Peruvian soles that he is requesting to buy a new engine.

loans.use: to buy a new vehicle

loans.name: Him

texts.en: From the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh, Mrs. Him is a 56 year-old widow woman and she is a good mother of four children, two of them are single and living under her care while the rest two are ready married and start to live in their own houses. She also relies on one of her kids who works at overseas as a worker. To earn living, Mrs. Him runs a small business by selling some fresh fish in the busy market next to her house. From this, she can be able to make an income approximately $5 each day for her family expenses.  Mrs. Him will be using a loan which she is requesting to purchase more fish to go on selling so she can increase her daily revenue by using Kiva loan. With the rest, she hopes to use for repairing her broken house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to go on selling and to repair her broken house.

loans.name: Miriam Leticia

texts.es: Doña Miriam de 26 años  y madre de 4 niños,quien únicamente curso el nivel primario  de escolaridad, por falta de recursos  en su familia, fue así  como ella  empezó a trabajar en la elaboración de delantales  los cuales son muy utilizadas por las mujeres indígenas fuera y dentro de su localidad, luego de casarse  inicio con su negocio propio el cual le ha ido bastante bien ya que gracias a Dios y al apoyo de su esposo logro adquirir  2 maquinas de coser, en lo que ella elabora su trabajo, ella solo realiza pedidos de varias personas donde ella se dio a conocer desde  soltera, ella solicita de capital para poder comprar materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos y algunos utensilios como agujas, aceite para darle mantenimiento a  sus maquinas, entre otros, y así poder seguir vendiendo  y percibir un ingreso sin salir de su casa donde puede atender a sus niños. Su meta es poder brindarle  trabajo a otras personas y vender por mayor  siendo así una mujer muy productiva y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Doña Miriam is 26 years old and the mother of four children. She was only able to finish her elementary school education because her family lacked the resources. As a result, she began making aprons that are widely used by the indigenous women who live outside and within her town. Miriam got married later and then started her own business, which has done quite well thanks to God and the support of her husband. She was able to acquire two sewing machines to use in her work. Miriam only works based on orders from different people who have known her since she was single.

She is requesting capital to buy raw materials for making woven articles and a few tools such as needles, oil for maintaining her machines, and other supplies. This will enable her to continue selling and generating income without having to leave her house so that she can look after her children. Her goals are to provide employment to other people, to sell in bulk, and to become a very productive and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies for weaving.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Selling cosmetics and other beauty products such as lotion, shampoo, body wash etc. is what Marlyn does. She has been earning a monthly net income of 4600 for the last 5 years from this operation. Marlyn is 36 years old, has a live-in partner, and is blessed with 5 children. They are living together in the village of San Pedro, Dapitan.

In 2010, Marlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.   Marlyn is requesting her 3rd loan of 14,999 PHP, which will be used to purchase more perfume and beauty products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: purchase perfume and beauty products to resell

location.town: Dipolog-San Pedro, Dapitan City, Zambo.Del Norte

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  Vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée   de 57 ans. Elle est enseignante de profession depuis 30 ans. Elle a choisi son métier par ambition et par amour du métier. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’éducation qu’elle inculque aux enfants et les résultats positifs sur tous les plans. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2007.  Elle y a déjà remboursé 3 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour la réfection d’une partie de la maison familiale. Ce financement ^participera a l’amélioration du cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou lives in Senegal. She is 57 years old and has been a teacher by profession for 30 years. She chose this profession out of ambition and for the love of it. What she finds the most interesting about it is the education she instills in the children and the positive results in all areas. 

She has been a member of a branch of the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC since February 2007. There, she has already repaid three previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for renovating part of the family house. This financing will help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the family house

loans.name: Wangnidekon Group

texts.fr: WANGNIDEKON est un  groupement composé de douze personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même hameau au Bénin. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Houndéhinso est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houndéhinso est âgée de 61 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Bienvenu. Le couple a six enfants, dont trois sont à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Depuis dix huit ans environs, Houndéhinso vend de l'huile de palme et des noix de palme dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Houndéhinso mène comme activité la vente de "sodabi" (boisson alcoolisée locale). Houndéhinso achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Houndéhinso et les autres membres du groupement WANGNIDEKON sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui leur servira à rehausser leur activité.
texts.en: WANGNIDEKON is a group of 12 people who all live in the same hamlet in Benin. This is their first loan request and is being made so that the group members can increase their level of business activity and fulfill their customer demand. The group´s representative is called Houndéhinso and has her hand raised in the picture. Houndéhinso is 61 years old and married to a farmer called Bienvenu. The couple have 6 children, some of whom go to school. They live together with 3 dependent children and both contribute towards the household expenses. Houndéhinso has been selling palm oil and palm nuts in her area for around 18 years, and has a sideline business selling "sodabi", a local alcoholic drink. She gets her supplies in Benin. She and the WANGNIDEKON group are requesting this first loan from ALIDé in order to enhance their businesses.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts, palm oil and "sodabi" for resale.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and none of them go to school. She has one additional family member (her mother). She sells bunches of bananas at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for less than a year. 

Madina has requested a loan of 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.  Madina generates additional income through cooked food vending. Her major challenge includes thieves and seasonality. Her goal and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to build rental houses. She lives in her house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en: Enhtur lives with his wife and kid in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in his father's yard in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He is recently married and just got a baby. His wife used to help with his business but due to her recent birth, she is not able to help him; instead, she take cares their baby. He started his coal reselling business in 2009; however, due to his recent marriage, he spent a lot of money, and he is willing to increase his asset. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I have a lot of responsibility now. I need to support my wife and child." He is requesting 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more coal.

loans.use: To purchase more coal.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Umoja Group in Western Kenya! Getrude is the facilitator of the Umoja group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Getrude takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to best prices offered by the firm and in order to access fertilizer. In the recent 2011 season, Getrude had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 24 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest 7 1/2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Getrude and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Getrude will invest in business and livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Umoja group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Getrude is pictured in the photograph together with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mbogo Yiff Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Mbogo Yiff qui signifie partager la même idéologie a été crée depuis la création du Banc villageois.
Il est composé de 10 femmes.
Madame Adama debout à droite sur la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée mére de 10 enfants.

Elle fait une activité de commerce de détails. Avec son nouveau Prét de 75000 francs cfa elle va se payer  du sucre du lait du riz de l'huile des bougies des pilles et des oignons destinés à la revente.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son activité qu elle mène depuis longtemps.

Avec les  bénéfices qu elle va faire elle va payer les frais de scolarisations de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Mbogo Yiff' which means 'to share the same ideology'.  It was formed after the village bank was created.  The group is made up of 10 women.

Adama is standing on the right of the photo, raising her hand.  She is the group's leader.  She is 57 years old, married, and has ten children.

Adama's business is selling products retail.  She will use her new loan for 75,000 francs to buy sugar, milk, rice, oil, candles, batteries and onions for resale.  She has good experience in her business which she has run for a long time.

With the profits that she makes, Adama will pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, candles, batteries and onions for resale

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 46 years old and is a married woman with three children. Her husband works as a security guard and helps her to run a general store in front of their house. Hoa started this business two years ago and uses the income from this business to cover family expenses and raise her children. Hoa and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hoa is requesting a loan to purchase rice and a variety of foods and seasonal goods in bulk to sell during the coming holiday season. She hopes that by offering a greater variety of products, she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand this business and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, other foods and seasonal goods in bulk to sell during the holiday season.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is married with three children. Maria Lourdes is 45 years old and lives in San Isidro, Mahayag.

Maria Lourdes sells in a sari-sari (local convenience store) to earn a living and has had this business for twenty years. Each month she earns15,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Maria Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Maria Lourdes hopes to earn each day to prepare for her monthly payment.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store business

loans.name: Rosa Irlanda

texts.es:
Rosa Irlanda tiene 28 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 11, 10 y 1 año de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao hace 1 año. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan. Solicita el crédito para comprar matas de cacao y abonos agricolas, fertilizantes.
 
El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar las semillas sin ningún tipo de problema por el dinero.
No se le presenta ningún tipo de problemas. El sueño es tener una casa.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a visitar a la familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Irlanda is 28 and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and three children, ages 11, 10, and 1, in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.

She is a member of the San Juan communal bank, located in San Francisco, belonging to the San Juan parish. The group members work in agriculture.

Rosa does housework and works in agriculture. She has been sowing cocoa for one year. She makes her purchases and sales in San Juan.
She is requesting this loan for buying cocoa plants, manure, and fertilizers.

This loan will be a great help for her so that she can buy these items without having to worry about not having enough money.
She has not had any challenges thus far. Her dream is to have a house.
In her free time she enjoys going to visit family.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants, manure, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Uno Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana es casada, tiene 47 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, cerdos, gallinas, inició este trabajo con un pequeño capital, y lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de gallina ponedoras y de engorde, ya que espera mejorar su producción de animales. Las demás integrantes del grupo de dedican a la agricultura, a la agropecuaria y al comercio.
texts.en:
Señora Ana, age 47, is married. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has six children, one of whom is in school. She raises small animals: hogs and chickens. She started this business with a small capital, and has eight years' experience. Her husband, who works in agriculture, supports her.
Ana organized a group to request a loan which she will use to buy laying hens and hens for fattening. She hopes to improve her animal business. The other group members work in agriculture, livestock, and trade.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia vive con su madre, es soltera y se dedica al negocio de venta de comida  hace 5 años, vende en el  mismo domicilio, ya que este esta ubicado en un sector de alto comercio de la zona, y esta creciendo la señora en cuanto a clientela se refiere, ya que en la zona hay bastante construcciones,  por este motivo solicito el crédito porque necesita hacerse de mas mesas e incrementar su capital de trabajo. La señora realiza su actividad sola trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana en adelante preparando sus riquísimas comidas, la Sra. es una persona muy trabajadora se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es la única actividad que tiene para mantener a su Mama.
texts.en: Patricia lives with her mother.  She’s single and has been selling food for five years; she sells at home since it’s located in a highly commercial sector of the zone.  As far as clientele is concerned, she’s growing because there is a lot of new construction in the area.  Because of this she’s asked for a loan because she needs to acquire more tables and increase working capital.  She works alone from 5am on preparing her delicious meals.  She is a very hardworking woman who feels very grateful for the opportunity she’s being given since this is the only activity she has to support her mother.

loans.use: to buy tables and ingredients.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, tiene la necesidad de continuar surtiendo el negocio de medicinas, en esta ocasión comprará medicamentos naturales tanto antibióticos, vitaminas así como para enfermedades corporales, en pastillas, jarabes, cremas, inyecciones con esta inversión espera mantener una buena disponibilidad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella considera que a través de sus préstamos ha logrado crecer y mejorar su servicio para las personas que demandan de sus productos, ha beneficiado a su familia con una condición más solvente.
texts.en: María needs to continue stocking her business with medicines.  On this occasion she’ll buy natural medicines like antibiotics and vitamins as well as for body illnesses in the form of pills, syrups, creams and injections.  With this investment she hopes to have good stock availability to offer her customers.  She believes that through the loans she’s been able to grow and offer better service to people requesting her products; it has benefitted her family with a more solvent condition.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, vitamins, pills, syrups and creams.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a single mother of two children. She owns a school which has been in operation for three years. She began the school from her personal savings. She also owns a boutique, selling used clothes.

Elina is applying for a loan of 15,900 Kenya shillings to purchase desks and chairs, school uniforms and other teaching aids. She believes that she has seen progress  so far and will be able to establish a fully fledged primary school in the near future. Her only challenge is some students not paying the fees on time. The additional income from this loan will help Elina pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase desks and chairs, school uniforms and other teaching aids.

loans.name: Yeredon 1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe YEREDON 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  33 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJIDJENI, commune de FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz et l’arachide avec BIBA la 2 ème personne sur la photo de la gauche à la droite position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1/2 hectare. La production est vendue à FAKOLA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Bwizi Traders Group

texts.en: Edrona a single parent is charged with a responsibility of looking after four children and member of Bwizi Traders Group. She lives in Kyenjojo-Uganda and has been in produce business for three years. After separating with her husband she thought it wise to engage in business and stop depending on him after all she struggled a lot to get anything from the man. Little did she know that the business would pick up and reduce the burden of paying school fees for her children? Her business is challenged by unreliable prices. She would now like to use the loan to buy stock of beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of beans to sell.

loans.name: Véronique

texts.en:
A married mother of six (6) children, Mrs. A. Véronique is well known for selling groceries in her region. Her husband is the community "taxi" driver. However, even with her husband's work, Mrs. Véronique A. is responsible for taking care of most of her family's needs. Very intelligent and practical, she is a woman people look up to in her community. Mrs. Alidjiso has proven to be an honest and trustworthy woman and has reimbursed her first two loans.

She is asking for a new loan of $700, to be able to increase her inventory and, as a result, her income. This loan could also have a very positive impact on her and her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de six (6) enfants, Madame A. Véronique est réputée dans la vente de denrées alimentaires dans sa localité. L’activité principale de son mari est la conduite de véhicule de transport en commun « Taxi ». Malgré la fonction du mari, Madame A. Véronique a en charge presque la totalité des besoins de la famille. Très intelligente et très bien appliquée, elle reste l’une des femmes de référence dans sa localité. Madame A. a fait preuve d’honnêteté et de femme de confiance à travers les remboursements sans incidents de ses deux premiers crédits obtenus. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $700 afin de pouvoir augmenter le niveau de stockage de ses produits et par conséquent de son rendement. Ce crédit pourrait ainsi avoir un impact très positif sur son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase the inventory of her grocery store

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is married with three children. He lives in Kiwalani area in Dar es Salaam. He sells vegetable and fruits near his residence. He buys fresh produce from nearby villages for resale. The business has been his main source of livelihood for the past ten years. He has had difficulty growing the business because he has to balance the business and his family obligations. If his business is expanded, he will be able to meet the challenge of paying school fees for his child who is expected to start secondary education. The business provides a source of employment for her wife too.

The proposed loan will help Leonard expand his business through adding up new products, like rice, beans, maize flour, millet, sorghum, groundnuts and the like. The amount needed to expand his business is USD 1000.

loans.use: Expand fruit and vegetable stand

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
My name is Purificacion A., and I have dedicated myself to selling burritos with chicken, pork or chorizo for the past four years. My customers are excellent, and they love my burritos. My business is located near many businesses and their employees are my best clients. My goal is to increase my sales and with the earnings I'll be able to feed my family and pay for the education of my two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Purificacion A. me dedico a la venta de burritas de pollo, carne de cerdo y chorizos, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que les gusta mucho mis burritas ademas estoy ubicada cerca de muchas empresas privadas y sus empleados son los mayores consumidores, mi meta es tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y pagar los estudios de mis dos hijas que estan en el colegio.

loans.use: Purchase chicken, pork, chorizo, tortillas, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, salt, pepper, oil, butter, water, disposable plates and beverages.

loans.name: Mary Mankah

texts.en:
Mary is married to Gilbert N. and their union is blessed with eight children. The fact that she was not able to obtain secondary education or vocational training coupled with lack of capital to start a business left her unemployed. This however did not discourage her from trying, so she decided to buy food cheaper from surrounding villages and to sell it in town so she can make a profit.

This motivated her to seek help and she became a member of GHAPE. Before receiving her first loan she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has been able to invest and repay all her loans with which she raised money to buy good food for her household, equip her house and increase her business.

Given a further loan of $600, she plans to continue the ‘’buyam sellam business’’ and raise money to pay her children’s school fees and save some with GHAPE. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. Her first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Mary would like to buy foodstuff to sell, and pay for transportation and the apprentice fee for her child.

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en: Esmira E. has been operating a home goods store in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi for the last 10 years. Esmira has already successfully re-paid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. She is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 so that she can increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: Esmira would like to increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en:
A. Abdulla is 54 years old and a father of 4 children. He is from the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict territory of the Gubadli region, situated in the west part of Azerbaijan. Right now he lives in Sumgayit city with his family. He is the only breadwinner in his family. He began his business 7 years ago. He began his business with $200. He started selling a small variety of baby clothes. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family's food and important consumption needs. He had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school, etc.

Having borrowed a loan amount of $700 from Normicro, he rented a shop. The second time he borrowed $1000 and expanded his business. The loans were paid back on time.

Now, he needs a $1000 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy more suits and baby clothes, to increase his business, and to improve his family’s living condition with this additional income. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: to buy other sort of suits and baby clothes, to increase his business

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is 29 years old and married with four children. Cocoa and vegetables have been the only source of income for her family. Matalena heard of SPBD through the women in her village so she decided to join so she could develop her business into a better one. Through years of trying and sacrificing they have managed to get where they are now. Her new loan will help motivate her to become more and to earn more for a better future.

loans.use: Matalena would like to buy supplies for her Samoan cocoa business and plantation.

loans.name: Normatov

texts.ru: Сироджиддин Норматов имеет 4 детей,работаетмастером в цехе по ремонту автомашин.Старший ребенок у него сын которому 19 лет .Он раньше работал с отцом в цехе и теперь научившись полнлстью работе кузовщика его сын решил поехать в Россиюна заработки.Но т.к билеты сейчас очень дорогие ,то Сироджиддин решил купить билет для сына в кредит.Поэтому обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Приобретение авиабилета

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela lives on Luís Espinal Avenue, street 4 of the Puerto Mejillones zone in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband who works as a hired driver and she has a newborn baby. She sells candy at a street stand located on the main avenue in El Alto city. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (candy of dfferent flavors and brands) and thereby be able to increase her sales and income.
