This is the first loan with Impro, and she qualifies to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Pamela vive en la avenida Luís Espinal, calle 4 de la zona Puerto Mejillones, de la cuidad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer asalariado y una bebe recién nacida. Se dedica al la venta de golosinas (dulces) en un puesto callejero ubicado en la avenida principal de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería (dulces de diferentes sabores y marcas) y así poder incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Buy candy of different flavors and brands to sell in her stand.

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat is a 36-year-old mother with 1 10-year-old son, who is currently in primary school. She sells household items such as plastic chairs and water containers at her corner store.

With her store, she has been able to raise the income of her family. She wants to use this loan to further expand her business and her family income. Her son hopes to be a doctor someday, and Najat would like to start saving to help him achieve his dream.

Najat is a member of the trust group called With God. The trust group is based on peer pressure between members to repay their share of the loan.

Najat is happily standing in her yellow dress with Dylan, a Kiva Fellow; Stella, another Kiva borrower; and her loan officer, Dorothy.

loans.use: To re-invest her loan for business expansion

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Mrs Edelmira runs her grocery store since 12 years. She sold only a few products in the beginning but diversified her offer since. She decided to invest in a few products and to start her business because of her difficult financial situation and the fact that her husband’s salary could not cover all the household expenses.

Thanks to her strength and the support CEPRODEL provided her through their credits, she has been able to improve her economic situation. She has diversified the products she offers, like personal products for the house and food.

Today she urgently needs to buy more products and thus requests a loan, as she has already done before, in order to obtain the necessary capital to keep her business running.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edelmira desde hace 12 largos años se ha dedicado al negocio de pulpería iniciando con la venta de pocos productos que a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido, ha venido diversificándose. El negocio lo inicia por la difícil situación que atravesaba y al no cubrir las necesidades del hogar solamente el salario de su esposo decidió invertir en la compra de estos pocos productos para iniciar el negocio.

Hoy en día, gracias a sus esfuerzos y al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel por medio de los créditos, ha logrado mejorar su condición económica diversificando sus productos y ofreciendo tanto productos personales como productos de casa y comestibles. La necesidad atravesada por ella hoy en día es la urgencia de la compra de estos productos, por tal razón ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel con el fin de obtener el capital económico para la adquisición y venta de estos productos.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa M. prepares a native food called ‘kenkey’, which is made from maize. It is very popular with the natives of her area. Mrs. M. is married and has 7 dependants. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase production and sales, but she is running out of ingredients.

She is asking for a loan to buy more food items for her food production business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her food production business

loans.name: Musfig

texts.en: Mushfig was born in 1978. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Khodjali region of the occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  This single man is settled in Baku city, Yasamal region. He has been a hairdresser for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $625 to buy the necessary things for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving his business

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr:
Mrs. Rachelle S. was born on March 22, 1970 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin, and is married to Casimir BODEHOUSSE who is a teacher. They have two children who both attend school. She has lived with her husband in the family home in the Sènadé II neighborhood of Cotonou for over 10 years. She runs a business selling food products and cloth tunics (pagnes) in front of her house. As an initial loan she received 60,000 CFA Francs ($150). She has since added the sale of cosmetics to her business activities and she is requesting 150,000 CFA Francs ($375) to lay in supplies.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame S. Rachelle est née le 22 mars 1970 à Porto-Novo, la ville capitale politique du Bénin et mariée à BODEHOUSSE Casimir, un enseignant. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. Son mari et elle vivent dans une maison familiale au quartier Sènadé II à COTONOU depuis plus de dix ans. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de produits vivriers et de pagnes devant sa maison. Pour son premier prêt, elle a obtenu 60000F CFA. Elle a ajouté à ses activités la vente de produits cosmétiques et sollicite 150000F CFA pour s'approvionner.

loans.use: To purchase five 25-liter cans of vegetable oil and two dozen dressings.

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr:
Aïcha B. is 38, married, and has four children. She would like to develop her small palm oil-selling business. She would like to improve her family’s standard of living and would one day like to build her own store. This is her first loan, and she intends to repay it in six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Aïcha B. 38 ans, est mariée et a 04 enfants en charge. Elle souhaite renforcer son petit commerce d’huile de palme. Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et envisage à construire plus tard son propre magasin. Voici son premier prêt qu’elle compte rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois.

loans.use: Develop her small palm oil-selling business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia empezó a laborar en una empresa, posteriormente con lo que tenia ahorrado y con las prestaciones recibidas, ella decidió emprender su propio negocio para ser empleada y patrón. Ella tenía en mente que al mantener bien surtida su tienda de abarrotes y trabajarla adecuadamente iba a darle muy buenas ganancias. Entonces emprendió su negocio, empezó vendiendo solo los productos indispensables para su comunidad y poco a poco ha ido haciendo crecer su negocio.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara a 6 meses para la compra de surtido de mercancía y remodelación del local, para tener mas clientes y ganancias, ella tiene toda la fe que con tu apoyo podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Amalia started out by working at a company and saving money. With the money she saved and loans she received, she decided to start her own business in order to be both employee and boss. She had it in her mind that maintaining a grocery store well stocked with a variety of products and working hard would bring her a good income. So she started her business, began selling only products that were indispensable to her community and little by little her business began growing.

Now, in order to accommodate more clients and bring in more income, she needs a loan of $375US, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy a variety of merchandise and to remodel her store. She has total faith that with your support she will do it.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of beauty products for her salon, and clothing.

loans.name: Balikyewunya 2 Women's Group

texts.en: Margaret B. is the mother of three school-going children and is also responsible for several orphans.  She works as the treasurer of Balikyewunya Women's Group, but is primarily a farmer of bananas, maize, beans, and cassava, which she grows and sells in her local market.  Although Margaret has been farming for many years, she has recently started selling clothes as well.  Both of these businesses complement each other and provide Margaret with a comfortable income.  However, her colleagues in Balikyewunya Women's Group have entrepreneurial spirits and want to develop their own businesses as well.  Therefore, as the treasurer, Margaret is requesting a loan of $4800, which will be used to purchase large quantities of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kindness

texts.en: Kindness is 23 years old and married without a child. Kindness sells clothes like skirts, trousers, shirts, etc. She is a LAPO client. The demands for her clothes are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more skirts, shirts and trousers to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lucila Yobana

texts.es:
La señora Lucila es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 compró repuestos para vender en su taller de mecánica. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha trabajado en el sector transportes y se compró una computadora nueva para la inscripción de vehículos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, pretende independizarse  y comprar lubricantes y un scanner para su taller de mecánica.
texts.en:
Señora Lucila is a member of the communal bank, "Wiñay," in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 40 and is single with no children. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she bought parts to sell in her mechanic's shop. She has worked with the communal bank for almost 3 years, and she tells us that she has worked in the transportation sector and has bought a new computer for vehicle registration. With this loan of 1,700 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she hopes to become independent and to purchase lubricants and a scanner for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase lubricants and a scanner

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma K. trades produce to support her husband and take care of the family. She trades tomatoes and other vegetables on a table top at the local market. She buys boxes of tomatoes, peppers etc from farmers who come from surrounding villages to sell at affordable prices. She sells mostly to food vendors in her community. Emma has been in business for three years. 

She is thirty-three years old and is married with four children; three boys and one girl. The first born is currently in junior high school and the others are in basic school. Emma’s husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops, such as plantains, cassava, and maize. Emma lives with her family in Offinso, a farming and commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Emma requests a loan  of $475 to buy vegetables in larger quantities so she can increase her profit margin to save more money to support the household and her kids education.

loans.use: To procure vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
For past four years, Georgina has been trading in palm oil. She is 49 years old and married with six children. Currently four of them are in the junior high school.

Georgina has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and palm kernel oil for eight years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts, while palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel. The palm kernel is a byproduct of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes.

Georgina treks to Twifo Praso, a town in the Eastern region of Ghana to purchase palm nut fruits. She supplies the oil she produces to food vendors to prepare their meals. She normally switches her production between the two products. That is, after producing palm oil, she automatically obtains the raw material to produce palm kernel oil.

She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency so she can produce oil in larger quantities. She believes this will help her expand her business and earn more income to support her family and finance her children’s education. Georgina belongs to a village bank called "Yayra," which means "blessing."

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mr. Sen S. lives in Ta Daul Pi village in the Kandal province. He is a rice miller. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to resell to earn more income.

He is a 62-year-old widower of two children, one of whom owns a rice mill while the other helps with the business.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es: GUALBERTO TIENE 2 HIJOS A LOS CUALES MANTIENE, TIENE SU CASA EN LA PLAZA PRICIPAL DE LA LOCALIDAD. CUENTA CON UN NEGOCIO DE KARAOKE LLAMADO "PLAZA" LO ATIENDE LOS FINES DE SEMANA Y LO ATIENDE DE MANERA PERSONAL, NO VIVE CON SU ESPOSA YA QUE ELLA SE FUE A OTRO PAIS. SU ACTIVIDAD TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA PERO TAMBIEN MUCHA DEMANDA POR PARTE DE LA GENTE QUE BUSCA DIVERSION. EL KARAOKE ES DE AMBIENTE AGRADABLE. LA VENTAJA QUE TIENE ES QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN PLENO CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. EL CREDITO LO DESTINARA PARA CONSTRUCCION Y REFACCION DE SU CASA. ES SU SEGUNDA OPERACION Y EN SU ANTERIOR CREDITO TUVO MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO, SOLO TIENE DEUDA EN NUESTRA INSTITUCION.
texts.en:
Gualberto has 2 children whom he supports. His house is located on the main square of the town. He has a karaoke business named "Plaza" which he personally attends to on the week-end. He does not live with his wife as she moved to another country. His line of business has much competition but is also very popular among people looking to have a good time. The karaoke has a friendly atmosphere and the advantage is that it is located right in the center of the town. The loan will be spent on building and refurbishing his house. This is his second operation and the repayment history of his first loan was very good. He only has debt with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building and refurbishing house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To do some construction at her store and to purchase summer clothes to sell

loans.name: Huk

texts.en:
Huk S., 46, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband. She sells fruit and grocery items and is able to make US$15 in revenue every day. Her husband is a farmer and earns US$3 per day. This couple has five children: two are construction workers and three are students.

Huk S. is asking for a loan to expand her grocery’s inventory to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 18, 16 y 12 años, en su casa propia. Hace 3 años, junto a su esposo, se mudaron a su actual casa, donde surgió la idea de tener un negocio propio que le permita generarse más ingresos y ser parte sustentadora de su hogar, entonces empezó a vender balones de gas, alfalfa y la leche que produce su vaca. Su diario trabajo consiste en levantarse muy temprano para extraer la alfalfa de sus tierras de cultivo, ordeñar a su vaca y abrir su pequeño establecimiento donde realiza sus ventas en su misma casa, y cuando es necesario sus hijos la ayudan a llevar los pedidos a las casa de sus vecinos. Para mejorar su negocio, Carmen quiere arreglar la infraestructura de su casa para seguir dedicándose a la venta de los balones de gas y la alfalfa, pero en un espacio con mayor comodidad. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y es nueva en esta experiencia del trabajo solidario con su banco comunal, por lo que tiene amplias expectativas, y sabe que será parte importante para promover la unidad en su grupo. El dinero que solicita lo va a utilizar en la compra de más balones de gas en otras marcas y tener mayor variedad en su mercadería.
texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and 3 children who are 18, 16 and 12 years old. She and her husband moved 3 years ago to their current home where she got the idea of starting her own business, one that allowed her to generate more revenue and support her family. She started selling propane gas tanks, alfalfa and milk . Her daily job is to get up very early to pick the alfalfa harvest, milk her cow and open her small store where she sells her products. Her children help delivering orders to neighbors when it is needed.

Carmen wants to fix the infrastructure of her house to improve her business and continue engaging in the sale of gas tanks and alfalfa in a more comfortable area. This is the first time she has a loan with MFP, and is new to the experience of working with her community bank. She has big expectations and knows that she will play an important role to promote unity in her group. The money requested will be used in the purchase of gas tanks in different brands and a greater variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1041061237) is a 45 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To making a living, H. owns & operates a business raising ducks for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND to be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by H. from TYM Fund.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena started her fish sales two years ago at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana where she lives. Abena takes delivery of fishes from Yeji in the eastern region of Ghana. With her very tasty and good quality fish, many customers buy from her stand. She is now 50 years old. She is married with five children. She is currently taking care of two in school and the others are working. She wants to use the loan to buy more assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and her business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance. She belongs to the community group called ‘Prayer is the key’.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish

loans.name: Leonarda Avelina

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Paucarcolla, Provincia D. San Román, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 52 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 03 hijos y no tiene estudios.  Vive en la Comunidad D. Collana.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 5 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. ganado menor para engorD..

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y vender  ganado al por mayor.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos  las reuniones y las charlas D. capacitación.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonarda belongs to the communal bank group “Santiago Apóstol ", which is located in the Paucarcolla District of San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She did not finish school. She lives in the community of Collana.

Sra. Leonarda has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase young farm animals. At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 600 soles to purchase calves for fattening.

She hopes to continue working and selling cattle at wholesale. She enjoys the ease of her loans, the communal bank meetings, and the training lectures.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves for fattening

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores es una señora casada con 3 hijos, ella nació en Jaramijo provincia de Manabí un cantón a orillas de las aguas del pacífico, el esposo años atrás se dedicaba a la pesca en alta mar, pero con el tiempo decide cambiar de ocupación y en los actuales momentos él es chofer.
 Dolores comentó que cuando el esposo salía en su lancha a pescar  para ella era un gran sufrimiento ya que arriesgaba la vida, pero ahora esta un poco tranquila ya que así lo  tiene mas cerca y puede compartir con la familia.
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora le encanta trabajar dedicarse de lleno  a la ayuda del hogar, por ello le gustan los grandes desafíos y decide tomar un espacio en su propia casa para montar un pequeño negocio.

Desde el punto vista positivo, ella toma la decisión de invertir una pequeña cantidad de dinero en su propio negocio que consiste en la venta de repuestos y accesorios para motores  fuera de borda, y es que en el lugar donde ella vive la mayoría de las persona viven de la pesca, en su localidad son muy pocos los lugares donde pueden encontrar estos respuestas.

Emocionada comenta que desde hace 8 meses viene dedicada a esta ocupación y manifiesta que le esta yendo muy bien, de lo poco que ella gana lo invierte surtiendo su negocio con bujías, bombas de agua, arrancadores y mas.

Al preguntarle que le motivo para solicitar un préstamo, ella nos respondió…´´ aspiro con ese dinero ampliar mi negocio e invertir en comprar más repuestos Y poder hacer realidad el sueño de ver mis hijos realizados que estudien y se preparen ´´ acotó.
texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with three children. She was born in the Jaramijo province of Manabí, a county on the banks of the Pacific Ocean. Years ago, Dolores' husband was a fisherman, but he later decided to change his occupation and currently is a driver.

Dolores told us that when her husband left on a fishing trip she suffered greatly knowing that he was risking his life, but now she is calmer because he works nearby and shares in their family life.

Dolores is a hard worker, and loves to devote herself completely to helping out at home, but she also enjoys great challenges and decided to use some space in her home to start a small business.

From a positive point of view, Dolores made the decision to invest a small amount of money into her own business, which consists of the sale of spare tires and after market automotive accessories. Since, in the place where Dolores lives, most people make their living from fishing, there are very few places where one can find these spare tires.

Dolores emotionally tells us that since she started this business 8 months ago, it has been going very well. The little money she has made so far, she has reinvested in her business, purchasing headlights, water pumps, starters and more.

When asked about her motives for requesting a loan, Dolores responded, " I hope that with this money I can increase my business and invest in more spare parts. I want to realize my dream to see my children study and be prepared."

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare tires, headlights, water pumps, starters

loans.name: Papa

texts.en: Papa G. is married and has four children. He has junior high school education. Papa sells fabrics, clothing and lace at Elmina, which he has been doing since 2006. His wife is a trader. Papa uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills. Papa will use the loan to purchase more of his clothing to resell at the market. With the new profits from his expanded business, Papa plans to build a new house for his family.

loans.use: Papa will use the loan to purchase more of his clothing to resell at the market.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann A. is the 41-year-old mother of five children who range in age from 1 to 19. Mary Ann’s husband is a laborer, and to help augment his sporadic income she put up a small variety store in their village as a business twelve years ago.

Mary Ann’s membership in ASHI at that time enabled her to have access to credit for business capital. All throughout her membership, she has shown a very good performance in loan repayment, in attendance during weekly center meetings, and in her business. From selling little variety of commodities when her business started, her store now sells almost all necessary commodities that people in their village need for their everyday living. The profit she has in her business is increasing.Thus she is able to continuously request a loan from ASHI every time she repays her previous loan.

Though Mary Ann’s business earns profits well, they are yet insufficient to finance the education of her children, especially her two eldest who are in college, at the same time as reinvesting some portion into her business. Therefore, Mary Ann requests a larger loan amount to be able to sustain and finance the growth of her business and to be able to increase her profit further.

Once all of her children have finished college, Mary Ann wishes to build a concrete house for her family and to grow her business into a big grocery store in their village.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly se dedica a la Venta de productos de belleza por catalogo
Nelly continúa trabajando por que su esposo no tiene trabajo fijo, solo por temporadas, él es obrero de construcción, su hijo mayor trabaja y aportan a su casa pero no es suficiente porque su sueldo es poco, todavía tiene un hijo estudiando en la escuela.  
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de otra vitrina exhibidora para sus productos de belleza colonias, talcos y cremas.
El sueño de Nelly es tener una bodega en su casa y terminar de construir su  casa.

loans.use: compra de una vitrina exhibidora

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es el nombre de este simpático joven que a sus 23 años ya está creciendo en el mundo de los  negocios, él vive con sus padres y hermana en su amplia casa. 
A pesar de su corta edad aprendió a enfocarse en el mundo de los negocios y se proyecta a crecer económicamente, ya que tiene dos motocarros que son de su propiedad, en uno él mismo presta servicio de movilidad y el otro lo da en alquiler a un joven conocido. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a este oficio y lo realiza durante todos los días, no hay feriados ni fines de semana porque él quiere superarse y sabe que con sacrificio lo logrará. Además, las ganancias son netas y así puede ayudar a sus padres, ya que el negocio es muy rentable porque el servicio de motocarros es muy requerido por la zona donde vive, y él ya es conocido, pues su servicio genera confianza. Para el futuro Jorge quisiera tener una flota de motocarros y darlos en alquiler para crecer aún más, ya que a sus 23 años ha conseguido mucho, por este motivo es el orgullo de sus padres y no descansará hasta conseguir cumplir con sus metas.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, por lo que promete, una vez más, ser responsable como con en el primero, y quiere seguir trabajando responsablemente para surgir, pues tiene toda una vida por delante. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la adquisición de un nuevo motocarro y también reparará los otros dos que tiene, porque sabe que en los negocios así como se gana, también se debe invertir.
texts.en:
Jorge is the name of a likeable young man who at 23 years old is growing in the business world. He lives with his parents and sister in a large house. Despite his young age he has learned to concentrate on business and is expected to grow economically. He already owns two motorcycle taxis - one of them he drives himself and the other he rents to someone he knows. For the past 7 years he has done this every day, with no holidays or weekends off, because he wants to get ahead and knows that with sacrifice he will make it. His earnings are net profits with which he helps his parents. The business is very profitable because the motorcycle taxi service is very much in demand where he lives, and since he is well known his service is trusted. In the future Jorge would like to have a fleet of motorcycle taxis and rent them out to grow even more. At 23 years old he has accomplished a lot, which makes his parents proud, and he will not stop until he has achieved all his goals. This is his second loan with MFP and it is expected that, once again, he will be as responsible as with his first loan. He wants to keep working responsibly to progress and has his whole life ahead of him. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a new motorcycle taxk as well as repair ther other two he has, because he knows that in business as you earn you must also invest.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle taxi and repair the two he owns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries to increase her stock.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia L. D. F. D. 49 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una venta D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, dicho negocio esta ubicado en su lugar D. residencia. Rosa ha trabajador arduamente durante 16 años por mantener su negocio, el cual le ha permitido tener una vida digna junto a su familia, es por ello que solicita un préstamo, ya que desea surtir la tienda con productos los cuales poseen mayor demanda y D. esta manera satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes y así percibir mayores ganancias y ver crecer su negocio el cual le ha permitido durante tanto tiempo contribuir junto a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia L. D. F. is 49 years old. She lives in the department of San Salvador with her husband and two children. She sells perishable foods and basic foodstuff from her home. Rosa has worked arduously for the past 16 years to run her business, which has allowed her to have a dignified life with her family. She is asking for a loan so she can stock her store with products with a high demand and satisfy the needs of her customers. Doing so would mean her business would grow and make more profit, which would allow her to continue helping her husband with household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying perishable items

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita F. is from the village of Libag Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 34 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita M., 54, has been in the shell crafting business for 25 years. Together with her husband, they formed a partnership to manage their business so that they can raise their family. They have three children. She buys Capiz shells and makes them into different crafts and sells them in the market. So far, their business has been so successful that it has opened up new opportunities to venture into other businesses. Aside from shell crafting, they also have rooms for rent and a food vending stand. Through their profits they were able to acquire a piece of land and renovate their house. 

Zita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for four years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 15 times in CCT’s Credit Cooperative. The reason why she was consistent in paying her loans was because she used almost all of the money she borrowed to buy Capiz shells for their business.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used to buy more Capiz shells to make more crafts and, thus, more profits.

She dreams of seeing her children with their own jobs someday.   

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more Capiz shells to make more crafts.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 47 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Cecilia works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Cecilia is a baker. She bakes bread and sells it to retailers in her community. She also sells maize. Cecilia buys bags of flour from nearby communities. She has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of motor oil

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel C. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old. Maribel is widowed and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel sells vegetables in the local community. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Maribel from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Larm

texts.en:
Larm N. is a farmer, earning US $2 per day. She is 42 years old, married and lives with her four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Her husband is a farmer too, and he earns the same income as his wife. The family is also assisted by N.’s two, who are currently employed at a local garment factory in the province. 

N. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a horse and a cart for her husband to operate a business transporting goods for people in their village. This is N.’s first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cart and horse

loans.name: Gloria Eufemia

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria Eufemia V. es comerciante del mercado central tiene un tramo de marisco en el sector marisco, tiene 40 años de ser comerciante activa anteriormente ella era ama de casa y caminaba vendiendo por las mañanas marisco lo iba a comprar a Morazán y aquí lo venia a revender es madre de 7 hijos pero ninguno depende de ella.
 Su negocio lo abre desde las siete de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde  y el producto me lo traen a vender a mi tramo proveedores que vienen de Morazán.
El financiamiento ella lo solicito para surtir su negocio  tiene seis años de trabajar con estos créditos y se siente muy agradecida primero que gracias a Dios nunca nos ha quedado mal, segundo que lo  ha sabido administrar para su negocio y de las ganancias a podido ir remodelando su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Eufemia V. sells in the central market and has a stall where she sells shellfish in the shellfish sector. She has been selling for over 40 years, before she was a housewife and sold shellfish as a street vendor in the mornings. Mrs. V. buys the fish in Morazán and resells them in her area. She is a mother to 7 children but none depend on her financially.

She opens her business from 7 a.m. until 1 p.m. and the product is brought from Morazán so that she can sell it in her stall.

The loan will be used to stock her business. Mrs. V. has been working with loans for 6 years and she is very grateful, first of all to God who has never let her down, and second she has been able to manage her business and the profits have been used to help remodel her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy varieties of shellfish.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina, de 28 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, Segundo de 30 años, quien trababa en una minera en otra ciudad y viene a casa cada 15 días. También están con ella sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea dar una buena educación, ya que siente que esa es su responsabilidad.

Los largos días de trabajo en sus tierras han logrado que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, sus cultivos están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos. Aunque tiene que cuidar prácticamente sola a sus hijos, se da tiempo para realizar todas las tareas que una madre tan dedicada como ella debe cumplir, entre las que se encuentran velar por la salud, alimentación y educación de sus hijos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde que era niña, lleva 9 años como agricultora y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Delfina con MFP y está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará un motocarro para que su esposo haga transporte de pasajeros en la ciudad y así pueda estar más cerca de su familia.
texts.en:
Delfina is 28 years old. She is a hardworking and honest young woman who lives in her own home with her husband Segundo, who is 30 years old and works as a miner in another city and comes home every 15 days. Also with her are her three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a good education. She feels that it is her responsibility.

Delfina works long days in her fields and has become an expert in farming. Her crops are well cared for and always command a good price when she sells them. Although she practically has to take of her children by herself, she makes time to perform all the duties that a mother has to do such as making sure that her children are healthy, well-fed, and educated.

What she enjoys most about her work is cultivating the land, an activity that she has been doing since she was a girl. Delfina has been a farmer for nine years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the market in Tarma. Over time she hopes to buy more land so that she can increase her production.

This is her third loan with MFP. Delfina is saving so that she can complete her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the members of her Communal Bank, where she feels very happy. With the loan of 3000 PEN that she requested, Delfina will buy a motorcycle taxi for her husband so that he can transport passengers to the city and be closer to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle taxi for her husband

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es: Este  Grupo  se llama San Isidro,  está  conformado 4 mujeres, con negocios similares, venta de ropa, dos de ellas se dedican a bordados a máquina,  y una  es tejedora de fajas, güipiles y servilletas típicas de la región, las integrantes,    se dedica a este negocio de años atrás,  siendo para ellas una pequeña fuente de ingresos con lo cual ayudan a sU. esposos, ya que todas tienen entre dos y tres niños, a los cuales ellas apoyan en ir a la escuela de su localidad en su nivel primario. El grupo es localizado en la aldea loma Alta de San Juan Sacatepéquez.  SU. negocios requieren de mas capital para seguir invirtiendo, y así mejorar sU. ingresos,  por lo tanto solicitan un crédito a Fape,  ya que algunas vecinas de ellas que ya tienen crédito con FAPE  les contaron de podrían tener la oportunidad de tener acceso a un crédito para mejorar sU. negocios.  Ella dicen que tienen el ànimo de mejorar económicamente y darle a sU. familias una mejor vida y oportunidad de superarse.
texts.en:
This group is named San Isidro and is made up 4 women with similar clothing sale businesses. Two of the women do machine embroidery and one of the women sews belts, blouses and napkins typical of the region. The members have worked in this business for several years, providing a small source of income to help their spouses. All of the women have two or three children who's education they support at the local primary school. The group is located in the village in the hills, Alta de San Juan Sacatepéquez. Their businesses require more capital to continue investing and thU. improve their incomes, this is why they are seeking a loan from FAPE. They have neighbors who have loans with FAPE who told them they could have the opportunity to access a loan to improve their businesses. The women say that their goal is to improve economically and to give their families a better life and the opportunity to advance.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy threads, fabrics, embroidery and shops

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret J. sells charcoal and bread from home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Margret is 33 years old and married to a small-scale farmer. She has three children in school  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita L. P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 56 years old, married and has two children. To make a living, Lolita raises crops. The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. In 2007, Lolita joined CEVI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers (such as manure) and seedlings. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Lolita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI provides credit for its clients as well as savings, insurance and training through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita S. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Melita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melita owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mechanical services to local community members. Melita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Melita is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Melita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn N. is 54 years old and she lives in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokun Nang, are farmers who own a 2.2-hectare plot of land where they can grow rice to sell to support their family. Now they have a problem because it is time to do farming but they do not have enough money. 

To improve production, Mrs. Thorn N. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide, and gasoline. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a teacher, while the others are attending a local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Sophois

texts.en:
Mr. Sophois P. (pictured above), is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sarem Chey, is 31 years old. They live along National Road Number One, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for three years and have a young daughter.  

Sophois and his wife are farmers. They grow vegetables on their farmland in the village. Sophois does not have enough capital to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm. So, he is requesting his first loan in the amount of $1,200 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and fertilizer to maintain his vegetable farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase stone, sand, and cement to build a room for his daughter

loans.name: Edison David

texts.es:
Edison de 41 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, el tiene una ferretería (lugar donde venden herramientas y materiales de construcción). 

El comenzó vendiendo herramienta a sus vecinos, poco a poco con ayuda de su esposa pudo surtir mas su pequeño puesto. Cuando agrando su negocio y surtió mas su mercadería pudo distribuir las herramientas a otras ferreterías. Ahora trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. 

El tiene dos hijos y como comenzaron la temporada escolar el quiere comprar con el préstamo libros y cuadernos para ellos y así darles una mejor educación. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de la ferretería.
texts.en:
Edison is 41 and lives in a urban area of the suburb of Guayaquil. He has a hardware store where he sells tools and construction materials. He started out selling tools to his neighbors and little by little with his wife's help he was was able to stock a small stand. When he expanded his business and increased his stock he was able to sell to other hardware stores. Now he works from 9:00 to 6:00 everyday. He has two children who have started school and wants to use the loan to buy their books and notebooks and so provide them with a better education. He would like to have more hardware store locations in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Books and notebooks

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda J. lives in Purok 4, Brgy.Tuyom, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She is married to Ernisto, 60 years old, and they have nine grown children. Erlinda operates a fish-vending business. Her husband works as a Tricycle Driver and also helps in Erlinda's business activities. Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1991 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 32 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, and improve the family's standard of living. Erlinda's 33rd cycle loan of PHP 10,000 will be used to buy more fresh fish to sell in her business. Her earnings will help her continue to save for future home renovations. Erlinda J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Grace has a restaurant. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Grace sells her products wholesale from home. Grace lives in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and medication. 

Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy rice, maize flour and bananas. The main business challenges for Grace include increasing prices of food and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to see her business grow big and to own a fully stocked hotel (restaurant). She decided to join MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by getting additional capital.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like rice, maize flour and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana P., from the village of Namabbalan Norte, Tuguegarao City, is 48 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Juana owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for fattening and sale. Engaged in her business for over 25 years, she earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells a pig.

In 2010, Juana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 4000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future, Juana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce O., 53, is a widow who has seven children: Charles (25), Maureen (20), Rose (18), Hezron (16),  Rodgers (14), Kennedy (12), and Dennis (10). They live in Kisumu city.

Joyce has been selling fabric for the past 10 years. She normally sells to the local tailors. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the first one. She intends to use the money to buy more fabric to add to her stock so she can serve her clients well.

Joyce hopes to see her business expand so she can pay school fees and college fees for her children who depend on her.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 52-year-old married man and the father of six children. He has sold women's accessories, perfumes, makeup and socks since 1980. 

Mouhamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy more products to improve his business and to increase his capital. His clients are tourists, friends and relatives.

It’s not the first time that Mouhamad requests a loan from Al Majmoua. He has a good payback history and he stated that the previous loan had a very good impact. He hopes to expand his business and to increase his capital, in addition to buying a store to settle down.

loans.use: To buy more products to improve his business

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y con 03 hijos. La señora tiene estudios de educación primaria completa.

Rina viene trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos  desde hace 03 años, su    préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de comidas y gaseosas.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar mercaderías para su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital y mejorar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Rina is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” community bank which is located in Azángaro district, in Azángaro province, in the department of Puno.  She is 36 years old, married and has 3 children.  She completed her primary education.

Rina has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years.  Her initial loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to increase the capital for her business selling food and sodas.

She is now requesting a new loan for 300 nuevos soles to buy goods for her business.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital and to improve her business.

What she most likes about her community bank is the ease with which she can obtain loans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida L. is from the city of San Antonio Ozamiz City. She is 52 years old. Aida is married and has 3 adult children. She owns & operates a business, providing sewing services to the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika, de 32 años, es una joven soltera y muy emprendedora, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a ellos y a sus dos hermanas menores. Hace muchos años trabaja como asistenta contable en una empresa y hace 2 años pensó en instalar un negocio de ropa. Desde entonces se dedica en la venta de ropa para bebes, en un local alquilado, dentro de un mercado; el más concurrido de su distrito, que se encuentra a media hora de su casa. De esta manera su padre y hermana menor la apoyan en este negocio, sin embargo los fines de semana, esta ella encargada del negocio, ya que hay mucha afluencia de gente. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que le permite captar buenas utilidades. En adelante desea ampliar su negocio con diversidad de prendas, para que pueda cumplir con la demanda del cliente. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará más prendas de bebes, asimismo piensa comprar ropa casual para damas y varones, para así diversificar su negocio.
texts.en:
Erika is 32 years old.  She is a single and very enterprising young woman.  She lives in her parents' house with her parents and her two younger siblings.  She has been working as an assistant accountant in a firm for many years and two years ago she set up her own clothes business.

Since that time, Erika has worked selling baby clothes from her rented premises, in the busiest market in her district, which is half an hour away from her home.  Her father and older sister support her in this business.  However, on weekends she is in charge of the business since there are a lot of people.  What she most likes about her business is that it allows her to make good profits.  In the future, she would like to expand her business with a variety of garments so that she can satisfy her customers' demand.

This is Erika's first loan with MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  She will use her loan to increase the amount of baby garments she sells.  She also plans to buy casual clothing for women and men so that she can diversify her business.

loans.use: To acquire baby clothes and casual clothes for men and women

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
La señora Simeona D. de Pavón de 47 años de edad, separada, con 2  hijos, cuenta con varias maquinas forrajeras lo cual utiliza para convertir el maíz en harina de maíz para su posterior comercialización en su domicilio, es muy conocido en la zona.
Solicito dicho préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de Maíz por bolsa.
 El mismo al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la fundación paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo ofrecido porque gracias a ello podrá seguir dando a todos sus clientes materia prima de excelente calidad y buen precio y de esa forma mejorar su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en: Simeona D. de Pavón, 47, is separated and has 2 children.  She has a number of fodder machines which she uses to convert corn into corn meal to later sell from her home.  Her business is well-known in the area.  She requests a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya to buy more sacks of corn.  She would like to thank the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support offered, because thanks to this she will be able to continue to give her customers excellent raw materials at a good price, and in this way improve the standard of living of herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk

loans.name: Mario Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Mario Fernando; el tiene 45 años de edad y es soltero; el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de carne para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes del mercado de San Pedro del Cusco este se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la cuidad, a la vez el socio trabaja brindado el servicio de taxi tanto por las noches y por los días y de esta forma el socio saca a su familia adelante. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas insumos para su negocio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mario Fernando is a member of the "SAN VALENTIN" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Mario Fernando is 45 years old and single.  His business is buying and selling meat which he distributes to his customers in San Pedro del Cusco Market, located in the city center.  He also provides a taxi service during the evenings and during the days.  This is how he gets his family ahead in life.

Mario Fernando is requesting this loan to buy more supplies for his business.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for his business

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
El señor Cristóbal A. Jardín a nacido el 25 de julio de 1974 en la comunidad de Zapata Rancho de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba.

La vivienda en que vive don Cristóbal es tipo económico donde vive con su familia que tiene tres hijos y actualmente que se dedica a la producción agrícola de tubérculos, como también presta servicio de pasajero en su comunidad.

El crédito que está solicitando es para insumos agrícolas como ser la semilla de papa, zanahoria y abono de gallinaza para ampliar más su producción agrícola y así para tener más ingresos económicos en la actividad económica. Los labores culturales realizan con su familia en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Cristóbal A. Jardín was born on July 25, 1974 in the town of Zapata Rancho, Tiraque Province, in the department of Cochabamba.

The house Cristóbal lives in is a humble place where he lives with his family, including his three children. He currently works growing tubers as well as offering passenger transport in his community.

The loan he is requesting will be used for agricultural supplies such as potato and carrot seeds, and fertilizer to increase his crop yield and his income. His family helps him with the work, as do his neighbors in the community from time to time.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Charmilyn

texts.en:
Charmilyn C. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 30 years old. Charmilyn is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Charmilyn owns and operates a direct selling business, she sells cosmetics and apparel products in the local community. Charmilyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these kind of activities.

In 2007, Charmilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Charmilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

Charmilyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Charmilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a young man from Palestine. He is employed by the Palestinian National Authority. Tareq inherited a house from his family. He wanted to fix the house, paint the walls, and install windows and doors. Tareq borrowed money from relatives to make the necessary improvements on the house. Since Tareq learned about FATEN, he took out a loan to repay his relatives and have only one payment per month.

Tareq is in the picture above.

loans.use: To repay relatives money he borrowed to improve his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Maame Afia

texts.en:
Maame Afia B. sells items such as milk, canned tomatoes, paper drinks, sugar, and others in her shop. There are not enough goods in her shop so she is requesting a loan to refill her shop to supply her customers with their needs. 

Maame is married and responsible for the upbringing of 7 dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She helps to take care of the home. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame Afia plans to save to further her dependants' educations.

loans.use: to refill store inventory

loans.name: Judit

texts.es:
Judit nació en la ciudad de Abancay del departamento de Apurímac, ella tiene 54 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Izcuchaca de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene dos hijos. 

Judit  es enfermera y trabaja en el PRONEI (Programa Nacional de Educación Inicial), ella también tiene un negocio familiar junto con su hija Nadia, ellas venden pasamanería los días sábados en la feria sabatina del Baratillo de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracia al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Judit requiere el microcrédito para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo cepillos, crema de zapatos y otras cosas más. 

Judit es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco se encuentra ubicada la ciudadela de los Incas de Machupicchu, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene de la lengua quechua que traducido al castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Judit was born in the city of Abancay in the department of Apurímac. She is 54 years old and lives in the city of Izcuchaca, in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco. She has two children.

Judit is a nurse and works at the PRONEI (National Program of Early Education).  She also has a family business, together with her daughter Nadia.  They sell accessories on Saturdays in the Baratillo market in the city of Cusco. They have been doing this for 5 years now and it is going very well thanks to the determination that they put towards their work. On this occasion, Judit needs the microloan to buy more merchandise such as brushes, shoe creams and other things.

Judit is a responsible person who belongs to the village bank "Warmicuna Llanqanchis", part of the Asociacion Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru. Cusco is where the city of the Incas, Machupicchu, is located. The word "Warmicuna Llanqanchis" is from the Quechua language, which translated means "Women Who Work".

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as brushes, shoe creams and other things

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta L. is from the town of MANSABAY BAJO, LOPEZ JAENA, MIS. OCC. She is 57 years old. Julieta is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits for sale.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en: Leab T. is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. They live along National Road 2, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Leap is a rice farmer. She also sells Khmer noodles in her village when she is not at the farm. Khmer noodles or Num Banh Chok are considered the national dish of Cambodia; it can be served with a green curry soup, banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks, and cucumber. Leap is requesting a loan of $300 to dig a well for family use.

loans.use: To dig a well for family use

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE est formé de quatorze personnes qui habitent toutes dans la même agglomération. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Cathérine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Cathérine est mariée à Pierre un soudeur. Le couple à deux enfants dont un à charge et scolarisé. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour y arriver Cathérine vend des friperies. Parallèlement à cela, Cathérine vend d’Akassa (une  pâte préparée à base de la farine de maïs). Cathérine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle, Cathérine et son groupe sollicite auprès de ALIDé pour une première fois son aide financier. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The AYIDOTE group is composed of fourteen persons, who all live in the same town. The group's representative, whose name is Cathérine, is the woman raising her hand on the picture. Cathérine is married to Pierre, a welder. The couple has two children, one of whom depends on them and attends school. The couple takes care of the various duties of their household together. To this effect, Cathérine sells second-hand clothing. In parallel, she sells "akassa" (corn flour-based dough). Cathérine gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. In order to develop their business and to better meet their customers' needs, Cathérine and her group are requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time. This loan will allow them to strengthen their activity to better satisfy their customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes and corn to prepare '"akassa".

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a food market business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other food market operators. Mwanakombo dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of beans, wheat flour and chapati(flat bread). She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of beans, wheat flour and chapati(flat bread).

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida has a common-law husband with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Loida is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Loida has a "carinderia" (local eatery) business in the Philippines. Loida requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Loida has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Loida would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 years old lives in the West Point area. She is single and has two children who live at home and attend school. Grace did not attend school herself. For the past nine years she has been selling water and soft drinks from a tub. Her uncle gave her the money to start the business.

Her main challenge is the low sales of goods during the raining season. What she likes about this business is selling to customers and it makes her proud to send her children to school. 

Grace has requested this loan to purchase more soft drinks. In the future, she would like to own her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es: El señor Apolinar trabaja como empleado en una empresa y tiene un puesto de zapatería donde arregla calzados de damas, varones y niños. Así complementa sus ingresos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de zapatería (goma, tacos, cola, clavos). Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene 5 hijos. Apolinar es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2010 y su historial de pagos es excelente. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Apolinar is employed at a firm and also has a shoe repair shop where he repairs women’s, men’s and children’s shoes.  He earns extra money this way.  He needs the loan to buy shoemaking supplies (glue, heels, rubber, nails).  

He lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Tacagua zone.  He’s married and has five children.  

Apolinar has been an IMPRO client since the year 2010 and his payment history is excellent.  This is the second time his loan has been channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy shoe repair supplies.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
 
Anabel has a retail shop that sells fruits like mangoes and apples. She has had this business for 20 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fruits to sell.

Anabel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Nidia Jeanneth

texts.es:
NIDIA  JEANNETH
Para doña Nidia quien tiene en su domicilio una tienda de consumo diario desde hace 7 años,  se siente orgullosa como mujer trabajadora  y madre de  de 4 hijos, aunque sabe que esto representa para  ella una obligación y compromiso muy grande  como también por su negocio ya que a Dios gracias tiene mucha clientela quien la visita desde muy temprano en la compra de los artículos necesario para el sustento diario, también ha incluido en su negocio la venta de recargas y tarjetas electrónicas, todo esto la impulsa a seguir luchando a pesar del alza que ha tenido todos los productos de la canasta básica,ella esta convencida de que nececita invertir mas para seguir creciendo por lo que ella esta solicitando este credito para al compra de productos comestibles  y no quedarle mal a su clientela, obteniendo de esta actividad un beneficio para su familia y sentirse como alguien que le brinda apoyo y servicio a su prójimo.
texts.en:
Doña Nidia Jeanneth has a store in her home where she has been selling everyday consumer products for seven years. She is proud to be a hardworking woman and a mother of four children. Nidia knows that this is an obligation and is greatly committed to her business. She also thanks God that she has many customers, who visit her from the early morning hours to buy the necessary products for their daily survival.
