In her business, Nidia also sells electronic rechargeable credits and phone cards. Nidia is encouraged to continue striving forward even though prices for all basic household products have increased. She is convinced that she needs to invest more so that she can continue growing.

For this reason, Nidia is requesting a loan to buy food products so as not to look bad to her customers. She established this business as a benefit for her family. Nidia feels that she is someone who can provide support and service to her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Koodoo

texts.en: Koodoo is 61 years old and lives alone in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her children are living separately now. She has sold well water since 2004. The most profitable months are between May and October. Her daily income from her water well is between 10,000 MNT and 25,000 MNT. In addition to the water business, she also runs a car wash and tire repair service. The monthly income from these additional activities are between 50,000 MNT and 100,000 MNT. She is a diligent woman who says: "I want to increase the income from my water well by fixing the well. Since my children are living separately, I have less workload and have time to focus on my business." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to fix the water well.

loans.use: To fix the water well

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, vive con su madre y un hijo de 4 años de edad, ella es empleada de una panadería, trabaja desde hace 5 años de lunes a viernes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de laminas, hierro, cemento, clavos, arena, para la reparación del techo de su vivienda, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar las instalaciones de la casa, dándole mayor seguridad a su familia.
El objetivo de Sandra es mantenerse en el trabajo, cuidarlo y ayudar a su hijo, permaneciendo atenta a las necesidades de ellos.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her mother and her four-year-old son.  She’s an employee at a bakery.  She’s worked there Monday through Friday for the last five years.

She is asking for a loan to buy metal sheets, iron bars, cement, nails and sand to repair her house’s roof.  This loan will help her do home improvements providing her family with greater security.

Sandra’s objective is to stay employed and care for and help her son always being attentive to their needs.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to repair the roof.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 35 years old and is married. She has a daughter and lives with her daughter and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Dung's husband works as a laborer in a steel company. Dung earns an income to support her family by running a store selling spare parts for vehicles. She intends to use her loan to buy a greater range of products to sell in her store to better meet her customers' needs.

She hopes her business  will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her daughter's education.

loans.use: To buy a range of vehicle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced with 4 children and none of the children go to school. She takes care of an additional family member (mother). She sells secondhand children’s clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She also has rental houses where she gets additional income.

She has requested a loan of 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand children’s clothes. Her major business challenges includes transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspirations are to buy another plot of land and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand children's clothes

loans.name: Siyan

texts.en: Siyan, 22 year old, is a garment factory worker who earns $4 per day. Her husband also works at the factory and earns $4 per day. The couple does not have any children yet. She lives with her mother and some of her brothers and sisters. Every month, she has to spend $102 on food, $5 electricity, $10 on house rent, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. The couple doesn't have any plans yet to change their job or do any business at this time, because they think their salaries can support the family well.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Takku  Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey est créé le 28 août 2009, il est constitué de dix sept femmes qui habitent le même quartier,elles sont parentes et amies; une parfaite solidarité règne entre elles. Le petit commerce est leur principale activité.

La responsable madame Fama est âgée de 23 ans, mariée elle est mère de trois enfants; elle mène une activité de commerce d'articles divers; elle a une bonne expérience de plus de 3 ans.Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo habillée en marron.
Elle s'approvisionne dans les grandes villes et revend au village où elle a ses clients.
Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des marchandises en grande quantité pour renforcer son activité afin de se faire plus de revenus.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et subvenir aux divers besoins de ses enfants( scolarisation et santé)pour une partie.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Liggey was created on August 28, 2009. It consists of seventeen women who live in the same neighbourhood. They know one another through ties of friendship and kinship, and they share a perfect bond of solidarity. Their main activity is small trade.

The head of the group is Mrs. Fama, standing at the far right in the photo and dressed in brown. She is 23 years old and married with three children. She runs a business selling miscellaneous items, and she has over three years of experience in this activity.

She buys her stock in large cities for resale in the village where she has a customer base. She wants to use her loan to stock up on merchandise and bolster her business to increase her revenue.

She plans to use her profits to help her husband to support the family. A portion will be used to provide for the children’s needs with respect to education and healthcare.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for resale

loans.name: Fahmi

texts.en: Fahmi is a 58-year-old man from Baqa'a, Jordan. Fahmi has his own blacksmith in which he produce swords and knives. Fahmi is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian dinars to purchase materials needed for his blacksmith so that he can improve his work. Fahmi is looking to improve his family's living conditions and employ his sons.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing more materials.

loans.name: Doan

texts.en:
Doan is 45 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village, Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh city. She has three married children. Mrs. Doan sells pork in the market. She has done this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

The last time Mrs. Doan took out a loan, she borrowed 7,840,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the fifth time she will borrow money from SEDA. This time she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more pork to sell.

loans.use: to buy more pork to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Luisa sigue dedicándose a la venta de ropa, artefactos y artesanía. 

Luisa con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio. 

Luisa requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa para esta campaña navideña. 

Luisa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luisa continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Choquequirao”, which is part of the microfinance organization Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She continues to sell clothing, appliances, and handicrafts.

With her previous loan, Luisa did very well and was able to obtain good benefits. For this reason, she wants another loan because she believes it will be a great help to her business. Luisa is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing for the Christmas season.

She is grateful for the opportunity being given to her, so she promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Eric Aaron

texts.es: Eric de 22 años de edad es soltero, trabaja como tecnico en Hardnica desde hace 4 años. Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de estudiar un postgrado en gramatica inglesa, lo que le permitira trabajar mejor en su carrera como ingeniero informatico, pues anteriormente solicito un credito que le permitio obtener su titulo de Ingeniero Informatico, y como esta carrera pide que sepa de ingles quiere aprovechar para fortalecer mas sus conocimientos la oportunidad de estudiar aqui este curso que le abrira mas puertas a nivel profesional.
texts.en: Eric, 22, is single and has been working as a technician at Hardnica for four years.  He’s asking for his fourth loan to study a post-graduate course in English grammar that will make it possible for him to work better at his job as a Systems Engineer.  He requested a previous loan that allowed him to get his degree in Systems Engineering and because this career requires him to know English he wants to avail himself of the opportunity to strengthen his knowledge taking this course here which will open more doors for him at a professional level.

loans.use: to pay for a post-graduate course in English grammar.

loans.name: María Celina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive por la parroquia de Quingeo en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de naturaleza, tiene grandes paisajes para disfrutar de la paz y tranquilidad, su gente se dedica a agricultura y cría de animales, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 32 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 de 15, 11, 9 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja solo para sus gastos personales, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión aserrador, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes, gallinas, credos y ganado, también cultiva sus terrenos pero es solo para su consumo.
 
Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos.
 
Su meta es tener más animales para continuar en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is a member of the communal bank Nueva Juventud (New Youth). She lives in the Quingeo parish in Cuenca. This place is surrounded by nature and has large vistas for enjoying its peace and tranquility. Its people work in agriculture and animal raising and maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

Señora Maria is 32 years old. She is married and has four children, ages 15, 11, 9, and 7. Her oldest son works only for his personal expenses. Her second son is in secondary school, and the two youngest children go to a small school nearby. Her husband has a sawmill. The house in which they live is their own.

Doña Maria's business is raising and selling guinea pigs, hens, pigs, and livestock. She also cultivates their land, but only for their own consumption.
 
This will be her third loan from the communal bank, and she will invest it in the purchase of hens, guinea pigs, and pigs.
 
Her goal is to have more animals to continue with this business.

loans.use: to buy hens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Ena Claribel

texts.es:
Ena, nuevamente necesita otro préstamo para la mano de obra, lo cual sacaran las cosechas  de maíz y frijoles y lo demás para preparar la tierra de nuevo y cultivar los granos básicos solo asi se mantendrá estable su familia teniendo lo necesario para la vida.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho, mejoraron en lo económico y pudo tener mejores cosechas para el gasto y otra parte para su familia.
texts.en: Ena once again needs a loan to pay labor costs related to harvesting her corn and beans; the rest of it will be used to prepare the soil again to farm basic grains.  Only this way will she be able to keep her family stable having everything they need to live.  The previous loan helped her very much; her economy improved and she was able to have better harvest to cover expenses and part of it for her family.

loans.use: to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.fr:
Victoire est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les pagnes, du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois,  etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur seizième  prêt de groupe. 
Lydie  est un membre du groupe qui fait l’achat vente du bois e chauffe et du charbon de bois, elle est la première personne à droite.   
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des chargements de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois.  Elle se procure de ces produits au marché de Koutiala et dans les villages environnants. Elle vend en détail et au comptant à la maison à une clientèle diverse et variée. Elle est très sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Victoire comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 110 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Lydie  compte réaliser 132 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter leur fonds de commerce.

loans.use: Achat du bois de chauffe et charbon de bois

loans.name: José Iván

texts.es: El joven José  Iván es soltero, vive con sus padres, le  tienen 1 hijo de 2 años, trabaja en su casa con su papa como técnico en reparación de televisores y otros electrodomésticos oficio que aprendió del padre, con lo que gana le ayuda a su pequeño hijo. Esta será su primer experiencia crediticia el cual le beneficiara a superarse cada vez más, solicita el crédito para mejorar su vivienda, levantar un muro en la parte de enfrente de su casa que se esta cayendo debido a que es de madera y con el pasar del tiempo se va deteriorando cada vez mas principalmente por los efectos del sol y las lluvias, por tal motivo necesita comprar materiales para construir como cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín , bloques, alambre todo con el propósito de vivir mejor y tener una casa digna para la familia.

loans.use: Para comprar cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín , bloques, alambre.

loans.name: Yeimi Jacqueline

texts.es:
Yeimi es una mujer de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con esposo y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Yeimi no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Guiso de Pallares Verdes para compartir con si familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yeimi trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Yeimi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, dulces, golosinas, gaseosas y otros, de esta manera Yeimi tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda, a fin de brindarles mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Yeimi is a woman of 28. She lives in the city of Ica with her husband and their two children, whom she loves and who are her principal focus in life. She is a very kind person, hard-working and enthusiastic, who together with her husband dedicates all her efforts to advance her family. Unfortunately, for lack of economic resources and because of the need to work since she was very young, Yeimi was not able to study for the professional career in education that she wanted. In her free time, she likes to watch television, and on some occasions she cooks a very delicious green lima bean stew to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Yeimi works in her little business of selling groceries. She works every day for approximately 12 hours, and she believes that it is going well for her because of the good prices and the friendly treatment that she offers to her customers.

Yeimi is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered she will be able to complete the purchase of a greater quantity and variety of merchandise, such as rice, sugar, milk, beans, sweets, candies, soft drinks, and other items. In this way, Yeimi will have her business better stocked and will be able to serve more customers, and thus she will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of finishing the construction of her house, with the goal of offering better security and well-being to her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Hello lenders; meet Florence. The 45-year-old mother is a small-holder farmer based in Omobera village, in the Nyanza region of Kenya. For the past 10 years, the primary-educated entrepreneur has run a mixed farm, where she keeps productive dairy cows that produce milk for both consumption and sale. Florence farms on a two-acre piece of land that belongs to her husband, whose professional activities have little to do with agriculture. Florence was farming for subsistence, but recently switched to commercial production. The income she made from this transition greatly improved her income status and enabled her to afford her children a better education. Florence is seeking a loan to purchase animal feed. She places more premium on animal health and nutrition in her dairy business than on other factors. Animal feed has a lot to do with the proper composition of the animal products she sells to her customers. She is seeking this loan to ensure that her animals have the proper feed composition that they require. The returns from this investment will enable Florence to pay for her children's education expenses. She wants nothing but the best foundation for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a house and start farming

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is married with one child. She runs a retail shop near her residence selling different consumable items, especially food. She lives in Vituka Dar es Salaam. She is facing stiff competition from nearby shops. Due to her limited capital she frequently has trouble maintaining sufficient stock on her shelves.

To improve her competitiveness she is in need of USD 550 to increase her working capital. The amount will be used to add stock of some items especially those with high turnover.

loans.use: Expand retain business selling food and other consumables.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.en:
My name is Maria M. and I am committed to the sale of basic grains, as well as earrings and necklaces for women. I have had my business for 3 years and I have the help of my husband who attends to my business during the nighttime when he is finished with his daily work. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to have better sales and with that be able to find a better premises to establish my store. The most important thing is to be able to feed my two dear children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer, Laura Kirkvold.

Mi nombre es Maria M. me dedico a la venta de granos basicos y aritos y collares para dama, tengo mi negocio hce 3 años, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para atender mi negocio en las noches cuando el termina su jornada de trabajo, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios para tener mayores ventas y asi poder conseguir un local para establecer mejor mi tienda y lo mas importante alimentar a mis dos queridos hijos.

loans.use: purchase of rice, beans, coffee, sugar, salt, butter, brooms, soap, necklaces, and earrings.

loans.name: Lawrence Ndoh

texts.en:
Lawrence is married to two wives and the father of twelve children. His heart cry is to see his twelve children all established in different jobs so they can be able to take care of him when he is old. To realize this dream, Lawrence has been very hard working, indulging in farming, but has always had low income because he invested little or no capital. Realising the heavy responsibility he has, he decided to join GHAPE so he can get a capital and invest in his crop cultivation business. After being trained in business skills, he received his first loan and has since been able to invest and repay four loans with which he raised money to send his children to school.

Given a loan of $1000, he plans to fatten and sell pigs, then cultivate yam and short-cycle vegetables so he can obtain a profit to continue paying school fees for his children. He plans to pay his loan in 24 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Lawrence would like to purchase seeds and piglets for his farm to support his twelve children's schooling.

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en: Ilkin has a small shop where he sells spare parts. He has had his business for 3 years, and it allows him to support his family. He is 28 years old,  married, and lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. Ilkin doesn't have any children.  He is applying for a loan of $950 to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca lives with her husband of 12 years and together they have a two year old son. Blanca and her husband have a business selling eggs wholesale, along with a few other products. She used to work as an employee for a company, while her husband worked as a fisherman. After several years of saving money and gaining experience, Blanca decided to start her own business selling eggs.

They began providing eggs to a few small stores, and today they have a strong customer base, including small shops and supermarkets. Although the work is very hard and they start their day at 3am, they are very dedicated and have already progressed a lot thanks to their efforts, purchasing two trucks to help with their distribution. They also have several employees now, including sales and deliveries.

Blanca is requesting the loan so she can make bulk purchases of eggs, because during this time of the year there is an increase in demand and she would like to be prepared for it.

La Sra. Blanca vive en pareja hace 12 años y tiene un hijo de 2 años. Blanca junto con su pareja se dedican a la ventas de huevos al por mayor y algunos que otros productos.

En principio Blanca trabajaba como empleada en un negocio, y su pareja era pescador, luego de varios años de ahorro y experiencia en las ventas, Blanca decidió dedicarse a la venta de huevos.

Empezaron proveyendo a pequeños comercios y hoy día ya tienen una basta clientela, entre ellos despensas, supermercados, entre otros. Aunque el trabajo es muy sacrificado, pues deben iniciar su jornada a las 3 am., realizan su labor con mucha responsabilidad; es así como hoy día han progresado bastante ya que gracias a sus ganancias adquirieron dos camionetas con las que realizan sus repartos. También poseen ya varios empleados entre ellos vendedores y repartidores.

Blanca desea adquirir un crédito para la compra de grandes cantidades de huevos, ya que en esta época del año, la demanda aumenta bastante y ella desea estar preparada para ello.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY EGGS IN LARGER QUANTITIES, AND BE ABLE MEET THE INCREASED DEMAND FROM CUSTOMERS THIS TIME OF YEAR.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Mr. Farrukh is 44 years old and married with two children.  He and his family live in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region.
Farrukh and his whife (she is shown on the picture) run a family business together. Farrukh sells milk in the Saatli town, while his wife takes care of their cows. The income from such a small herd is too low to support the family which is why Farrukh applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy more calves to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Inobat T. lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs.T. is engaged in the business of selling national dresses in the flea bazaar. The stable business income helped her to open her own trade outlet. Additionally she works as a secretary. Mrs.T. works with the direct suppliers of the material which is the reason her prices for her dresses are lower than the bazaar prices. She has repeat customers and bulk buyers. Mrs.T. requests a loan of 2700 STJ for the purchase of new material lots.

loans.use: For the purchase of new material lots.

loans.name: Letife

texts.en: Letife M. and her family are cattle breeders in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Letife is 58 years old, married with three children, and has been working in this business for the last 20 years. She is currently looking for funding to purchase more cattle.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Mrs. Sushila B. lives with her husband and one son, who is one year old. Her husband's name is Rusatam B.. Both Mr. and Mrs. B. have been doing tailoring work, which they learned from their forefathers. They make school uniforms for both boys and girls. They prefer to make popular ladies' dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, Makhshi, and others. Now she is seeking a loan to buy raw material like cotton cloth for the tailoring work.
They are planning to save their income to provide a quality education for her son, and the cost of that education in Nepal is very high.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is a widow who lives in her own home with her children on Tupac Katari Street in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. In the mornings, she works selling clothes which provides her with a very small amount of money. Her other source of income comes from the rental of a taxi. The loan that she is requesting will be used to repair her taxi so that she can continue generating enough income. This is especially important since she is alone and the only one supporting her children.

She has a good prior history and qualifies to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora vive en la C. Tupac Katari de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, vive con sus hijos en casa propia, es viuda y por las mañanas trabaja vendiendo ropa donde percibe un salario muy pequeño, su otra fuente de ingresos es la renta de un taxi, el crédito que solicita es para reparar su movilidad y poder seguir generando ingresos ya que es ella sola la que mantiene a sus hijos Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
Adilia is 28 years old, and she lives in the North Waspan neighborhood in the city of Managua. She is married and has a four-year-old son. Her husband works a machine operator in the duty-free area and together they are getting their family ahead.

Adilia has a business selling cosmetics, which she sells on credit to her customers. She has four years of experience, and got started using microfinance loans. Through these loans, she has come out ahead and has been able to keep up. This loan is needed to provide her work with cash, which she will use to diversify her inventory, broaden her credit, and satisfy her customers. Later on, she hopes to do some home improvement projects to make it more comfortable for them to live in.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Adilia tiene 28 años de edad,habita en el barrio Waspan Norte de la ciudad de Managua, es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como operario de maquina en una Zona Franca, y juntos sacana adelante a la familia. Adilia tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos, los cuales los vende al crédito entre sus clientes y tiene cuatro años de experiencia, ella comenzó con prestamos a Microfinancieras y es por medio de estos préstamos como ha salido salido adelante y ha podido mantenerlo, el préstamo lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y diversificar el inventario para ampliar sus créditos y sastifacer a sus clientes. Más adelante desea hacerles mejoras a sus casa, para que tenga más comodidad para habitar.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to expand her inventory and earnings

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi N., 32 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2004. She has 2 children who are still going to school. At first, she used the borrowed money in breeding animals. Since she joined the Fund, her family economy was improving. Being experienced in breeding animals, she wants to expand her breeding farm. Her husband is working and earning 125 USD/ month, helping her to repay weekly. This time, she wants to borrow 550 USD. Her average income is 1200 USD/ year. 
Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Nở 32 tuổi, Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004, hiện tại gia đình chị có 2 con còn nhỏ đang đi học, vòng vốn đầu tiện chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi với mức vốn vay ban đầu là 2.000.000đ các vồng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị cũng đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, từ khi tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển. Với kinh nghiệm sẵn có trải qua nhiều năm làm dự án chăn nuôi, vòng vốn này gia đình bàn bạc mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi, hiện nay chồng chị thường xuyên đi làm thuê thu nhập bình quân 2.000.000đ/ tháng đó cũng là nguồn trả hàng tuần. Vòng vốn nay gia đình xin vay 9.000.000đ.
Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi 20.000.000đ/ năm.

loans.use: Breeding animals

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn Y., 59, is a mother of five living in an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from the capitol city of Phnom Penh. She is married to Ou Kot, 63, a farmer.

For the past two decades, Vorn has earned a living by weaving silk, a skill that she learned from a relative. One of her sons also weaves silk. They sell their finished product to a middle man in the village, who then peddles it in Phnom Penh's markets. To expand her business, Vorn is requesting a loan of $400 U.S. dollars to buy more raw silk.

loans.use: To buy silk for a family weaving business

loans.name: Javier Carlos

texts.es:
Javier M. is an illustrator and he makes small notebooks with drawings to color designed for children between 3 and 6 years old. His wife is a seasonal clothing vendor and both activities are their principal income sources with which they support their children ages 4 and 6. Their home is located in the zone of San José de Yunguyo (city of El Alto). Javier applies for this loan to acquire the raw material (paper, ink) and satisfy market demand, which will allow him to increase his income. This is his first loan with Kiva and he qualified favorably in our evaluation which is why he has access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Javier M. es graficador, elabora pequeños cuadernos con dibujos para colorear destinado a niños de 3 a 6 años. Su esposa es comerciante de ropa por temporadas, ambas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con las que cubren la manutención de sus hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad, su vivienda esta ubicada en la zona de San José de Yunguyo (ciudad de El Alto). Javier solicita crédito para adquirir materia prima (papel, tinta) y satisfacer la demanda de su mercado, lo que permitirá que se incrementen sus ingresos. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, calificó favorablemente en nuestra evaluación por lo que puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: María Macarena

texts.es:
Macarena inició el negocio por que estudio en una escuela de belleza la colocación de uñas y cosméticos, y ante la necesidad de tener un empleo que le ayudara a obtener ingresos y ayudar con los gastos de la casa ya que su esposo estaba trabajando fuera por lo tanto tenia que conseguir ingresos. Comenzó en su casa colocando uñas de acrílico y gel, y gracias a su buen servicio ha logrado hacerse de clientes que le ha dado bunas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6meses para la compra de una lámpara UV. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Macarena started the business because she studied in a beauty school how to apply nails and cosmetics, and due to the need to have a job that helped her have an income to help with the household expenses because her husband was working far away and she had to get money coming in. She started in her home applying acrylic nails and gel and thanks to her good service has succeeded in having clients that allow her to earn a good income. She needs a loan for US$250 which she will repay in six months to buy a UV lamp. With your help she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a UV lamp

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji is married to A. M. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. She completed her education in the 10th standard [grade]. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her daughter reads at the 9th standard level. Her elder son is in 7th standard. Her younger son is in 2nd standard.

Shahnaz baji's husband runs a small hotel in his community. He is a well-known person, and everybody comes to buy food from his hotel. He has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Shahnaz baji is a housewife and helps her husband with his food business. She successfully repaid her previous three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy ingredients (cooking oil, lentils, vegetables, rice, and spices).

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the family's food business

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank E. is 27 years old and is single. He sells electronics at New Benin market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. He buys the electronics from Ontisha main market and sells them in Benin City. He opens his store at 7:30am and closes each day by 7:00pm. 

Frank needs the loan amount of N70,000, US$600, to purchase more electronics to sell. He says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Jinna

texts.es:
Jinna pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 20 años de edad y junto a su conviviente tienen 1 hijo. Afirma que su principal dificultad ha sido adecuarse a la ciudad de Huaraz porque es natural de la zona selva específicamente de Tocache. Desde hace 3 años vive en al ciudad de Huaraz y ha iniciado un negocio de venta de ropa a pedido y el lugar donde vive con su conviviente, Av. Manco Cápac 159, le sirve de almacén. Empezó este negocio con la venta de joyas y que ahora está invirtiendo en la venta de ropa. Su principal dificultad es que a veces los clientes se olvidan de pagarle o no le pagan a tiempo y ella tiene que buscarlos en sus respectivos domicilios para cobrarles.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de ropa para niños.
 
Jinna piensa crecer en su negocio y agradece el apoyo de su Banco Comunal por colaborar en su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Jinna belongs to the cooperative bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” (“Women of Great Challenges”), in the district and province of Huaraz, in the Ancash department. She is 20 years old and has one child with her partner. She affirms that her biggest challenge has been relocating to the city of Huaraz, as she is originally from the jungle area of Tocache. She has lived in Huaraz for three years, and has started a business selling clothing on order. The place where she lives with her partner, on Manco Cápac Avenue, is where she has installed her business. She started out selling jewelry, and is now investing in clothing sales. Her biggest hurdle is that, at times, her customers forget to pay her or don’t pay her on time. This forces her to seek them out in their respective homes in order to collect. With this loan of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will invest in the purchase of children’s clothes. Jinna plans to expand her business, and is grateful for the cooperative bank’s support and collaboration towards her growth.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La señorita Pamela es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera, sin hijos y tiene 4 hermanos menores a los que apoya económicamente. 
Pamela nos cuenta que este es su primer préstamo y que estudió para ser chef. Tiene casi medio año trabajando con el banco comunal. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará insumos para preparar pavos rellenos en navidad.
Pamela desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Miss Pamela is a member of the “Wiñay” microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 18 years old, single, and has no children. However, she has 4 underage siblings whom she supports financially.

Pamela states that this is her first loan, and that she studied to become a chef. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost six months.

With this 300.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase the ingredients necessary to prepare stuffed turkeys for Christmas.

Pamela wishes to continue working in order to help support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make stuffed turkey

loans.name: Enriquieta

texts.en: Mrs. Enriquieta A., 47 years old, married and lives at Olingan, Dipolog City. Her husband is a fisherman. She has 5 children and 4 of them are in school. She has much desire to help her husband. She decided to raise pigs in order to have additional income. Mrs. A. has been a MIGS (member in good standing) of Paglaum Cooperative since September 2006.  She had availed loan for several times already. The cooperative really helps them especially when it comes to financial matters. At present she applies Php7,000 to buy feeds and injectable medicines for her pigs. She is looking forward to own a piggery someday.  She wants to uphold the good records she has shown to the cooperative and for Paglaum MPC also to reach out to those are needing the help.

loans.use: to buy feeds and injectables for her pigs

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa M. is thirty eight years old and married with two children. All of her children are still in the school. Hawa lives with her family at Bawalashie a suburb of Accra in Ghana. She loves fashion very much and as a result, trades in jewels like ear rings, necklaces, etc. She has been selling jewelry for the last ten years. Hawa buys her goods from Agbobloshie market which is also a suburb of Accra. She hawks with her goods from house to house and also treks to nearby markets to sell. However, she is constrained with funds to make her business grow in order to meet her family's needs. 

Hawa wants to use the loan to buy jewelry in bulk so she can sell at more markets. Hawa is in a village bank called ‘Fear Not’. She hopes to receive GH¢800 to improve her business by restocking her inventory. It has been her dream that her children acquire a quality education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk for resale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 56 years old, widowed, and blessed with four children. But even though she is widowed, she is still dreaming and hoping for the best for her family and business.

Isabel is engaged in fish vending. She sells fish in her neighborhood and in Dalipe (in the municipality of San Jose public market). Fish vending is an occupation she inherited from her mother. When Isabel was twenty years old, she started accompanying her mother to sell fish. She also owns a variety store, which is another source of income for the daily expenses of the family.

Isabel dreams that her business will expand and that she will have a place or stall in the San Jose public market. She hopes that her business could sustain the expenses of her children's studies and a future house renovation.

loans.use: To purchase 450 kls of fish.

loans.name: Buscando Al Señor Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Buscando al señor, está conformado por las siguientes personas: Verónica del Socorro F., vende carnes de pollo y res, Nidia del Socorro G. R. su actividad es similar a la otra integrante y Clara Rosa M. es la coordinadora y se dedica a la elaboración de vestuario textil.

Doña Verónica del Socorro F. vende carne en su casa, tiene más de cinco años de tener este negocio, ella ha pasado por momentos difíciles en los que estaba por cerrar el negocio, con el crédito que Adim le dio ella ha logrado comprar por cantidad y poder competir en precios con otros establecimientos.
Es casada, tiene un hijo adolescente que le ayuda en la venta y su esposo aporta con su trabajo a los gastos de la casa. Espera poder crecer en su negocio para alcanzar sus metas de mejorar su vivienda.
Expresa que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que recibe y también a mejorar de manera personal.

Se proponen trabajar con Adim en varios ciclos y están claras que para esto es solamente si son disciplinadas en sus pagos. El grupo ha obtenido cuatro créditos y ellas han salido adelante mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The supportive group Buscando Al Señor (Seeking the Lord), is made up of the following people: Verónica del Socorro F. who sells chicken and beef, Nidia del Socorro G. R.. whose business is similar, and Clara Rosa M., the group's coordinator who supports herself by handcrafting clothing. Doña Verónica del Socorro F. sells meat from her home. She has been working in this business for more than 5 years. She has gone through difficult times, including moments when she was about to close the business. With the loan that Adim gave her, she has succeeded in buying her products wholesale. As a result she is now able to compete on price with other butcher shops. She is married, and has an adolescent son who helps her sell her products. Her husband helps cover household expenses with his own work. She hopes to be able to grow her business and to reach her goal of improving her home. Veronica comments that the Adim training she has received has taught her to better control her business and to improve herself as a person, as well. The group plans to work the Adim through several cycles. All of the members are clear that they will be able to do so only if they are disciplined about their payments. The group has already received 4 loans; all of the members have imrproved their quality of life as a result.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve their businesses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary Q. is single parent and has 8 dependants. She has received schooling through primary education. Mary sells fresh fish. She buys fish from the fishermen at the seashore and then sells them fresh at the market. She preserves the rest of the fish by smoking process. She later sends them to the market for sale at Elmina, which she has done since 1980. Mary uses her income to pay school fees and other housekeeping expenses. Mary will use this loan as additional capital to increase the amount of fish she buys meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save towards buying a fishing boat so the she can have fishermen working for her.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell at market.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Soun N. Y., 40, lives with her husband and three of their children in Kampong Cham Province, where she sells vegetables and grocery items, on average earning $10 in revenue per day. Her husband is a taxi-driver who also makes $10 per day. Two of her children have a business cleaning motorbikes. Soun N. Y. is asking for a loan to increase her grocery inventory.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Virgen de los Angeles Village Bank, which meets once per month in the town of Huayllacocha, where she lives. Paulina is forty-seven years old and married with six children. Her children are all adults, and three of them still live at home with her. Paulina and her family have a farm where they grow potatoes, barley, wheat and broad beans (“habas”). She has been working on the farm for many years, and is now preparing for the upcoming barley harvest in June. She and her husband also raise a handful of cows and sheep. 

Paulina is requesting a loan to invest in livestock. She plans to buy either sheep or a cow; the money would be enough to buy one cow or five sheep, she says. She would raise the animals and eventually sell them for meat. 

Paulina has been a client of Asociacion Arariwa for the past six years, and is grateful for the loans available to her because it is the only institution that works in her town. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Buy sheep or a cow

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et a 02 enfants, son mari est un gendarme. Le revenu de son mari est insuffisant pour couvrir toutes les charges du foyer, pour pouvoir l’aider dans les charges quotidiennes elle a entamé le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale et divers. Elle est la seule à exercer cette activité dans son quartier ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de très bonnes recettes. Voulant agrandir  son stock et commencer le commerce de produits congelés elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 04 cartons de lait « PEAK », 05 cartons de savons , 6 bidons d’huile, divers produits congelés.
texts.en:
Ayaovi M. is married to a police officer, and has two children. Her husband's income is not enough to cover all of their household expenses. To help with daily expenses, she has started selling various food products. She is the only person with this type of business in her neighborhood, so she earns a good deal of money. Hoping to expand her stock and begin selling frozen food products she is requesting her first loan through WAGES to buy four boxes of "PEAK" milk, five boxes of soap, six containers of oil, and various frozen foods.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new types of food products for her business

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila T. is a vegetable farmer in the village of Dolchoky. Sushila grows a variety of vegetables but at the moment, she only grows enough to feed her family and does not make a profit from her produce.

Sushila is requesting a loan of Rs.10,000 so that she can purchase a variety of vegetable seedlings. She hopes to grow cauliflower, broccoli and carrots and have enough vegetables to make the transition from being a subsistence farmer to making a profit from her produce.

Sushila has three daughters and one son. Her husband works as a meat supplier in the city of Patan where he collects meat from suppliers and delivers it to butcher shops around town.

Sushila hopes to be able to generate enough income from selling vegetables so that her children can look to her as a successful businesswoman. This is the first time that Sushila has taken out a loan and she is excited about the prospect of running her own business.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seedlings

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married with four children. She is a 30-year-old trader who believes in hard work and is dedicated to her work. She sees it as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and is very serious with her business. 

Janet trades in foodstuffs like plantain, maize and cassava. She started this business three years ago and trades them at the community market. Through this she has been very resourceful to her family.

Janet wants to use the loan to buy a large enough supply of plantain, cassava and maize to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She dreams of seeing her business grow to a higher level.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like maize, plantains and cassava

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria G. is a 48-year-old farmer and mother of two children. She helps her husband till a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm that provides income for their household. She said that when she has savings, she will not need a loan to support her business.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, rice seed and chemicals. She is very optimistic that she will be able to increase the average size of her harvest. 

CEVI helps her fulfill her dreams. Now she is involved in the CEVI cluster meetings. She learned about business from the credit plus education CEVI brings to the community. She also received training and insurance coverage in addition to  the loans that she borrowed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticides, rice seed and chemicals

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is forty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, two sons and four daughters. All of her children are still in school. She says she works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Afia is a petty trader. She sells all kinds of canned foods in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Afia has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario Abarola, 47, lives in a village near the seashore along with her husband, 49, and three children. Most families in their village depend on fishing and fish selling as the main source of income. Rosario’s family is one of them. Rosario’s husband and eldest son are fishermen, while Rosario is into financing business. The loans that she requests from ASHI are not only used to finance her husband and son’s fishing business but also other fishermen’s business in the village. She profits by getting a share of fish from the fishermen whom she finances. The sharing depends on how much money Rosaria finances to the fishermen.

Rosario sells her share of fish together with her husband and son’s fish in the market. Aside from her financing and fish-selling business, she also has an eatery in their village. After selling fish in the morning, she manages her eatery for the rest of the day. At the end of the day, she happily counts the money she has made and looks forward to the next day. She requests a larger amount of loan for her growing business. Out of the profit her business makes, Rosario wants to finance her youngest child’s education until graduation as her two eldest children are unemployed because of lack of education.

loans.use: Additional capital for financing and fish-selling business

loans.name: Rosa Violeta

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer, es casada, tiene 52 años, cuatro hijos todos casados, independientes.
Rosa decidió abrir en su garaje una tienda D. abarrotes, tuvo mucha acogida en la zona y las ventas eran buenas, se compraron un carrito D. segunda que lo dejaban en la puerta D. su casa hasta que intentaron robarle en dos oportunidades, entonces tuvo que cerrar la tienda para guardar ahí su carro. Para tener un ingreso adicional, decidió alquilar partes D. su casa. 
DesD. que empezó en Finca Perú hace dos años, se ha dedicado a construir su casa, gracias a los préstamos que ella recibe cada periodo. ahora solicita un préstamo D. 2400 para levantar paredes y tener un ambiente mas para alquilar.
El sueño D. Rosa es incursionar en otro negocio para tener mas entradas, esta pensando en su vejez por que ella no tiene seguro D. salud.

loans.use: levantar paredes

loans.name: Aproniano

texts.en:
Aproniano G. is from the village of Bonifacio in Misamis Occidental. He is 51 years old. Aproniano is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Aproniano plants, harvests, and sells rice. Aproniano has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Aproniano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aproniano has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Aproniano is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that he will use to repair a vehicle that he uses for his business. This will be Aproniano's sixth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou S., 52, is a widow with three children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with her children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of fruit, fried potatoes and other food types for her existing and new customers, earning  an income of approximately US$5 per day as a primary source of income for her family. The family also is assisted by three of her children, who are currently employed as teachers at the local schools. They are able to earn a reasonable income to make a living and to help cover their mother’s household expenses. 

The members of S.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase groceries to stock her store. By doing so, S. hopes that her business will go well so that she is able to generate extra income for future household use.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann H. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and four of her children in the Siem Reap province. She is a good house wife who stays at home looks after her children and cooks for the family. Her husband, pictured here, has a business as a moto-taxi driver. He typically makes about US$8 a day. Three of the children are in school and one is at home. Vann H. would like to take out a loan of US$300 as her husband needs to repair his broken moto.

loans.use: To repair a broken moto-taxi

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah E. is from the village of Malaubang Ozamiz City. She is 27 years old. Dinah is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Dinah owns & operates a business selling barbecue products in the local community. Dinah has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,750 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Dinah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dinah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Dinah is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Dinah from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to pay for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen sells Nigerian cooked foods to make a living in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is 49 years old and is married with 7 children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. She is a LAPO client. The Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She is a hardworking woman. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Maria Lino

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Lino R. se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, vende huevos, manteca, aceite, sal, arroz, azucar, cafe, pan, galletas, margarina, condimentos, harina de maiz y trigo, salsas. 
su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Nacaome.
tiene 5 años de tener su negocio.
sus clientes la prefieren ya que Maria es muy atenta con ellos, tiene un buen caracter, es my amable, por eso es que muchas personas compran en su negocio.
Maria necesita el credito para comprar mercaderia ya que en estos momentos no tiene surtido el negocio.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
su meta es poder graduar a sus hijos para que sean unos buenos profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Lino R. sells groceries such as eggs, butter, oil, salt, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, margarine, spices, corn and wheat flour, and sauces. Her business is located in the municipal market of the town of Nacaome. She’s had this business for five years. Many customers choose Maria’s store to do their shopping in as she provides good service, is good-natured and friendly. She needs a loan so she can buy more merchandise as at the moment the store has no stock. It is her only source of income. Her goal is to have her children complete their education so they can get good jobs and do well in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Rodolfo Antonio tiene 29 años, este Joven es muy luchador y además disfruta mucho de su trabajo. La actividad económica de Rodolfo es ofrecer el servicio de triciclo. Hace 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que no es el primer trabajo que ha tenido Rodolfo ha tenido que trabajar en muchas cosas porque tiene 2 hijos que mantener, por lo que anteriormente vendía ropa y plátanos, en la semana recorría muchos mercados ofreciendo la ropa, y los fines de semana vendía plátanos ya que tenía que buscar el medio de vida para su familia mas tarde de los ahorros que obtiene decide comprarse una bicicleta y ofrecer el servicio de triciclo. El solicita este financiamiento para proporcionarle mantenimiento a su triciclo. El sueña con obtener otro triciclo y así alquilarlo.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 29 years old. This young man is a fighter and he enjoys his work very much. Rodolfo offers his services on a tricycle as his economic activity. He has been doing this business for three years. This isn’t Rodolfo’s first job. He has had to work at many jobs as he has two children to support. Before this job he sold clothes and plátanos (a type of banana). During the week he walked through many markets offering clothes for sale. On the weekends he sold plátanos. He had to look for a way to support his family. Later, with his savings, he bought a bicycle in order to offer the services of a tricycle. He is asking for this loan in order to maintain the tricycle. His dream is to have another tricycle and rent it.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios V. is a typical mother who dreams of her children having a better life someday - a life that is not like what they have right now, which is very poor. She wants her children to experience happiness which she did not experience when she was young because her parents were poor and making friends and socializing was never in the list of her choices. 

Since 1996, when Remedios became a member of ASHI, she found her strength and courage to face the challenges brought about by poverty. Loans she requested and received were used for a fishing business in partnership with her husband. Eventually it went well and her proceeds were used to finance the education of her three children, whereby the 28 year old eldest child is now a teacher and the other two are in college. However, Remedios wants to buy their own motor fishing boat instead of buying fish from others in their village. Even though this activity will be pursued, Remedios wants it to grow, therefore, she is requesting a much larger amount of loan through the ASHI and KIVA partnership. This loan is very significant for her because the graduation of her two children from college relies on her business profit.

loans.use: To finance a fishing business.

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Yeng L., 39, is married and lives with her children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She sells traditional baskets, earning an income of US$4.30 per day. Her husband operates a business as a construction foreman, earning a gross income of US$20 per day. By doing so, he is able to cover his family expenses, particularly his children’s education. He has been doing this job since 2002. L. is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase more baskets for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more baskets for resale

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: To make a living, Alma G. runs a sari-sari (variety retail store) selling food and daily use products in her community. She is 38 years old, widowed and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Cabu-an, Guinsiliban, Camiguin province. Alma has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Alma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Tomas Manuel

texts.es:
Este cliente es agricultor de la zona de potosí es una zona alejada de la ciudad por lo que la electricidad no llega hasta esa área 
 Por tal razón esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de un equipo solar y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida es un hombre soltero padre de dos hijos
texts.en:
This client is a farmer in the zone of Potosi, which is far from the city and therefore, electricity does not reach the area. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase solar panels to improve his quality of life. He is a single man and the father of two children.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase solar panels

loans.name: Braulia

texts.es:
La socia Braulia; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos de 28, 26, 16, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista Nuestra socia vende chicha diario en su casa por las tardes, a parte ella tiene un auto que lo alquila y le pagan a diario por el alquiler de todo un día de su auto para que lo trabajen como taxi; la socia también vende caldo de gallina en la tablada los domingos, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gallinas.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
La socia Braulia; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco. Braulia, 46, is a member of the “LAS AMISTOSAS” (The Friendly Ones) communal bank. She is from Urcos, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department, which is an hour away from the city of Cusco. She is a widow and has three children who are 28, 26 and 16 years of age. She combines her household chores with retail commerce. She sells chicha (alcoholic drink made from fermented maize) from home every afternoon. In addition, she has a car that she leases out for taxi service for a daily rental fee. Also, she sells chicken soup in La Tablada on Sundays. She is asking for funding to buy chickens. She is grateful for and values the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old and has two children. To make a living, Nemia owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nemia has been engaged in her business for over five years already.

Nemia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nemia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Nemia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Canape

texts.en:
S. Canape is from the village of Santa Isabel, Dipolog City. He is 49 years old. S. is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, S. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store, and at the same time operates a copra (dried coconut meat) buyer business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from trading copra in the local community. S. has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, S. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. S. is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by S. from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom T. is a villager in Phngeas village in Takeo province and she is 29 years old. She owns a general store at her home where she can earn some money from selling groceries to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sroeurn Hem, is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family.

Now she has a problem because her husband’s field is far away from any irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Mom T. is applying for a loan to dig a well and with the rest of the loan she will buy fertilizer, gasoline, and a motor.

She is a mother of two children who all attend the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To dig a well.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en:
Emiliano O. is from the village of Anonang, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 47 years old and married with eight school-aged children. To make a living, Emiliano provides motorcycle services in the local community. Emiliano has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emiliano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emiliano has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. He is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will also be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the second loan taken out by Emiliano from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand service

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio A. M., tiene la edad de 22 años, está casado, y aún no tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de máquinas especiales para trabajos en madera. Desea comprar máquinas y herramientas para trabajar en madera. Cuenta con experiencia en el trabajo, sabe utilizar adecuadamente las herramientas y la maquinaria. El desea ser más eficiente en su trabajo, cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de actualizar su equipo de trabajo para desempeñarse de la mejor manera con su trabajo, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como trabajador.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio A. M. is 22 years old and married. He does not have any children yet. With this loan he wants to buy special machines and tools for wood working. He has experience in this line of work and he knows how to use these machines and tools. He has very good customers and he wants to be more efficient in his work. For this reason he sees the need to modernize his equipment so that he can do the best job possible and earn a better income for his household. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very grateful for the services that they offer him. He hopes that in the future he can give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and, to be able to continue growing as a person and a worker.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase machines and tools for wood working

loans.name: The Blessing Of God Family Group

texts.en:
Mardea B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called The Blessing Of God Family. Mardea is 35 years old, single and has two children, ages 7 to 12 years old. She was only able to attend School through 10th grade due to lack of financial support..

For 5 years, Mardea has been selling charcoal in Gaye Town Market, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 52,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She describes herself as an earnest woman.

Her dream is to grow her business, build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris M. is from the village of Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Iris is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Iris owns & operates a motor transport "habal-habal" services business. Iris has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Iris joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Iris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Iris is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair the existing engine. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Iris from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the existing engine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a member of Jobiswa group of Faulu Kenya.  He is 30 years old and has been selling clothes for two years.  Apart from selling clothes, he runs a cafeteria.  He has previously serviced a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya.  He is requesting another loan of 50,000 KES to buy clothes.  He hopes to build flats in the future.  Daniel is the father of one child.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth A. is from the village of San Isidro. She is 31 years old. Janeth is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Janeth sells personal products from AVON, MSE, Natasha and Board Walk in the local community. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Janeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Janeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 56 years old a shop keeper. She is married to K., a businessman. They have four children aged eight, 12, 16 and 18 years, respectively. Catherine has been operating a retail shop for the past 11 years. Her monthly income is KES 20,000.

Catherine plans to increase the stock for the business to buy one bag of sugar, two cartons of tea leaves, two dozen bars of soap, one bundle of salt and washing detergent. With the anticipated profits from her business, she intends to educate her children.
