Her hopes and dreams are to improve living standards for her family and also to have her children operate a business independently in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap and detergent in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Kalibala

texts.en: He goes by the name of Kalibala M., a 59 year old retail business man who exemplifies a refreshing sense of diligence in his everyday transactions. Getting into the retail business is not a decision he has ever lived to regret since he began 7 years ago. Kalibala has 5 children and operates in Kayunga Town. Kayunga is a growing lucrative business-friendly center that many people, especially those involved in retailing, are drawn to. M. says he is glad to bear a hand in this genre of business. His business generates him 200,000 shillings weekly. With this loan he wants to buy more general merchandise retail stock for resale.

loans.use: The purchase more general mechandise retail stock to resell.

loans.name: Jovelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jovelyn I. is from the village of Dammang West, Echague, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Jovelyn is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jovelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Edmarie

texts.en:
Edmarie D. is from the town of Surallah. Edmarie is married and has 3 children. She owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Edmarie aims to have a successful business. She hopes that, some day, she will have her own money for capital.

Edmarie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and to pay for farm expenses. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for farm expenses

loans.name: Narcisa Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Narcisa J. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la Ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como  Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos, su cultura y tradiciones hacen de esta una ciudad encantadora, tiene gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es amable y muy cordial.

Doña Narcisa es comerciante de ropa hace 15 años, actividad que la realiza ambulantemente y labora solo un día a la semana, vende todo tipo de ropa usada, el resto de su tiempo pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, también es profesional en la área de la belleza y labora solo los fines de semana en el gabinete de una amiga.
 
La Señora Narcisa tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos  de 21, 16, 13, y 6 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la Universidad, su segunda y tercera hija  estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo es propietario de un taller de mecánica, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Nuestra socia se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el  banco comunal y ha sido su cuñada quien le ha invitado a formar parte de este grupo. El dinero de su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de más ropa para la temporada navideña. Su meta es  tener su propio gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
Narcisa J. is a member of the community bank Mujeres Luchadoras.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known as Santa Ana of the Four Rivers.  Its culture and traditions make this a charming city.  It has a variety of cuisines, and the people are nice and friendly.

Narcisa has been a clothing saleswoman for 15 years.  She sells all types of used clothing on the street one day a week.  She spends the rest of her time at home caring for her children.  She is also a beauty professional and works on the weekends in her friend's shop.

Narcisa is 39 years old, married, and has four children, who are 21, 16, 13, and 6 years old.  Her oldest daughter studies at the university, her second and third daughters are in high school, and her youngest child attends a public school.  Her husband is the owner of a mechanic shop.  They don't own their own home, so they rent a home.

This is her fifth loan with her community bank.  Her sister-in-law invited her to form part of the group.  She plans to use the loan to purchase more clothing for the Christmas season.  

Her goal is to have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 30 years old, married and has three children who are between the ages of two and five years old.  Her husband is a bar owner.  Charlotte owns a business that sells foodstuffs, which she has been doing for four years.  

Charlotte plans to use her loan to buy more beans, potatoes, and bananas.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand and grow the business.  She also hopes to buy a house to be used for renting and as a new means of generating income.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy K. and her husband, Mr. Sok Men, both 41 years old, live in a suburb about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children - two sons and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, three have full-time employment and the youngest attends school.  

Mrs. Sophy K. has been operating a tailoring business at home for four years. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1000 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es: Nicanor, es un hombre admirable y trabajador de, 55 años; que junto a su esposa Natividad, cuidó con amor y esmero de sus 9 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 4 de ellos; en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Yanama Alto. Desde muy joven se dedico al negocio de sus padres, “la agricultura”, de eso pasó 30 años. En todo este tiempo logró obtener sus propios terrenos agrícolas, en donde siembra papa, arveja, olluco, zanahoria y flor de gladiolo; los que después de mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y trabajo, los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, pero en campaña agrícola, los comercializa en la capital del país. Pero como buen hombre del campo, Nicanor también se dedica a la ganadería, donde gracias a sus 8 vacas, todas las mañanas extrae leche y elabora queso. Él está feliz de vivir en el campo por ello está trabajando para mejorar sus cultivos. Pertenece al banco comunal  “Manantiales de Yanama”, y esté es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde es un presidente responsable y trabajador. Nicanor, sembró una hectárea de papa, el cual está creciendo sin mayores contratiempos, por ello está pensando invertir el crédito en la compra de abono orgánico, para mantener en buenas condiciones su sembrío.
texts.en:
Nicanor is an admirable and hard-working 55 year-old man who, together with his wife Natividad, cares for his 9 children (only 4 of whom still live with him) with great love and care.  He lives in his own home which is located in the village of Yanama Alto.

Since he was very young, Nicanor has been working in his parents' business of "farming".  He has been in this business for 30 years.  During this time, he has managed to acquire his own farmland where he grows potatoes, peas, 'olluco' (a native tuber), carrots and gladioli, to which he dedicates a lot of effort, commitment and hard work and then sells in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  During the farming season, however, he sells them in the country's capital city.

However, as a good country man, Nicanor also works in livestock farming.  Thanks to his 8 cows, every morning he milks his herd and makes cheese.  He is happy to live in the countryside.  For this reason, he is working hard to improve his crops.  Nicanor belongs to the "Manantiales de Yanama" (Yanama Springs) community bank and this is his seventh loan with MFP where he is a responsible and hard-working president of his community bank.  Nicanor sowed a hectare of potatoes which is growing without major setbacks.  He is planning to invest his loan money in buying organic manure, to keep his crops in good condition.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Emalinda

texts.en:
Emalinda is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  fish vending and a piggery business.  She lives in Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. 

Emalinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past ten loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emalinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $460, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, with which she intends to buy fresh fish to resell so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Emalinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking on the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad belongs to Samundri, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 20 years.
 
She is a 52-year-old widow who has had a very difficult life after her husband's death. She worked hard and suffered a lot of difficulties in raising her children and surviving financially. Due to poor financial conditions, she couldn’t educate her children.
 
Now all three of her sons operate a construction supplies business. They have shops in the market where they deal with their customers and fulfill their needs. They sell construction supplies to different construction companies as well. Now they are all in a position to contribute to their family financially.
 
Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her eldest son, who wants to buy cement, bricks, sand, etc., to fulfill orders of his customers and to make more profits.
 
He has been operating this business for the past six years and Shamshad is hopeful that after the loan investment, her son  will be able to improve his income, which will enable Shamshad to save some money every month for his marriage.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamshad.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Ihisa

texts.en: Ihisa is currently in a business of selling bed sheets. She is 19 years old and single. Ihisa borrowed a loan to stock more bed sheets to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Gladys Ramona

texts.es:
La sra. Gladys tiene 45 años, y está casada con el sr. Ciro Z. D. 44 años D. edad, tienen 2 hijos varones D. 13 años y 5 años respectivamente, y ambos van a la escuela cerca D. su casa.
La sra. hace 13 años que se dedica a elaborar trabajos D. cotillón, para cumpleaños infantiles, quince años y bodas, también realiza trabajos D. decoraciones para todo tipo D. acontecimientos,  ya sea empresariales o  familiares.
Su esposo tenía en su domicilio una despensa bien surtida, y que atendía personalmente, pero luego le salió un trabajo en el Ministerio D. Obras Públicas, y la sra. Gladys también se hizo cargo D. la misma por un buen tiempo pero luego decidió cerrarlo, ya que los trabajos D. Cotillón le llevaban mucho tiempo y quería atender bien  a sus clientes.
Según manifiesta cuenta con muy buena clientela y trabaja por recomendaciones D. sus propios clientes.
El crédito que solicita le serviría para comprar materiales D. mejor calidad, ya que teniendo un poco más D. capital encontraría variedad y mejor precio.
texts.en:
Gladys is 45 years old and she is married with Mr. Ciro Z. who is 44 years old. They have two boys, aged 13 and 5 respectively. They both go to school near their house. 

She has been making decorations for kids' parties, sweet sixteens, and weddings. She also makes decorations for all types of occasions, whether for business or for families. 

Her husband had a well-stocked grocery store in their home that he used to manage personally but later he became employed with the Ministry of Public Works. Gladys managed the store for a time but she later decided to close the business because her decorations business enjoys a good client base and she becomes known through recommendations by her existing clients.

The loan that she requires is to purchase better quality materials. Having a better capital fund will help her add variety and she will be able to give betters prices.

loans.use: to purchase crafting materials to make decorations

loans.name: Maribel Del Rocio

texts.es:
Maribel de 33 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó su negocio en la venta de encebollados.

En la actualidad ella desde muy temprano labora en la preparación del encebollado para sus ventas aparte de eso realizar bisutería, en su trabajo de afecta son las épocas de lluvias por así sus ventas bajan. Con el préstamo desea comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos en un futuro desea poner su local para ponerse u  restaurant.
texts.en:
Maribel, 33, is a hard working woman who started her business selling stews.  She gets up very early to start preparing the stews to sell.  Aside from that, she also makes costume jewelry.  Her work is affected by the rainy season because sales drop then. 

She wants to use the loan to buy school supplies for her children and in the future she wants to set up a locale in which to install a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy her children's school supplies.

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa D., 46, is married and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a welder who specializes in making household products such as ovens, cups, spoons, forks, etc. Ariunaa manages a grocery business in her town. She started her business in 1996 as a mobile grocery business, meaning that she used to pick up orders from her customers and bring their orders to their home.

As her business became stable and profitable, she managed to open a grocery store in her town. Her two sons help with both of the family businesses. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery items and metals for their businesses.

Ariunaa and her family are very hardworking people who have become well-known for their honest and excellent services. She says, "I am very thankful to Xacbank for providing me a loan necessary to opening my grocery store."

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and metals

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao S. (pictured with her young daughter) and her husband, Mr. Sie Sun, live along National Road Number Six, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They just have a young daughter.  

Sreymao sells fish that her husband catches. Her husband is a fisherman. In addition, the couple also grows rice lotus. They hope to expand their farming business by growing watermelons, so Sreymao is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for growing water melon.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 32 años de edad, él vive con su esposa y 2 hijos en una comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. Miguel es conocido por ser un hombre de buenos modales, honrado y trabajador.

La actividad a la que se dedica Miguel, es la agricultura. Él cuenta con un terreno agrícola, que su madre le heredó, en el cual siembra dos tipos de mango, que actualmente se encuentran en producción. Miguel tiene 5 años de experiencia en la agricultura y ha sabido cosechar muy bien sus productos lo que le ha traído consigo una gran demanda.  

Adicionalmente, Miguel cuenta con una mototaxi (moto con cabina en la parte trasera para transportar pasajeros) con la cual brinda un servicio de transporte público y esto sumado a sus cosechas le ayuda a mantener su familia. 

Miguel solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y agroquímicos para su cultivo de Mango. Además, le servirá para la inducción de dicho cultivo con la finalidad de asegurar una buena floración y fructificación.

Miguel estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues tiene muchos deseos de darles a sus clientes una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Miguel is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a rural community of Tambogrande district - Piura.  He is known as a well-mannered, honest and hard-working man.

Miguel is a farmer.  He owns farmland, which he inherited from his mother, where he grows two types of mango that he currently has in production.  Miguel has five years experience in farming and he has known how to grow his products very well which has led to a great demand for his produce.

Miguel also owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with a cabin in back for transporting passengers) which he uses to provide a public transport service.  Combined with the money he makes from his crops, this helps him to support his family.

Miguel is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will invest in buying fertilizers and agrochemicals for his mango crop.  It will help him to ensure good flowering and fruiting.

Miguel is very grateful for this loan since he has a great desire to provide his customers with a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agrochemicals for growing mangos

loans.name: Amalia Gioconda

texts.es:
Amalia de 45 años,  vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral. Su esposo es maestro albañil y tienen tres hijos que estudian en escuela fiscales. Su actividad es costurera.

Su profesión siempre ha sido modista desde muy joven confeccionaba ropa a amigos y familiares entonce desde allí lo desempeña bien. Labora desde muy temprano y termina cuando haya concluido con el pedido que le hacen. Algunas veces tiene problema cuando no lo entrega a tiempo o cuando no tiene trabajo. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales como telas, hilos y varios cosas para confeccionar. Y así poder incrementar su negocio. Ella anhela tener su taller bien surtido y tener ropa para su respectiva ventas.
texts.en:
Amalia is 45 years old and lives in a semi urban area in Perimetral. Her husband is a master mason and they have three children who attend primary school. Amalia is a seamstress.
She has always been a seamstress and from a very young age she made clothing for friends and family and she did a good job. Amalia works very early in the morning and ends when she finishes the work order. Sometimes she has a problem when she doesn’t deliver the items on time or when she cannot find work. With the loan she wants to buy materials like fabrics, threads and various items to make her products this will help her increase her business. Amalia hopes to have her workshop well stocked and to have clothing for her sales.

loans.use: buy materials like fabrics, threads and various items.

loans.name: Javkhlan

texts.en:
Mr.Javkhlan is 24 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old daughter in his father’s apartment. His wife recently graduated from the university. He used to run an internet cafe in his own groundfloor apartment till May 2011. But he rented it to someone, and now he is planning to start another business. The new business he is planning to start is a food supply to a mining company in Dundgobi province. 

He already arranged the transportation. and now he is asking for a loan to buy more food products to deliver to the campsite. The loan he is taking will be used to buy food and groceries and to supply catering companies at the mining campsite in the countryside in order to improve his family's living conditions. In the future he dreams of opening his own construction panel factory.

loans.use: buy food and groceries and to supply catering companies at a mining campsite in the countryside.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua cooks banku which is made from corn (maize) at Abura. She is married and has four children.  Her partner is into farming. She helps her partner in educating their children. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better eating place for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize (corn) to cook to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 44 years old and lives in Kakata, a town to the north of Monrovia.  She is a widow.  She has 8 children, ranging in age between 18 and 23 years old, five of whom live at home and go to school.  She did not attend school herself.

She has a small business selling used clothes which she has run for 8 years.  Business is going well for her and she does not face any particular problems.  She started the business with money she had saved from her previous business which was making charcoal in the bush.

Martha will use the loan to purchase more stock for the business and use the profits to help with school fees.  In the future, she hopes to complete her children's’ education and buy some land and build houses for them.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the business

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Angelo is 44 years old and lives in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married, with 2 children.  Angelo works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 13 years. He requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more fish to sell.
Angelo has been a member of PMPC for over 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 38 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. Three of her children are currently in school.  

Justine has a small restaurant, which she has had for five years. She does farming as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for the restaurant. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Justine hopes to expand her business. 

Justine is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: to purchase food for the restaurant.

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en: Odbayar, 26 years old, lives with his wife and child in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. He was a taxi driver from 2009 to 2011 in his local town. Since the spring of 2011, he has transported people and goods from Hovd province to Bulgan province. He also brings goods and supplies from the west side of Mongolia and goes to the countryside to exchange these goods and supplies for animal raw materials with nomadic herders. He then sells the collected raw materials at the local market. Odbayar is a diligent man who says, "I want to fix and improve my truck. I also plan to buy a commercial space at the local market so that my wife can sell goods and products." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy spare parts to fix his truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his truck

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Doña Blanca tiene 55 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos, el hijo  mayor trabaja con ella, en su negocio de venta de comida, pues inicio con la venta de tortilla, lo que cambia para lograr mejores ventas y ingresos.
Como objetivo, ha sido la mejora a su casa, en donde ha venido trabajando por parte, devido a su condicion economica, ya que tiene que cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar por eso trabaja dia  a dia para obtener resultados positivos.
A traves de este financiamiento que Afodenic, esta haciendo, podra construir la parte frontal de su casa de concreto, ya que es de tabla y piedra, y mejorara esta condicion para el bienestar familiar. Comprando materiales de construccion y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Blanca is 55 years old and a single mother with two children. Her oldest son works with her in her food-selling business, which she started by selling tortillas, but which she has changed to realize greater sales and profits.
Her goal is to improve her house, where, due to her economic situation, she has been working partly, since she has to cover all her household costs. For this reason she works day to day to achieve positive results.
Through this loan from Afodenic, she will be able to build the front part of her house out of concrete, since it is currently made from wood and stone, and improve this condition for her family’s well-being. She will be buying materials and starting the work.

loans.use: to make the front part of her house out of concrete for her family's well-being.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 39, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a labourer on construction sites. 

Phuong supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business three years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yoghurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products (foods and beverages) to stock and sell.

loans.name: Shady

texts.en:
Shady is a 33-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. He has 13 years of experience working as a home painter. And in 2001, he started operating independently. 

In parallel, he has worked in a local company since 2000 in order to earn supplementary income. In Lebanon, It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. 

Today, Shady is applying for a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase a small car to facilitate his transportation to projects where he works. In the future, he looks forward to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase a small car to facilitate his transportation towards projects where he works.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel, 36, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a construction worker. She helps her husband earn an income by doing her own business at home while attending to their children.  

Raquel operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 that will help to her to have additional capital. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. The more materials, the better so she can produce more of her products. The loan will help her to have additional rolling capital.

Raquel hopes that her business will grow more, that all of them will have good health and her children will be able to finish their studies. She values the time spent in the weekly fellowship* as it strengthen her faith in God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread and other items needed in her business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan Carlos; el tiene 27 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad del cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de taxi.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos y llantas para su carro. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Señor de los Temblores-Poroy Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco, province and department of Cusco.

Juan Carlos, 27, is married and has two children.  He alternates his daily activities with his transportation business.  He has a car that he uses as a taxi service in various streets in the city of Cusco.  He works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m.  With this business Juan Carlos gets his children ahead.  He wants to increase and improve his taxi service.

Juan Carlos is requesting the loan to maintain his car, to buy parts and tires for his car.

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy parts and tires to maintain his car.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a 22-year-old single man from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Hisham has an auto repair and accessories shop. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 JD to purchase vehicle accessories.

Hisham is looking at building his own house.

loans.use: to purchase auto accessories

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es:
José Ignacio, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está soltero y vive con su  madre actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar materiales como papel, lapices, programas especiales de computo para diseñar y así realizar trabajos que tiene encargados para facilitar sus labores como diseñador grafico. El tiene como profesión realizar diseños gráficos, actualmente tiene unos encargos pendientes de entregar y le hacen falta los materiales mencionados para poder realizarlos por lo cual opto por el crédito. 

El tiene como meta prioritaria darle a su clientela el mayor y mejor resultado son sus trabajos dándole así una mejor calidad de los trabajos y mayor eficacia al hacerlos y a su vez generar más ganancias para su bienestar propio y de su mamá. 

Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Ignacio, age 22, is single and currently lives with his mother.  He is going to use the loan to purchase materials such as paper, pencils, and special design computer programs.  This well help him with his work as a graphic designer, as he currently has some pending assignments.  He lacks some materials for carrying these out, which is why he is applying for the loan.

His main goal is to give his clients the greatest and best results.  This leads them to give him better quality jobs.  Doing them with greater efficiency allows him to generate more earnings to improve his well-being, and that of his mother.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDESCOR.  He hasn’t had any previous loans from state owned banks, but FUDESCOR has offered a loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy materials for his graphic design business.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en: Consorcia is 62 years old and lives in Poblacion, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married, has nine children and earns a living by selling a variety of dried fish and vegetables. She has been in this business for three years and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,500 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for the last two years and hopes to earn enough money to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: C18520 Abungumugayo Group

texts.en: Beatrice is 41 years old and is married, with seven children between the ages of five and 14 years old. Beatrice is also the leader of this group, which is called "C18520 Abungumugayo" in the local language. Beatrice employs two people to help her and has two years of experience. She works from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m every day. Beatrice is the first person on the right in this picture. Beatrice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more goods, like beans, rice, soap, cooking oil, and so on, to sell. With this profit, Beatrice hopes to satisfy her customers and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like beans, rice, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El señor Anibal tiene 34 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Luque. Comenta que hace aproximadamente 8 años se dedica a la venta de agua mineral, anteriormente era empleado de una empresa, fue así que fue conociendo a muchas personas.
En un momento dado decidio independizarse, fue asì que hace aproximadamente 3 años recurrio a la Fundaciòn Paraguaya para obtener un crédito y de esa forma poder comprar bidones para el agua que vende. En la actualidad ya posee su propio vehículo y piensa seguir ampliando su clientela.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de más bidones para utilizar en su negocio, pues es un elemento muy importante para el. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad de crecimiento que esta le da.
texts.en: Mr. Anibal, 34, is single and lives in the city of Luque. He has worked selling purified water for eight years; he previously worked for a different company, and through his job he met many people. About three years ago he decided to strike out on his own and start his own business. He went to the Paraguay Foundation to obtain a loan, and he began buying the water jugs to use for his business. He is thankful for the opportunity to grow his business that this loan will give him.

loans.use: purchase water jugs for his company

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Tomasa tiene 43 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos, ella trabaja en un hotel donde realiza labores de limpieza, ordenar, lavandería, ella trabaja en tiempo completo ósea desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde de lunes a domingos. Ya son tres años que trabaja y le va muy bien. Tomasa también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Tomasa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y también para la educación de sus hijos. Su sueño de Tomasa es abrir una tienda de abarrotes. 

Tomasa es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Tomasa was born in Urubamba province and lives in the village of Rumichaca Baja.  This village is located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department, Peru.

Tomasa is 43 years old, married, and has five children from this beautiful relationship.  She works in a hotel, cleaning, tidying and doing laundry.  She works full time, from 8.00am to 5.00pm, from Monday to Sunday.  She has been working for three years and is doing very well.  Tomasa also raises animals such as hens and guinea pigs.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy more animals such as guinea pigs, and to pay for her children's education.  Tomasa's dream is to open a grocery store.

Tomasa is a member of the 'Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja' (Sunflowers of Rumichaca Baja) community bank.  This group has 19 members who live in the village of Rumichaca Baja.  This is where they carry out their business activities.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as guinea pigs, and to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Dina Argelia

texts.es: Dina, nuevamente está iniciando el proceso con otro préstamo que le ayude a comprar herramientas para su pequeña ferretería, martillos, desarmadores, clavos, sierras, entre otros que son necesarios para la construcción. Ella considera que la buena administración de estos préstamos le ha permitido mejorar la condición de su negocio y la condición de vida junto a Su familia.
texts.en: Dina is requesting another loan so that she can buy tools for her small hardware store such as hammers, screwdrivers, nails, saws, and other items that are needed in construction.  She believes that managing these loans well has helped her to improve the condition of her business and the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy hammers, screwdrivers, nails, saws, and other items used in construction.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 62 años, es un hombre muy amable y sencillo, esta casado con Sarela de 60 años con quien comparte su casa propia, él es padre de una hija quien ya es mayor e independiente y a quien educó y crió, ahora como esta solo con su esposa, está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de José consiste en al transporte de pasajeros y carga, todos los días sale a recorrer con su taxi las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa, en el cual constituye su forma de ganarse la vida. Su taxi por lo general para ocupado y es que su habilidad o suerte como lo llama él, para encontrar pasajeros, han hecho que su trabajo le genere los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por las calles de Pucallpa, lleva 25 años en esta actividad, los cuales le han servido para conocer su ciudad. Espera en el futuro comprar un taxi nuevo y ponerlo a trabajar en la misma empresa. Le esta yendo muy bien y espera seguir progresando. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, realizará la refacción de su vehículo, además de actualizar su documentación ya que están por vencer.
texts.en:
José, 62, is a very friendly and simple man. He is married to Sarela, 60, with whom he shares his own home. He is father to one daughter who is now an adult and independent and whom he raised and had educated. Now that he is alone with his wife he is willing to work very hard in order to improve his quality of life. José's work consists of transporting passengers and freight. Every day he goes out to travel the streets of the city of Pucallpa in his taxi, which constitutes his way of earning a living. His taxi is constantly in use, as his talent or luck as he calls it for finding passengers has caused his work to generate for him the necessary income for covering his expenses. What he enjoys most about his work is driving through the streets of Pucallpa. He has had this business for 25 years, during which time he has come to know the city. He hopes in the future to purchase a new taxi and put it to work in the same business. Things are going very well for him and he hopes to continue to make progress. 

This will be his fourth loan with MFP. He is very happy to know he has financial support, since he feels more confident of advancing in his work that way. Furthermore he commits once again to making his payments as he did with his previous loans. In addition he appreciates being part of his communal bank because all of the members are responsible and mutually supportive people. 

With the requested amount of 2,000 Peruvian soles, he will have repairs done to his vehicle as well as update his documentation since it is about to expire.

loans.use: to pay for services of a mechanic to fix his car as well as renewing his driver's license.

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du BENKADI IV sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Beleniko, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, FATOUMATA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  100.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Honronya  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Honronya 3 sont mariés dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Kondia dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage et d’avoir de la main d’œuvre, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver de l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du niébé.
Madame Bintou (femme au milieu parmi des femmes debouts) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs d’engrais et utiliser la main d’œuvre pour labourer et sarcler son champ de mil, de niébé et de gombo. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Ségou et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire  6 sacs de mil, 30 sacs de gombo, 1 sac de niébé et des fanes. 
En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production du mil, du gombo et de niébé sera vendue pour prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en produits de premières nécessités et le reste serait auto consommée en famille. 
Madame Bintou a pour objectif d’assurer les soins de santé de ses enfants et l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans son foyer.

loans.use: Achat d’engrais et utilisation de la main d’œuvre

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is a 29-year old vocational graduate and lives in Bago City. She is married to Abner, who works as a construction worker in Cebu City. They have 2 children aged 5 and 3. Their total monthly family income is only Php 4,500.00 ($102). Michelle also wants to provide for her family's basic needs and then save some money for her children's education. When she learned about the 2-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job, she took the opportunity and was competent enough to pass the selection process.  She needs financial assistance with her tuition, and your help will greatly impact her and her family's life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 49 years old. She is divorced and has no children. Juliana is very hardworking and supports her aged mother who is sick and bedridden. She is a second-hand clothes seller who lives in Ntankoful with her family. She has done this business for two years now.

She is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothing in order to pay off her mother's hospital bills as well as increase her income.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 34 years old mother of three children, actually Aida as all mothers she wants to provide a high quality life for her ‎children and she working hard to do that, therefore she wants to use her free time in something useful, so she decided to ‎be a productive woman and help her husband in the expenses of her children.‎
She started to sell blankets and bed`s covers, when she felt that she is working well and she gets good incomes from this ‎work, she decided to expand her work, therefore she applied for a loan to help develop her work and buy more kinds of ‎blankets and bed`s cover and to add covers for tables to sell and increase her incomes.‎

loans.use: to help him make a good promotion for his ‎business to attract more customers so increase his incomes

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar has been selling clothes and shoes for 9 years. Before opening his own business he taught tennis at a local academy where he used to practice with his friend in his free time.

While Cesar was happy with his job, as time passed he decided to leave the tennis academy so that he could dedicate his life to the teachings of Christ. He began preaching at a local penitentiary to the inmates and prison guards, and one day an inmate was admiring the pants he was wearing, and asked him to sell them to him. At this moment, Cesar realized that even inside the prison system there existed a market for the sale of merchandise. He began to bring goods-clothes, shoes, and accessories- with him when he visited the prison, and little by little he established his business. Cesar now visits the prison three days a week, on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays, from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. He is able to both preach, and make a living. In addition, he has two inmates who help him with his business on the weekends, when the demand is highest.

Cesar would like a loan so that he can invest in more merchandise as he has reached a point where the demand for his products outweighs what he is able to supply. He would also like to expand his business to another area of the prison system, but has not been able to yet due to a lack of capital.

Cesar is 40 years old, and has three children who are in school, and help him with the business in their spare time. He is married, and his wife is a nurse. Cesar owns a motorcycle, but would like to buy a car one day to help him transport his goods. He is confident in his business skills, and he knows that with the help of those around him he will continue to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Kreger, a Kiva Volunteer.

Cesar tiene una experiencia de 9 años en la venta de ropa y zapatos. Al comienzo el se inicio como profesor de tenis gracias a un amigo que lo llevo a practicar donde se gano la confianza del dueño y lo contrato para que comience a enseñar en su academia. Luego con el transcurrir del tiempo logra dar un giro a su vida y se convierte a Cristo, lo que lo lleva a predicar la palabra a la Penitenciaria del Litoral en donde están los presos del Ecuador. En ese lugar cierto día lleva un pantalón y un preso le dijo véndemelo a lo que el accedió viendo en ese momento que dentro de ese lugar había potencial de venta. Comenzó a llevar mercadería y al momento ya cuenta con su mercado de clientes, logrando hacer las dos actividades dentro de ese lugar el que lo visita los días miércoles, sábado y domingos desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. Inclusive tiene dos internos que le ayudan con el negocio los fines de semana ya que la demanda es buena.

Cesar desea el crédito para poder invertir en mercadería ya que al momento tiene bastante demanda y desea abrirse a otro sector dentro del Penal pero por falta de capital no lo hace.

Cesar tiene 40 años y tres hijos los cuales estudian y en sus días libres trabajan junto a el ayudándolo en el negocio, su esposa es enfermera particular. Actualmente el cuenta con la moto en la foto pero a futuro desearía comprarse un carro para poder trasladar la mercadería ya que en su moto no puede llevar mucho. El sabe con la ayuda de todos lo va ha lograr.

loans.use: Invest in clothing to sell in local penitentiaries

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Lizzy is 35 years old and married, with 4 children. She had a basic education but very determined to succeed. She operates a pub that dispenses both alcoholic and non alcoholic beverages. They include some of the popular brands in the country. After participating in the 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN, she is poised to take advantage of a KIVA loan to improve her business and better her lot and that of the family.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
My name is Ursula M. and I make a living sewing women's dresses, blouses and skirts. I've had my business for the past four years and I have a lot of clients since there are very few seamstresses in my neighborhood, and so, people look to me for their clothing needs. My goal is to be able to generate more income so that I can remodel my workspace (which is in my own home) and cover the costs of my home.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Ursula M. me dedico a la costura de trajes para dama, blusas, faldas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo muchos clientes ya que en mi vecindario no hay muchas costureras entonces la gente me busca a mi para que les haga sus ropas, mi meta es poder generar mas ganancias para poder remodelar mi lugar de trabajo (casa de habitacion) y cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar.

loans.use: purchasing cotton, oil, scissors, fabric, etc....

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Born in 1954, Mary T. is a widow with five children. Her desire to see all of her children educated was shattered when her husband died, leaving her to single-handedly provide for her family.  This motivated her to seek help.  She became a member of GHAPE, where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has taken out and repaid loans through her crop cultivation business.  This has also allowed her to raise money to pay for her children's school fees.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to sell spare motor parts (both secondhand and new) in the commercial zone of the town.  She plans to repay the loan in 24 months.  Her first repayment installment will be made four months from the date of the disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase spare motor parts

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel works washing clothing and has contracts with the embroiderers and exclusively washes folkloric clothing. She is separated from her husband and has one son. Her work is the only source of income in her home.

Her home is located in the zone called Llojeta, in the city of La Paz. This is the first time she has requested a loan from our institution. The money is to buy a clothes dryer. Her work makes her eligible for this loan. She has the experience in her business, and our analysis of her cash flow shows it is sufficient to cover this loan and her particular needs.

Mabel se dedica al lavado de ropa, ya que tiene contratos con los bordadores y exclusivamente lava la ropa folklórica. Tiene un hijo y esta separada de su esposo por lo que esta actividad es la única fuente de ingreso en su hogar. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Es primera vez que solicita un crédito con nuestra Institución. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de una secadora para que le pueda facilitar el secado de la ropa. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio y el flujo de caja analizado muestra ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades particulares.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: She will use this loan to purchase a clothing dryer for her laundry business.

loans.name: Fanny Dareli

texts.en:
Two years ago, when 31 year-old Fanny moved to Ayacucho, Perú to live with her husband, she decided to begin a small business. Her mother-in-law brought her to the village bank, and with her very first microloan, Fanny began a Nintendo arcade. She slowly accumulated televisions and gaming systems, and before she knew it, she was able to provide toys and a bed for her new baby son. As she is always looking for the best way to increase her business, Fanny recognized the need for internet in her community and decided to change gears and open an internet café. She sold her televisions and together with the profits, with the money she had been saving in the bank, and with her loans, she bought 7 computers and opened her new business. It continued to grow, and today, she and her husband run a beautiful and very busy internet café with 12 computers, a new television for playing movies, and a large display of candy for her patrons to snack on. All the neighborhood children pass in and out of her doors throughout the day, playing video games, meeting friends, and learning from the limitless resources the internet has to offer.

As a professional goal, Fanny and her husband hope to buy the property next door and expand the internet café to allow more computers and more customers. Fanny is incredibly grateful to her village bank for allowing the realization of her ambitious business goals. Without the loans and classes she has received for the past 2 years, she says she wouldn’t know how to save her money and none of what she has today would have been possible. Fanny is requesting a loan of $500, with which she will replace two out-of-date computers with newer, faster models.

loans.use: Replace two out-of-date computers with newer, faster models.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Mr. P. Samnang is single and living with his mother (shown in photo) on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. He is an only child. His father died many years ago. Samnang started doing farming in 1997. He grows tomatoes, corn, and papayas on his farm near the village. His mother also does farming with him. He did not finish primary school. He is requesting his first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. He will use this loan for expanding his farming business.

loans.use: For growing tomatoes, corn, and papayas

loans.name: Kigandazi E Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Betty is 37 years old and divorced with four children. Her current business is selling fish. Betty wants to buy a piece of land with the extra business profits. Damalie lays bricks for a living. Cathy has a canteen business and wants to use the loan to add to her stock. Annet sells charcoal and wants to expand her business while J. J. has a retail shop and intends to increase the stock of goods in it.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Rossi

texts.es:
Ms. M. and her two children, which she supports on her own since she is divorced from her husband, are living in a rented house located on the Pioneros street, in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. Her business involves selling condiments and spices, which she buys in bulk and repackages into smaller packages to sell in grocery stores. She applied for this loan to help her increase capital for her business. Her previous credit history makes her qualified for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martínez y sus dos hijos (a los cuales mantiene sola ya que se divorció del marido) viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la calle Pioneros de la zona de San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. La actividad que realiza es la venta de condimentos, ella compra por arrobas, los envasa en bolsitas pequeñas y los vende en las tiendas de abarrotes. Solicita crédito para aumento de capital. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To help build up her business - incremental capital.  (FOMENTO A SU NEGOCIO. INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL)

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 21 year-old Amina W., who is single with one child, aged 1. In 2007, Amina established a café business, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase ingredients such as rice, oil, and beans, in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as rice, oil, and beans, in bulk.

loans.name: Mercedes Mafalda

texts.es:
Señora Mercedes sells general merchandise out of her home and out in the streets. She has been with our bank institution for the past 4 years.

La señora se dedica a la venta de mercaderia en general negocio que lleva a cabo en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante trabaja con nuestra institucion desde hace cuatro años.

loans.use: To invest it in new inventory

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
Ayde is a member of the “Renacer” comunal bank.

Ayde lives with her husband, she is 25 years old, and has one child. Ayde has a small restaurant in a rented space located on the Alalmeda del Cementario boulevard. She sells drinks, food, and on Saturdays and Sundays she sells meals of regional dishes. She and her husband also have a motorcycle taxi, which her husband uses to transport passengers. With the loan money, Ayde plans to buy another motorcycle taxi to rent out.

Ayde needs a loan of 2000 soles, which would be invested as part of the payment for a motorcycle.

Ayde’s dreams are to have a pharmacy shop, to build her house, and to provide a good education to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hayde es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Ayde es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Ayde tiene un recreo bar en un local alquilado, ubicado en la alameda del cementerio, vende bebidas, comida y los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica. Además junto a su esposo tienen un mototaxi con el que trabaja su esposo haciendo transporte de pasajeros, Ayde con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar otro mototaxi para alquilar.

Ayde necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una mototaxi.

Los sueños de Ayde son tener una botica, construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a su hija.

loans.use: Ayde needs a loan of 2000 soles. The money will invested as part of the payment for a a new motorcylce, tidy.

loans.name: Suntali

texts.en:
Mrs. Suntali K. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Bhatkepati. She sells a variety of grocery items in her shop. Several years ago, her husband died.  Therefore, she is solely responsible for raising her four children. Her two sons and two daughters are studying in higher secondary school.  All of her children also help her with the shop. 
Mrs. Suntali K. is requesting for a Rs 15000.00 loan to buy grocery items such as rice and maize for her shop.
She uses her earnings to fulfill the daily needs of her family and support her childrens' education.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina has operated her small retail business at the busy Yubileinyi market in Zaporozhye for ten years. Zaporozhye is located in the south-east of Ukraine. She has learned a lot over the years she’s been in business. She has enjoyed the opportunity to work for herself and her income has been a big help to her. Presently, she has about $5000 in inventory.

Galina has requested a loan that will enable her to buy product in bulk to sell in her kiosk. The ability to purchase in large quantities can save a lot of time, effort and money for her as she can obtain better pricing from her suppliers and make fewer trips to buy inventory. Galina is grateful for the financial support she has received through “Nadiya Ukraine”. We look forward to seeing her business continue to be successful and provide for Galina’s needs.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Maimouna Badiane

texts.fr:
Maimouna Badiane M. is a trained hair stylist, single and with no children. She has been working in this trade for more than 4 years. She is requesting this loan with the intention of buying equipment for her beauty salon.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

maimouna badiane M. est une coiffeuse de profession , elle est célibataire sans enfants et exerce ce métier depuis plus de quatre ans .elle sollicite ce pret dans le but d'acheter du matériel pour son salon de coiffure.

loans.use:
purchase equipment for her beauty salon

coiffure

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Married with a child, Mavis T. is a 40-year-old trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidotes to minimizing poverty, and for that matter, she is very serious with her business. She trades in goods like eggs, maize, beans, peanuts, and yams. She has been trading for the past 10 years and has since been very resourceful to her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize, beans, peanuts, eggs, and yams to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She is a member of the trust group called "Adehye Mma," meaning royal children. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize, beans, peanuts, eggs, and yams

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.en:
Shahriniso T. is 38 years old. She is married and has four children. Shahriniso’s husband works in the Tajik Aluminium Factory, but his salary does not provide a steady income. For that reason, Shahriniso decided to start her own business selling clothes for children and shirts for men nine years ago. Little by little, she began to be noticed at the market. 

Currently, she has clients that seek her out to buy her merchandise. Still, Shahriniso does not currently have enough merchandise to offer her customers. For this reason, she asks for a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) to be repaid over a period of 6 months. With these funds, Shahriniso will be able to buy more shirts, thus increasing the range of her goods. With your support, she will be able to help her family get ahead financially.

loans.use: To buy new men's shirts to sell

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana runs a small jeans and clothing sales business in the central market of Simferopol. She launched his business four years ago and has opened two vending facilities since then. Presently, Tatyana has about 30,000 Grivnas invested in business. Her monthly net income is about 8,000 Grivnas. 

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 4000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal inventory and increase her sales. She is hoping to see long-term consistent development of her venture. Tatyana used to work as a salesperson and realized how efficient this trade was. She is happy to be self-employed today, to make a profit and to generate enough savings to afford to buy separate (single-family) housing some day.

loans.use: Increase her seasonal inventory

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet sells foodstuffs such as rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, and tomato paste. Violet travels to Togo and Cotonou to purchase foodstuffs to sell in Lagos state. She is 38 years old and married with 4 children.

Violet is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Eloy Julio

texts.es:
Eloy es chofer propietario de un taxi mismo que trabaja como trufi interciudad La Paz – El Alto. Esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su familia. Eloy vive en casa alquilada ubicada en  la Zona Alto San Pedro Ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará la reparación de su herramienta de trabajo (taxi) para poder continuar prestando servicio de transporte publico.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Eloy is a chauffeur and has his own taxi that he uses for transport between La Paz and El Alto. This is his principal source of income with which he covers the cost of living for his family. Eloy lives in a rented house located in the Alto San Pedro Zone in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used for repairing his taxi in order to be able to continue providing service as a public transport. This is his second loan with Impro, his good payment history allowed him to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his Taxi

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice I. is 40 years old, married with 8 children; she sells foodstuffs, provisions and drinks. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Presently she is requesting a loan in the amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions, and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino tiene 58 años, está casado hace 39 años, es padre de 6 hijos y actualmente viven en su casa propia. Se dedica a la siembra de plantas frutales, después de cada cosecha su esposa comercializa sus productos en los mercados más cercanos de su zona cada fin de semana. Cuando no se ocupa de sus cultivos realiza labores de carpintero en un pequeño espacio de su casa que se ha convertido en su taller de trabajo, Marcelino se siente muy feliz y complacido de realizar todo tipo de muebles, según el pedido de sus clientes, para ello es indispensable las herramientas que utilice, porque ellas le ahorran tiempo y esfuerzo. Desde hace 17 años que realiza este oficio y con toda la experiencia ganada ahora le pone mucha creatividad en el acabado de sus diferentes piezas, por lo que sus clientes se van muy satisfechos. Marcelino acaba de delegar su cargo de presidente en su banco comunal a otro miembro, en todo este tiempo demostró eficiencia y responsabilidad en su labor. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP pagando con puntualidad sus cuotas. Con una parte del dinero que solicita comprará de una máquina lijadora, y con el resto, fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Marcelino le tiene mucho aprecio a MFP, porque le ha posibilitado seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 58 years old, has been married for 39 years, and is the father of six children. At present the family lives in their own house. He cultivates fruit-bearing plants, and after each harvest his wife sells the produce at the nearby markets in their neighborhood each weekend. When he is not working on the cultivation, he works as a carpenter from a small space in their house that has been set up as his workshop. Marcelino is happy and pleased to build many types of custom-ordered furniture. The tools he uses in his work are indispensable because they save him time and effort. He has been involved in this business for the last 17 years and because of his experience, he is able to creatively finish the different pieces he makes, to the great satisfaction of his customers. Marcelino has recently delegated the role of president of the communal bank to another member. During his tenure he worked with efficiency and responsibility. This is the 5th loan with MFP and he has always made payments punctually. With some of the funds requested, he will buy a sander; with the remaining funds, fertilizer for the plants he cultivates. Marcelino is grateful to MFP because it has made it possible for him to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sander and fertilizer for plants.

loans.name: Samai

texts.en: Mrs. Samai C. was born in 1986 and lives in Ta Dork Pong village in Takeo province. Mrs. Samai C. is a widow with a child who is too young to work or study.  She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land she uses to cultivate rice.  Aside from this plantation, she is a tailor and a general seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more goods to sell to earn a larger income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Ana Mercedes tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el barrio la Francia numero dos ,  junto a sus hijos los cuales le apoyan con el trabajo agrícola después que ellos salen de clases , ella es una madre muy luchadora ya que le ha inculcado a sus pequeños la importancia del trabajo , los planes hacia un futuro es poder terminar de construir su vivienda , ella desde hace quince años trabaja en la agricultura y al comercio , ella inicio con sus propios esfuerzos para poder darle alimento y educación a sus dos hijos , el préstamos que ella solicita es para la comprar de insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo y tener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
38-year old Señora Ana Mercedes lives in the neighbourhood of La Francia 2 together with her children who help her with her work as a farmer when they get out of school each day. She is a very determined woman and has taught her young children the importance of hard work. Her future plans include finishing the building of her own home. For the last 15 years, she has worked in agriculture and business. Through her own efforts right from the beginning, she has managed to provide food and education for her children. The loan she is seeking is to buy fertilizer and other items to improve her fields, have a better harvest, and to sell her produce for a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other items to improve her fields

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice B. is 52 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven kids. She says two kids are out of school and working and the rest are currently in junior and senior high schools. She lives with her family in their own house at Oda, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. Eunice works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. She is a petty trader. She sells fresh eggs and salt on a tabletop in the community market. She buys her fresh eggs from the poultry farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. She also distributes the fresh eggs to breakfast operators in her town. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase fresh eggs in bulk so that she can cut down on costs, such as frequent trips to procure the goods, and maximize profit. 

She is a member of the community group called “Akwai Allah.” Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral so they can access the loan and then they support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs in bulk

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen sells wholesale oranges to her customers. She travels to Edo state to purchase her oranges and sells them in Lagos state. Queen is 44 years old, married, and has 5 children. Queen is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN120,000 ($825 US) to purchase more oranges to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more oranges to sell.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en: Tong V. is a 30-year-old, married woman and is the mother of two children: both are still minors and are under her care. She provides decorating services for wedding parties and other ceremonies. Most of her clients are people who live in and around the community. She is married to Vuthy, age 30, who is a truck driver for a small firm. Tong V. will use the loan money to buy a plot of land so she can rent it out to the crop farmers and earn a profit. The family lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell grocery items

loans.name: Fuerza En Cristo Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Mercedes del Carmen Sánchez, María Adilia L. R., Darling del Rosario L. P., Jessenia del Carmen Muñoz García y Juan José plarte R..

El grupo solidario Fuerza en Cristo del señor son originarios de la ciudad de Masaya en la comarca Valle de la Laguna, tienen varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim porque sienten que es una institución que ha confiado en ellos, expresan que se sienten como parte de la familia de Adim. 

Doña Mercedes del Carmen se dedica a la venta de verduras  en el mercado de masaya, ella tiene años de tener esta actividad ha sabido como es el giro de su negocio, expresa que ella ha visto como en cada préstamo le va quedando un mayor inventario en el negocio. 
Doña María Adilia L. R. vende ambientadores para todos los usos, vende ambulante en el mercado de Granada, tiene cinco hijos y le ayuda su esposo con los gastos del hogar, con el préstamo compra esencias para combinarlas y vender en líquido estos ambientadores.
Doña Darling del Rosario L. P. ella es una madre joven de 1 hijo pequeño en edad escolar . Su esposo es albañil y le ayuda con los gastos del niño.Ella elabora delantales y los vende en los diferentes mercados del país, los entrega en lugares fijos, todo lo que ha logrado le anima a seguir trabajando y quedando bien en Adim, esto se lo hace saber a su grupo y por eso se encarga de ir a dejar el abono para garantizar la puntualidad. Ella invierte en telas, encajes para adornar los delantales y está haciendo diseños nuevos.

Doña  Jessenia del Carmen Muñoz vende productos perecederos como frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya, ella invirtió el crédito en la compra de perecederos como lechugas y zanahorias, para ofrecer más productos a sus clientes, ella sueña tener comodidades en su vivienda y tener mayores ingresos. 

Don Juan José P. se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado de Masaya, él vende en un puesto fijo donde ofrece ropa para caballeros y damas, el préstamo lo usó para comprar pantalones de Jeans que tienen mucha demanda.

El grupo espera siempre tener el financiamiento de Adim para sus actividades económicas y asimismo ser puntuales en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Mercedes del Carmen Sánchez, María Adilia L. R., Darling del Rosario L. P., Jessenia del Carmen Muñoz García y Juan José plarte R.. The group Fuerza en Cristo are natives of the city of Masaya located in the Laguna Valley. They have worked with Adim for various cycles because they feel that it is an institution that has trusted them. They express that they feel part of the Adim family. Mercedes del Carmen is dedicated to selling produce in the Masaya market. She has done this for years and knows how her business runs. She says that she has seen how with each loan she gets more inventory for her business. María Adilia L. R. sells air fresheners for all uses. She sells on foot in the Granada market. She has five children and her husband helps her with the bills. With this loan, she'll buy essential oils to combine them and sell, in liquid, those air fresheners. Darling del Rosario L. P. is a young mother to one small child who is school age. Her husband is a bricklayer and he helps with the family expenses. She makes aprons and sells them in different markets in the country. She sells them in fixed places. Everything that she has achieved encourages her to keep working and remain in good standing with Adim.
