C’est une  malienne âgée de quarante-cinq (45) ans, mariée à un cultivateur , mère de huit(8) enfants, cinq(5) garçons et trois(3) filles, âgés de : 7 à 25 ans dont  cinq (5) scolarisés .Aissata  fait recourt au Réseau (R.M.C.R)  en sachant bien  qu’elle  peut avoir une somme importante  pour accroitre son activité d’élevage.
 Expérimenté dans le domaine d’élevage d’ovin depuis vingt-quatre (24) ans, elle a  un plaisir naturel et surtout le bénéfice qu’elle trouve dans cette activité qui lui motive d’avantage.
Elle prend le prêt pour augmenter le nombre de ses moutons, elle s’approvisionne dans le marché  de sa localité la plus proche, fait ses ventes   dans son  village ou aux marchés les plus proche. Elle peut avoir souvent un bénéfice  de 45 000 Francs CFA par bélier dans un cycle (huit (8) mois), mais souvent confrontée à des maladies ou des décès de moutons. 
Les bénéfices de ses activités lui permettront de prendre en charge certaines dépenses de sa famille : les frais de scolarisation de ses trois enfants, d’habillement, de santé et de condiment. 
Elle souhaite acheter des moutons pour ses enfants.

loans.use: Elévage de  moutons pour la vente.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Ms. Marie D. is a divorced woman who takes care of three children. As she is quite gifted in the identification and analysis of business opportunities, she has chosen to get into the business of selling fish and condiments, in which she is doing rather well. However, due to her very limited financial means, she is confronted with high demand that she is unable to meet. She currently needs a loan, which will allow her to increase the size of her business in order to increase her revenue. She is requesting a loan of $700, which will give her the capital to buy and resell fish and condiments. This new possibility will allow her to meet not only the needs of her customers but also those of her family. This will allow Ms. D. to live off the fruits of her labor and to better meet her immediate needs, notably the feeding, clothing, health and education of her children.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Marie est une femme divorcée avec trois (3) enfants à charge. Très douée dans l’identification et dans l’analyse des opportunités d’affaires, elle s’est choisie pour activité principale la vente de poissons et condiments qui lui réussit assez bien. Cependant, par ses moyens financiers très limités, elle est confrontée à beaucoup de demandes qu’elle est incapable de satisfaire. Elle a besoin aujourd’hui d’un appui financier qui lui servira à augmenter la taille de son activité en vue d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires. Elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui lui permettra de disposer d’un fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente du poisson et des condiments. Cette nouvelle possibilité lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement les besoins de sa clientèle mais aussi ceux de sa famille. Ceci permettra à Madame D. de vivre du fruit de son travail et de mieux subvenir à ses besoins immédiats, notamment: l’alimentation, la santé, l’habillement et l’éducation de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy and sell fish and condiments

loans.name: Juana Inés

texts.en:
Juana Inés is 48 years old. She is an enthusiastic, hardworking and responsible woman. She used to work as an employee in a business but she lost her job, and had to find a way to support her mother, who at her advanced age needs medical attention and medicines. That was when she decided to start her own business, selling groceries. This business allows her not only to earn the resources she needs to support the family, but also to spend more time with her mother. In 1995 she started her business in a vacant lot she reconditioned to serve as her store. Little by little she has continued to grow her business and with the help of an aunt she has been able to move it ahead.

Now Juana needs a loan of $750 to buy merchandise and make improvements to her store. She agrees to repay the loan in 5 to 10 months. She has confidence in people who help those who need it most, and she appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Juana Inés tiene 48 años de edad, es una mujer entusiasta, trabajadora y responsable, ella trabajaba como empleada en una empresa pero quedó desempleada y tenía a su cargo a su madre que es de edad avanzada y necesita de atención médica y medicinas. Entonces decidió iniciar su propio negocio y vender productos de abarrotes, este negocio le permitió, además de obtener los recursos necesarios para el sustento, pasar más tiempo al cuidado de su madre. En 1995 inició su negocio en un terreno baldío que fue acondicionando para poner su tienda. Poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio y con ayuda de su tía han podido salir adelante.

Ahora Juana necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 750 dólares que utilizará para impulsar su negocio con la compra de mercancía y mejorar el aspecto de su local, mismo que esta dispuesta a devolver en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses. Ella confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita y agradece tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.en:
My name is Ana B. and I make a living selling new clothes. I've had my business for the past three years. Because I am located near the bus station, in one of the busiest streets of my city, I have a lot of good customers. My goal is to increase my product stock and thus increase my sales. With my earnings I will feed my family and buy wood to fix my shop.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Ana B. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, estoy ubicada cerca de una estacion de buses en un lugar muy transitado de mi ciudad por lo tanto tengo muchos clientes muy buenos, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y comprar madera para arreglar mi negocio.

loans.use: purchasing new clothes for ladies, men and children

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Mrs. Miriam A. lives in a home she owns in the Llojeta Bajo neighborhood of La Paz. She is a widow and has four children, but only one child who is still a dependent.

She works mornings at a bakery owned by one of her sons; in the afternoons, she works as a hair stylist in her own beauty salon. On Saturday afternoons she teaches hairstyling at a beauty school in the city of El Alto.

This loan is to be used to finance her son's thesis coursework at Salesiana University. This is the first time she has requested a loan through IMPRO, and IMPRO's financial analysis indicates that she has sufficient income to repay this loan and cover her and her dependent child's living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Miriam A. vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Llojeta Bajo en la calle Valle Vergelito Nº 1146 de la ciudad de La Paz. La señora es viuda tiene cuatro hijos, pero bajo su dependencia se encuentra solo uno.

Trabaja en la mañana en la pastelería de su hijo y luego en la tarde se va al salón de belleza de su propiedad, ubicado en la calle Jaimes Freyre de la ciudad de La Paz, donde se dedica a los peinados (ella es peinadora), y los días sábados en la tarde dicta clases de peluquería en un instituto de belleza de la ciudad de el Alto.

El destino del crédito es para colaborar a uno de sus hijos en la elaboración de su tesis de la Universidad Salesiana. No tiene crédito con Impro, pues es la primera vez que acude a nuestra Institución. El análisis financiero indica que cuenta con suficientes ingresos como para pagar el crédito solicitado y cubrir sus necesidades particulares y las de su hijo que aun depende de ella.

loans.use: To finance her son's thesis coursework at the university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy laundry products such as detergent and bleach.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
We found Maruja very happily and eagerly cleaning her restaurant, which is the only source of income her and her husband, Cristóbal, count on to provide for their family. In this small but cosy restaurant they prepare the richest stews at the best prices in the area, thanks to their good seasoning and customer service. Maruja is pleased with the results, but her goal is to enlarge and refurbish her small rented site with the hope of providing more comfort and personal attention to their customers. With the increased income, they could also improve their own home and offer more comfort to their 9-year-old child. To carry out their plans in a short amount of time, they are requesting a loan and thank you for your generous heart and selfless support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Encontramos a doña Maruja, muy alegre y afanosa haciendo la limpieza de su restaurante, único ingreso económico con el que cuentan junto a su esposo, Cristóbal, para mantener a su familia; en este pequeño pero acogedor restaurante preparan los potajes más ricos y económicos de su zona, negocio que gracias a su buena sazón y trato que ofrece a sus clientes obtiene día a día asiduos comensales. Ella se siente contenta con los resultados que está obteniendo pero el deseo que tiene en mente es ampliar y refaccionar su pequeño local alquilado, con el fin de brindarles una mejor comodidad y atención a las personas que visitan día a día su pequeño espacio de ventas, así mismo con los beneficios que obtenga ofrecerle una morada cómoda y propia a su pequeño retoño de nueve años de edad.Para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo con el que gracias a tu generoso corazón y apoyo desinteresado podrá concretar en muy corto tiempo sus planes.

loans.use: Renovate and enlarge a small restaurant.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sreymom, 29, and her husband, Mao Sophal, have been married for 2 years. They have one 13-month-old daughter. Until recently, they lived with Sreymom's older brother and his family where they learned how to grow flowers. Now, they have a small, thatched home of their own and a neighbor has given them permission to farm his fallow land. Sophal also works as a construction mason, a skill he learned when only a teenager.

Sreymom is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. She will use this loan to purchase flower transplants from neighbors to add to the few from her brother. In total, they plan to grow four different varieties of flowers. A portion of the loan will also be used to purchase fertilizer. From the time of planting, it will be 2-3 months before Sreymom can begin picking the flowers. Some, she will bring to Phnom Penh to sell direct; others will be sold to a local buyer that visits the area. As the rotation of flowers will grow year-round; this will provide them with a steady income and financial independence.

loans.use: Buy flower transplants and fertilizer

loans.name: Kireku E Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Florence has a clothes selling business. With the extra business profits, Florence intends to buy a piece of land. Fatumah and Mastula sell charcoal. Rose runs a canteen while Safina offers catering services.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase stock and expand their businesses.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio R. is a 56-year-old married father of six children. His children are all grown and live and work on their own. In order to bring in sufficient income, he is the owner of two public buses that have routes throughout the surrounding cities. The company that he works for is Tapiracuay.

Dionisio has many dedicated clientele who use his buses. However Dionisio is still looking to expand his business and he hopes to have saved enough to soon buy another bus. The loan he is asking for will be used to fix the two buses he owns to give his clientele a more comfortable ride.

loans.use: To fix two buses

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza C. D. Aguilla runs a small shop where she sells candy in the district of Yarina Cocha, department Ucayali.  She also sells sodas, fruit, ice cream and juices.  Maritza has many loyal clients, most of whom are neighborhood children.  To promote her business and continue to grow, Maritza conducts raffles and lotteries and serves homemade chocolate milk to all her clients during Christmas.
	
Maritza is 34 years old, single, and has no children.  She is very driven and has big plans for her future.  She currently studies nursing at a local university.  She is also excited to expand her business and start selling medicinal plants. 
	
A member of the community bank Las Azucenas, Maritza is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 4 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for a sweets shop

loans.name: Maura's Group

texts.en:
Maura is the coordinator of a group of five women, all of whom are entrepreneurs which operate their own businesses in the Los R. community of San Cristobal. Maura is fifty-eight years old and a proud mother of seven grownup sons, each one living with his respective family. Maura explains that her husband passed away eight years ago and she was left alone to face all the responsibilities. She spent almost all her savings to start a small cafeteria. She explains that in the beginning, it was really difficult to run the cafeteria. She remembers that she had to face an arduous competition, and the access to capital was complicated.

Now, Maura’s cafeteria is relatively stable and she has a lot of customers that visit her everyday to enjoy her appetizing plates. Maura would like to leave the local stall (made of wood) within which she’s operating her cafeteria and build a concrete one in a few years. With her loan, Maura will buy raw materials and other goods to prepare her food and keep satisfying her clients.

The members of Maura’s group are: Santa Patricia S. C., a grocery store’s owner; Yenny Gabriela R. A., to invest in her store; Anicia S. C. will buy more goods for her clothing store; Fiordaliza S. G., to purchase women’s clothing to resell in her community.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and many other goods for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Taulaai

texts.en:
Taulaai F., 41, is married with 6 children. She has 4 years of experience selling taro and bananas to the general public in the main market 5 days per week. She will use the loan for her farm and will also purchase her children's sportswear for school. Her husband is her right hand in her business, supporting her and their children.

Taulaai has had a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to now be 250 Tala (about $US104). SPBD loans are Taulaai’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase more taro tops, a crowbar, wheelbarrow and pesticides

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a 33-year-old woman from the village of Banovići, which is near the town of the same name.  She is married with 2 children, and her husband works in a coal mine in the town of Banovići.  To help support her family, Alma works in agriculture and breeds cattle.  She earns her income primarily from selling milk and milk products.  This is her second loan with WWI. She has asked for 1200 KM to buy chickens to fatten, after which she can sell them for a profit.   Her wish is to help support her family by growing her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca K. produces ‘tie and dye’ fabric for sale. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Rebecca and her 1 child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Rebecca is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Julia Edilberta

texts.es:
Julia is 50 and lives with her husband Pedro and their six children, who are all adults now and working. Together, the family is trying to improve its standard of living. Julia owns two motorcycle trishaws that her sons maintain and operate to transport passengers. Furthermore, Julia sells clothes in various locations in her region from 6:00 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening. She has been conducting this activity for the past three years. She likes her work because she feels it is useful to society. With her loan, she wants to buy spare parts to maintain and repair one of her motorcycles, buy more garments to sell and then rent a location to set up her clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Julia, de 50 años vive a lado de su esposo Pedro y sus 6 hijos que ya son adultos y trabajan. Esta familia, en unión, busca mejorar su calidad de vida. Julia es propietaria de dos motocarros, son sus hijos los que las cuidan y manejan haciendo trasporte de pasajeros. Adicionalmente, Julia se dedica a la venta de ropa por los distintos lugares de su zona, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Ella lleva en esta actividad desde hace 3 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que le hace sentir útil a la sociedad. Con el dinero que solicita en préstamo, quiere comprar repuestos para el mantenimiento y arreglo de una de sus motos, comprar más prendas para su venta, y posteriormente alquilar un local para poner su tienda de ropa.

loans.use: Motorcycle repairs and purchase of wholesale merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Milenium Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal las “MILENIUM”, se fundo el 12 de Noviembre de 1998, actualmente se encuentra en el II ciclo 16 mujeres y 6 varones, es un banco comunal conformado por socias que viven en el distrito Calca en la calle Bolivar Nº 128 a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, las actividades económicas a las que se dedican son el comercio de productos agrícolas  y servicios venta de comidas dentro del mercado y artesanía. El banco comunal tiene 10 años de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio.
“El ahorro lo utilizo para que mi hija estudie en Cusco” “He mejoR. mi casa con el ahorro”,  "Mi hija puede estudiar ahora con luz electrica" son algunas expresiones de las socias que nos alienta a seguir trabajando bancos comunales. Calca esta ubicado en el Valle SagR. de los Incas, en la cuenca del rió Vilcanota, cuenta con un clima templado. Los días de feria local son los domingos, es cuando las socias realizan sus actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
The community bank "MILENIUM", was founded on November 12, 1998. Its members consist of 16 women and 6 men, who live in the Calca district on Bolivar Street No. 128. It is located 50 minutes from the city of Cusco, Peru. The economic activities of those engaged with this bank are trade in agricultural products and services involving the sale of food and crafts at markets. The community bank has been in operation for 10 years, and its members are happy and satisfied with its services of loans, savings and training it offers. The following are some quotes from members who encourage the use of community bank services: "I use the savings for my daughter to study in Cusco", "I've improved my house with the savings," "My daughter can now study using light from electricity." The Calca district is located in the Valle SagR. de los Incas (the sacred valley of the Incas), in the Vilcanota River basin, which has a temperate climate. The local fair days fall on Sundays, and this is when the members conduct their business activities.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members of this community bank typically use their loans in order to purchase more merchandise to grow their business. ( Las socias del banco comunal, destinan sus creditos para actividades de comercio, principalmente es capital de trabajo, para incrementar el stock de mercaderia, acopiar productos.)

loans.name: Mayernith

texts.es: Mayernith tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos estudiantes, su esposo Sixto, quien es trabajador independiente la apoya mucho, y ambos desean salir adelante y brindar a sus hijos lo necesario. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace varios años atrás y por su amabilidad y buena atención cuenta con gran cantidad de clientes, que siempre le mencionan y sugieren las cosas que faltan en su bodega, y ella trata de satisfacerlos, porque como ella nos dice “el cliente tiene la razón”. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de comida, solo lo hace para la hora del almuerzo. Mayernith quiere implementar su negocio, así como también modificar algunas partes de su vivienda, es por eso que requiere de un préstamo para realizar estos objetivos.
texts.en:
Mayernith is 38 years old and a mother of 3 school aged children. Her husband Sixto is an independent worker, supports her a lot and both desire to get ahead and provide their children with everything they need. She has worked selling groceries for several years and thanks to her friendliness and customer service she has a large number of customers that always suggest the products that her store lack. She tries to satisfy these request because, as she says, the customer is always right. She also works selling food, which she does at lunchtime. Mayernith wants to expand her business, as well as improve various parts of her house, and for this reason she needs a loan to fulfill these objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand the merchandise in her store

loans.name: Sy-Koutiala-00050 Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi de l’association Sodia ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’tonaso de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative du Mali)
Liées par des relations essentiellement de parenté, elles mènent différentes activités qui va de la fabrication du savon, de la teinture, la restauration à la vente des produits cosmétiques.
 C’est dans leurs recherches de ressources complémentaires qu’elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis cinq années. Après neuf prêts solidaires tous remboursés sans difficulté, les membres de ce groupe sont à leurs dixièmes prêts. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, cents kilogrammes d’ haricots, 20 litres d’huiles alimentaires et d’autres ingrédients (colorants, potasses etc.).au grand marché de Koutiala auprès des commerçants des domaines concernés.
Les articles vendus au marché, à la maison, dans les gargotes et de façon ambulante à une clientèle riche et variée. 
Elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 100 000FCFA. de bénéfice par cycle qui sera utilisé pour développer leurs activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Benkadi group of Sodia association have an average age of 40 and, on average, 4 children. They live in big extended traditional families in the village of N’tonaso in the prefecture of Koutiala (3rd administrative region of Mali).

United essentially by bonds of family, they have various businesses: from making soap to doing dyeing, to food service and selling cosmetics. It was in their search for additional financial resources that they decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 9 solidarity loans, all reimbursed without difficulty, the members of this group are on their 10th loan.

This loan will be used to buy 100 kg of beans, 20 liters of cooking oil, and other business items (dyes, potash, etc.) in the big market of Koutiala, from merchants who sell those goods.

Their merchandise is sold in the market, out of their homes, or door-to-door to a richly varied clientele. They are counting on making an average profit of 100,000 F CFA per loan cycle which will be used to expand their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items (cosmetics, food ingredients, raw materials for soap-making and dyeing)

loans.name: Benjamín Felix

texts.es: El Sr. Benjamin, es un hombre muy trabajador, que desde pequeño, demostró sus cualidades manuales, es así que aprendiendo de su madre aprende los oficios de la costura y el bordado, trabaja junto a su esposa quien le ayuda en la elaboración de ropa interior femenina en un pequeño taller ubicado en su casa, labor que realiza desde hace varios años de forma artesanal, y gracias a su trabajo mantiene a sus dos hijos, quienes tambien han demostrado habilidad para la costura y confección artesanal de ropa interior femenina, es así que toda la familia se dedica a la costura. Toda la familia trabaja muy duro con el sueño de hacer ampliar su pequeña casa para así tener un taller más amplio y vivir más comodamente.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a hard working man. Since a young age, he has demonstrated a talent for manual skills and was able to learn sewing and embroidering from his mother. He works with his wife, whom he helps making women’s interior garments in a small workshop in their house. He has been doing this work for many years and is thus able to support his two children, whom also have a talent for making women’s interior garments. Therefore, the entire family is dedicated to sewing. The family works very hard with the hope of expanding their small house to have a larger workshop and to live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Flor Magaly

texts.es:
Flor Sánchez C. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito II” de la provincia de Huaraz.

Flor tiene 23 años y es madre soltera de una niña, la dificultad mas grande para ella ha sido tener que enfrentar la separación de su conviviente hace tres años ella afirma “ser padre y madre para mi hija” es un reto muy grande, ella en la actualidad no tiene un negocio estable debido a que cuando su hija ingresó al jardín le ha dificultado realizar la actividad que siempre ha realizado el de vender comida y brindar alimentación a los trabajadores de la zona de Tacllán que trabajan en la extracción de arena y agregados de construcción, ella espera mejorar y reintegrarse al trabajo pronto porque su hija saldrá de vacaciones.
  
Con este préstamo de s/.1700.00, que pagará en seis cuotas lo destinará en el arreglo de su casa para el enlucido con yeso de las paredes y techo de su casa y tener mejores condiciones de vida debido a que actualmente es totalmente de adobes y tierra.
 
A flor le gustaría aprender otras alternativas de negocio y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Flor Sánchez C. is part of the communal bank “Niño Manuelito II” in the province of Huaraz.

Flor is 23 years old and is the single mother of one little girl. Her greatest difficulty has been dealing with the separation from her partner three years ago. She states that "being the father and mother for my daughter" is a difficult challenge. She does not currently have a stable business since, when her daughter entered kindergarten, it became difficult for her to carry out her former job of selling food and bringing it to the workers in the Tacllán region who extract sand and other construction aggregates. She hopes it will get better and she can get back into her work soon because her daughter will be out for vacations.

With this loan for $575, which she will repay in six payments, she will make repairs to her home to replaster the walls and roof of her home and improve their living conditions, since the house is currently made of adobe and earth.

Flor would like to learn other ways of doing business and to continue working.


Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs on the front, walls, and roof of her house.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo A. est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de bassines et ustensiles de cuisines au grand marché de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. elle espère avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son commerce en approvisionnant sa boutique afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Adzo A. is 43 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is a reseller of plastic bowls and kitchen utensils at the large Lomé market, in Togo's capital. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business's capacity by stocking up her shop in order to better meet her customers' demand.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic bowl and kitchen utensils for resale

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Mr. Aurelio M. is 50 years old and he is married with two children. He is the owner of a small store, Despensa San Antonio, and he has cows that produce milk that he also sells in his store. Mr. M. also makes and sells cheese.

Mr. M. has run the store for more than 25 years; sales are usually good because the store is located in the downtown area of the city of Piribebuy, where one can find a good crowd of people every day of the week.

Thanks to the loan he will receive from Fundación Paraguaya, Mr. Megarejo will keep his store well-stocked and he will be able to buy more merchandise of all sorts, especially products that are sold on a daily basis: meat, sugar, oil, eggs, noodles, etc.

Mr. M. states that he needs to buy a three-door freezer to keep drinks cold because on the weekends his drink sales are very strong. In the hot summer months, cold drinks are the products that sell most, along with chicken and beef.

loans.use: purchase of goods such as meat, milk, eggs, sugar, flour, sodas, beer, rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: M. kossi est un homme marié qui habite le quartier d’agbalépédogan, il a 03 enfants et sa femme est une revendeuse. Il a ouvert une boutique qu’il a appelé Ets M. Kossi dans laquelle il fait le commerce de pièces détachées. Il fait ce commerce depuis 2002 et c’est avec cette activité qu’il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Actuellement  il ne dispose pas de certaines pièces que ses clients demandent, il demande alors un crédit pour pouvoir acheter des pièces détachées.
texts.en:
M. Kossi is a married man who lives in the Agbalépédogan neighborhood. He has three children, and his wife is a reseller. In 2002, he opened a store called "Ets M. Kossi" where he sells spare parts. Since then, he has been running this business, which enables him to provide for his family. At this time, he's lacking some spare parts that his clients are looking for. He's therefore seeking a loan in order to be able to purchase these spare parts.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell spare parts

loans.name: La Inca Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Inca está conformado por tres señoras, todas ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, originarias de la comarca del mismo nombre del grupo, ubicada en el departamento de Masaya, sus condiciones de vida son humildes, trabajan con Adim porque les gusta que confíen en ellas, expresaron..
Son vecinas, de confianza, se conocen hace muchos años y son muy unidas. Doña Darling vende productos lácteos, doña Susana M. vende ropa ambulante y Doña Darling G. vende ropa y cosméticos ambulante.

Doña Darling E. G. es una joven de 28 años, casada, madre de tres hijos de las edades  5, 3 y un bebé de 2 meses. Doña Darling se dedica a la compra y venta de productos lácteos como : crema, queso, cuajadas, leche, etc., los cuales las va ha vender en el mercado de Masaya. Ella sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casita, puesto que actualmente vive con su suegra, hacer que crezca su negocio, y darle una buena educación a sus hijos.

Este grupo está comprometido a pagar puntual y así seguir obteniendo créditos con Adim, están seguras que con el crédito saldrán adelante porque incrementan sus ventas y así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Inca is made up of three women, all hard working women from the area of the same name as the group, located in the Masaya region. Their living conditions are humble. They all say they work with Adim because they trust the organization. These women are neighbors who trust each other. They have known each other for many years and are very close. Mrs. Darling E. sells dairy products, Mrs. Susana M. sells clothing in the streets and Mrs. Darling G. sells clothing and cosmetics, also in the streets. Mrs. Darling E. G. is 28 years old, married and the mother of 3 children, ages, 5, 3 and a 2 month old baby. Darling works buying and sellling dairy products such as cream, cheese, cuajada (a dessert made of curdled milk), milk, etc. She goes to the Masaya market to sell her products. She dreams of buying a plot of land where she can build a house. She currently lives with her mother in law. She also dreams of growing her business and giving her children a good education. This group is committed to pay punctually in order to continue receiving loans from Adim, They are confident that with this loan they wil move ahead by increasing their sales and as a result, their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria G. is 45 years old. She is married and has five kids. All the kids are currently in school. She lives with her family in their own house at Oda, a farming community in the eastern Ghana. Victoria works hard to support her kids’ welfare and schooling. She sells foodstuffs and vegetables. She sells maize, beans, yams, tomatoes, onions, eggplant, etc., at a stand in the community market. She buys her goods from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for five years. She also distributes the maize and beans to local food vendors. She wants a loan to buy foodstuffs in bulk so that she can make fewer trips to procure the goods and in this way maximize profit.

She is a member of the community group called “Yehowa Mma” (Jehovah's children). Members of this group guarantee each other's loans and support one another in handling repayment of the loans.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en:
Bosede is 60 years old. She is a widow with eight children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions.

She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 so that she can purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchsae more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 59 years old and sells generic medicines in her village. She has been a widow for about 18 years. Her husband passed when her youngest child was merely four years old. She has six children and is glad that some of them have their own good jobs that support their own families. Her youngest is now 22 years old and still lives with her. Josefina’s grandchildren inspire her every time she sees them and that keeps her working hard to expand her business.  

Josefina sells generic medicines in different villages near her place to generate a daily income to support her children's and grandchildren’s need. She is very proud that even though she is already a widow it has not been a hindrance for her to pursue working and provide financial support to her children. Josefina is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 which will be used as her additional working capital in expanding her current business.

loans.use: Business Capital
